original: gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon can no //
analyzed: gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi sa bon can no //
translated: The alaya consciousness is the seed of all afflicted phenomena.

original: yang rgyu mtshan smos pa ni de'i @162b sa bon de dag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang rgyu mtshan smos pa ni de'i @162b sa bon de dag gi dmigs pa'i rgyu mtshan bstan pa'i don to //
translated: The mention of “sign” is for the purpose of teaching the objective sign of those seeds.

original: de ltar byas nas sa bon de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas par spangs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar byas nas sa bon de dag rgyu dang 'bras bu dang bcas par spangs pa bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, those seeds are taught to be abandoned together with their causes and results.

original: de'i rjes las thob pa la dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pa la dgos pa ci yod /
translated: What is the purpose of post equipoise?

original: gal te rnam par mi rtog pas sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kun tu bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par mi rtog pas sgrib pa thams cad spangs pa dang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kun tu bsgrub par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, “Is it that all obscurations are abandoned and all the qualities of a buddha are accomplished through nonconceptuality?”

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rnams des bstan par mi nus te /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i 'bras bu'i chos rnams des bstan par mi nus te /
translated: The phenomena of cause and result are not able to be taught by that.

original: de ni mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because it is nonconceptual.

original: de'i phyir rjes la thob pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos rnams ston par byed de /
analyzed: de'i phyir rjes la thob pas rgyu dang 'bras bu'i chos rnams ston par byed de /
translated: Therefore post equipoise teaches the phenomena of cause and result.

original: rten pa yin pa dang / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma byas pa bzhin du phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten pa yin pa dang / sgyu ma mkhan gyis sgyu ma byas pa bzhin du phyin ci ma log par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the basis, and because it is nonerroneous, like the creation of an illusion by a magician.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las thams cad rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa las thams cad rab tu skye ba zhes bya ba ni gang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i rgyu las byung ba rnams so //
translated: “Everything arises from the storehouse consciousness” means that everything arises from the cause of the storehouse consciousness.

original: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma thams cad de /
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i mtshan ma thams cad de /
translated: All representations of cognition

original: rnam par rig pa'i rgyur gyur ba las sgyu ma byas pa bzhin du rjes las thob pa'i phyin ci log med par 'byung bas yang dus thams cad du ston par byed do //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa'i rgyur gyur ba las sgyu ma byas pa bzhin du rjes las thob pa'i phyin ci log med par 'byung bas yang dus thams cad du ston par byed do //
translated: arise from the cause of cognition, like the creation of an illusion. Because they arise without error after the storehouse consciousness, they are always manifested.

original: thams cad du de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las yin pas de'i phyir 'dir yang de bstan par bya ba'o //
analyzed: thams cad du de kho na nyid la 'jug pa ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa las yin pas de'i phyir 'dir yang de bstan par bya ba'o //
translated: Because the entry into reality is from the aids to penetration, therefore, here, that is taught.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la yang dag par brten pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la yang dag par brten pa zhes bya ba ni nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa la brten pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Based on the aids to penetration” means “based on the aids to penetration.”

original: mngon par rtogs pa dang nye ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pa dang nye ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par rtogs pa'i dus su zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: “Near to realization” means “at the time of realization.”

original: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang sgyu ji ltar rnam par gnas pa sa bcu par sa'i rnam par gnas pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par gnas pa bstan pa zhes bya ba ni gang sgyu ji ltar rnam par gnas pa sa bcu par sa'i rnam par gnas pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “As it is taught” means “as it is taught in the Ten Stages.”

original: 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pas dmigs pa'i gnas la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dres pa la dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni mkhas pas dmigs pa'i gnas la dmigs pa'o //
translated: “Observing the mixed” means “observing the object of the wise.”

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: “Transcendent” means “non-discriminative.”

original: de'i rjes la thob pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pa zhes bya ba ni rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: “Subsequent to that” means “subsequent to that non-discriminative wisdom.”

original: de ni 'jig rten pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: That is called “mundane,”

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because it is in conformity with the mundane.

original: ; gang gi phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa 'ba' zhig ni 'jig rten pa la reg pa ma yin pas so //
analyzed: ; gang gi phyir 'jig rten las 'das pa 'ba' zhig ni 'jig rten pa la reg pa ma yin pas so //
translated: Because only the supramundane does not touch the mundane.

original: de bas na gcig tu zhugs par mi brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na gcig tu zhugs par mi brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is not said to be engaged in one.

original: de gnas gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi bye brag gnas gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de gnas gyur nas zhes bya ba ni 'dres pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyi bye brag gnas gyur pa'o //
translated: Having transformed that, means having transformed the transformation of the knowledge that takes the mixed as its object.

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par zhes bya ba ni @163a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par zhes bya ba ni @163a * //
translated: Having attained the three Buddha bodies, means

original: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur ba zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sku rnam pa gsum thob par 'gyur ba zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: having attained the three Buddha bodies.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dzin par byed kyi nyan thos ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa 'dzin par byed kyi nyan thos ni ma yin no //
translated: The distinction of nirvana, means that in this way the bodhisattvas take up the nonabiding nirvana, but the sravakas do not.

original: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i khyad par ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: The distinction of purity, means

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnam bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba yin gyi nyan thos rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnam bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spong ba dang / sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong ba yin gyi nyan thos rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the bodhisattvas eliminate the afflictions together with their instincts, and they purify the buddhaverse, but the disciples do not.

original: ji ltar bur de kho na nyid la 'jug pa de tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: ji ltar bur de kho na nyid la 'jug pa de tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: How they enter reality is stated in the following verse.

original: ming dang dngos gnyis phan tshun du //🔽glo bur yin par yongs su btsal //
analyzed: ming dang dngos gnyis phan tshun du // glo bur yin par yongs su btsal //
translated: Name and thing are mutually

original: zhes bya ba la /🔽ming ni don la glo bur ba yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la / ming ni don la glo bur ba yin la /
translated: accidental.🔽Name is accidental to the thing,

original: don ni ming la glo bur ba ste /
analyzed: don ni ming la glo bur ba ste /
translated: and the thing is accidental to the name.

original: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: They are not identical with each other.

original: yongs su btsal zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pas blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su btsal zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pas blta bar bya'o //
translated: “Investigated” means “observed in meditative equipoise.”

original: btags pa rnam pa gsum po la //
analyzed: btags pa rnam pa gsum po la //
translated: The three kinds of designations

original: de tsam nyid du btsal bar bya //
analyzed: de tsam nyid du btsal bar bya //
translated: are to be investigated as mere conventionalities.

original: zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo dang khyad par ma yin pa btags pa'i don dang / btags pa'i khyad par de tsam pa nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽yang dag ji bzhin yongs su shes pas //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni don gyi ngo bo dang khyad par ma yin pa btags pa'i don dang / btags pa'i khyad par de tsam pa nyid du blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yang dag ji bzhin yongs su shes pas //
translated: This means that the object of designation and the specific object of designation should be regarded as mere designations.

original: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ste /
translated: The phrase “through thorough knowledge of reality as it is” means thorough knowledge of reality as it is.

original: 'di ltar gang gi phyir tshol ba rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i rgyu las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi phyir tshol ba rnam pa bzhi zhes bya ba'i rgyu las yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase “one will understand reality as it is” means that one will understand reality as it is through the four investigations.

original: don med par ni rtog pa gsum dang / mthong ba gsum pa la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don med par ni rtog pa gsum dang / mthong ba gsum pa la zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “three types of conceptual thought and three types of views that are groundless” means the following.

original: don med par brtags pa rnam pa gsum mthong ba ste /
analyzed: don med par brtags pa rnam pa gsum mthong ba ste /
translated: Three types of conceptual thought that are groundless are views.

original: ming du brtags pa dang / ngo bor brtags pa dang / khyad par du brtags pa'o //
analyzed: ming du brtags pa dang / ngo bor brtags pa dang / khyad par du brtags pa'o //
translated: They are conceptual thought about names, conceptual thought about natures, and conceptual thought about specific qualities.

original: don med pa ni don med pa nyid do //
analyzed: don med pa ni don med pa nyid do //
translated: Groundless means without a basis.

original: mthong ba gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni don med na rtogs pa yang med par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: mthong ba gsum pa la zhes bya ba ni don med na rtogs pa yang med par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The third seeing is that if the object does not exist, the cognition also does not exist.

original: gang gi phyir brtag par bya ba yod na de la dmigs pa yod de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtag par bya ba yod na de la dmigs pa yod de /
translated: Because if the object to be imagined exists, then the cognition that perceives it exists.

original: de'i phyir don med par gyur na rtogs par byed pa yang med par blta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir don med par gyur na rtogs par byed pa yang med par blta'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, if the object does not exist, the cognition that imagines it also does not exist. This is the meaning.

original: gsum la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: gsum la 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid gsum la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The entry into the three is the entry into the three realities.

original: de la ming dang don gnyis phan tshun glo bur ba nyid du mthong ba nyid du mthong bar gyur na kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la bzhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: de la ming dang don gnyis phan tshun glo bur ba nyid du mthong ba nyid du mthong bar gyur na kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid la bzhugs pa yin no //
translated: When one sees that the name and the object are adventitious to each other, one enters into the imagined reality.

original: ming gi ngo bo nyid brtags pa dang / khyad par du brtags pa tsam du mthong ba na gzhan gyi @163b dbang gi ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: ming gi ngo bo nyid brtags pa dang / khyad par du brtags pa tsam du mthong ba na gzhan gyi @163b dbang gi ngo bo nyid la zhugs pa yin no //
translated: When one sees that the name is merely imagined as an entity and as a distinction, one enters into the other-dependent reality.

original: brtags pa de nyid mthong ba na yongs su grub pa la zhugs pa yin te /
analyzed: brtags pa de nyid mthong ba na yongs su grub pa la zhugs pa yin te /
translated: When one sees that very imagination, one enters into the reality of the perfected.

original: de lta bu ni gsum la 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni gsum la 'jug pa yin no //
translated: This is the entry into the three.

original: gang gis de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i don gyi man ngag sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: gang gis de kho na nyid la 'jug pa'i don gyi man ngag sbyin par byed de /
translated: He is the one who gives the instruction for entering into reality.

original: de la don gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de la don gyi tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: The point is summarized in the verse:

original: gzugs brnyan yid du mthong ba ni //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzugs brnyan yid du mthong ba ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reflection is seen in the mind.

original: chos dang don du snang ba gang yin pa'i gzugs brnyan de yid yin no zhes mthong ba'o //
analyzed: chos dang don du snang ba gang yin pa'i gzugs brnyan de yid yin no zhes mthong ba'o //
translated: The reflection that is the appearance of the teaching and its meaning is seen in the mind.

original: gang gis mthong zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis mthong zhe na /
translated: By whom is it seen?

original: byang chub sems dpas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas so //
translated: By the bodhisattva.

original: gang gi dus na zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi dus na zhe na /
translated: When is it seen?

original: mnyam gzhag pas so //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag pas so //
translated: When he is in equipoise.

original: don gyi 'du shes bzlog nas su //
analyzed: don gyi 'du shes bzlog nas su //
translated: Having turned away from the perception of meaning,

original: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //
analyzed: rang gi 'du shes nges par gzung //
translated: he should grasp his own perception.

original: zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na don gyi 'du shes bor nas rang gi sems nyid chos dang don gyi rnam pa de yin par gzung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽de ltar nang du sems gnas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de'i dus na don gyi 'du shes bor nas rang gi sems nyid chos dang don gyi rnam pa de yin par gzung zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar nang du sems gnas so //
translated: At that time, having abandoned the perception of meaning, he should grasp his own mind as having the aspect of the teaching and its meaning.🔽In that way, the mind abides internally.

original: zhes bya ba na gang gi sems 'di ltar gnas par gyur ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba na gang gi sems 'di ltar gnas par gyur ba ste /
translated: The mind of the one who has become like that abides.

original: don ni med do //
analyzed: don ni med do //
translated: There is no meaning.

original: de lta na yang sems la sems gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽gzung ba med par rtogs par byos //
analyzed: de lta na yang sems la sems gnas par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gzung ba med par rtogs par byos //
translated: Still, the mind is in the mind, as the text says.

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Understand that there is no object.

original: gzung ba med par shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzung ba med par shes par gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Understand that there is no object, as the text says.

original: de phyir 'dzin pa med rtogs kyis //
analyzed: de phyir 'dzin pa med rtogs kyis //
translated: Therefore, understand that there is no subject.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzung bar bya ba'i don yod pa ma yin pas 'dzin par byed pa'i sems nyid kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir gzung bar bya ba'i don yod pa ma yin pas 'dzin par byed pa'i sems nyid kyang rigs pa ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Since there is no object, the existence of the mind as subject is also not reasonable.

original: des na dmigs pa med pa reg / ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: des na dmigs pa med pa reg / ces bya ba ni /
translated: Therefore, contact is without objective support.

original: de'i phyir na de las gzhan pa'i de bzhin nyid la reg par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na de las gzhan pa'i de bzhin nyid la reg par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, one touches reality which is other than that, as the text says.

original: de bzhin nyid ni dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni dmigs su med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because reality is not an objective support.

original: de la gzhan pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ji ltar mdo sde'i rgyan las bstan pa las gang de las rtogs par dka' ba de bstan par byas pa /
analyzed: de la gzhan pa mngon par rtogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ji ltar mdo sde'i rgyan las bstan pa las gang de las rtogs par dka' ba de bstan par byas pa /
translated: A verse on the realization of what is other than that🔽.

original: mtha' yas pha rol med ces bya ba ste /🔽pha rol ring pas ji ltar tshig la mtha' med ces bya ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: mtha' yas pha rol med ces bya ba ste / pha rol ring pas ji ltar tshig la mtha' med ces bya ba lta bu ste /
translated: The phrase “without a far shore” means🔽that it is not possible to say that there is a far shore, just as one cannot say that there is an end to space, because it is infinite.

original: de la mtha' med pa ma yin na yang mang po nyid la mtha' med ces bya ba'i brjod pa 'thob ste /
analyzed: de la mtha' med pa ma yin na yang mang po nyid la mtha' med ces bya ba'i brjod pa 'thob ste /
translated: Although it is not the case that there is no far shore, the expression “without a far shore” is used because of the immensity of the number of sentient beings.

original: 'di yang de dang 'dra'o ;
analyzed: 'di yang de dang 'dra'o ;
translated: The same is true of the ocean of the Tathāgata’s qualities.

original: / ci'i tshogs rnams she na /
analyzed: / ci'i tshogs rnams she na /
translated: What are the two collections?

original: bsod nams ye shes kyi'o //
analyzed: bsod nams ye shes kyi'o //
translated: They are the collection of merit and the collection of wisdom.

original: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa la sogs pa la pha rol tu phyin pa gsum ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Among the perfections, the first three are the collection of merit.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The perfection of wisdom is the collection of wisdom.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyi ga ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni gnyi ga ste /
translated: The perfection of effort is both,

original: de'i don gyi thabs kyi @164a * //
analyzed: de'i don gyi thabs kyi @164a * //
translated: because it is the means for accomplishing both.

original: brtson 'grus ni ye shes so //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni ye shes so //
translated: The effort that is the means for accomplishing wisdom is the collection of wisdom.

original: gang sems can gyi don gyi brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gang sems can gyi don gyi brtson 'grus ni bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: The effort that is the means for accomplishing the welfare of sentient beings is the collection of merit.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Similarly, the perfection of meditative absorption is twofold.

original: de la gang yang tshad med pa rnams la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsod nams so ;
analyzed: de la gang yang tshad med pa rnams la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan gyi bsod nams so ;
translated: The merit of the concentrations that have the immeasurables as their objects.

original: ; de las gzhan bdag ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: ; de las gzhan bdag ni ye shes kyi tshogs so //
translated: The other is the accumulation of knowledge.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //🔽chos la sems pa legs par rnam nges phyir //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' nyid do // chos la sems pa legs par rnam nges phyir //
translated: The state of a bodhisattva.

original: zhes bya ba ni //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni //
translated: Because of the thorough discernment of the investigation of things.

original: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes la chos rnams sems par byed pa de lags par rnam par nges pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang ting nge 'dzin gyi rjes la chos rnams sems par byed pa de lags par rnam par nges pa yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no //
translated: That is the thorough discernment of the investigation of things that is subsequent to concentration, but not of any other.

original: don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyus byung rtogs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyus byung rtogs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The knowledge that arises from the cause of the expression of the meaning of things.

original: don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'o //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa brjod pa'i rgyus zhes bya ba ni yongs su shes pa'o //
translated: The cause of the expression of the meaning of things is thorough knowledge.🔽One abides in just that mere mind that is like that.

original: de 'dra ba'i sems tsam nyid la gnas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ni 'di ltar don du snang ba 'di dag ni sems tsam nyid do zhes bya bar shes pa'o //
analyzed: de 'dra ba'i sems tsam nyid la gnas zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir de ni 'di ltar don du snang ba 'di dag ni sems tsam nyid do zhes bya bar shes pa'o //
translated: Because of that, one knows that these appearances as objects are just mere mind.

original: de bas gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bral ba yi //
analyzed: de bas gnyis kyi mtshan nyid bral ba yi //
translated: Therefore, it is free from the characteristics of duality.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni mngon sum nyid du 'gyur //
translated: The expanse of reality is directly perceived.

original: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i de gzhan nyid mngon sum nyid du 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa dang bral ba nyid kyis de las gzhan pa'i de gzhan nyid mngon sum nyid du 'gyur pa'o //
translated: This is because, by being free from the apprehended object and apprehending subject, the direct perception of the otherness of that from something else occurs.

original: de las gzhan pa ji ltar mngon sum nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ji ltar mngon sum nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can the otherness of that be directly perceived?

original: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:

original: sems la gzhan med par ni blos rtogs nas //
analyzed: sems la gzhan med par ni blos rtogs nas //
translated: Having realized that there is nothing other than mind,

original: de phyir sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de phyir sems kyang med pa nyid du rtogs // zhes bya ba la /
translated: therefore, mind is also realized to be non-existent.

original: sems las gzhan pa'i dmigs par bya ba'i don med la de med pas dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyang med pa nyid 'thob pa ste /🔽de gnyis kyi med pa nyid byang chub sems dpas rtogs nas /
analyzed: sems las gzhan pa'i dmigs par bya ba'i don med la de med pas dmigs par byed pa'i sems kyang med pa nyid 'thob pa ste / de gnyis kyi med pa nyid byang chub sems dpas rtogs nas /
translated: There is no object of perception that is other than mind, and because that does not exist, the existence of the perceiving mind is also not tenable.🔽Having realized the non-existence of both,

original: de dang mi ldan chos kyi dbyings la gnas //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de dang mi ldan chos kyi dbyings la gnas // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: the bodhisattva abides in the expanse of reality that is devoid of that.

original: don de dag dang sems bral bar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: don de dag dang sems bral bar gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expanse of reality is devoid of those objects and mind.

original: rtog med shes stobs zhes bya ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi stobs so //
analyzed: rtog med shes stobs zhes bya ba rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi stobs so //
translated: The power of nonconceptual knowledge.

original: mnyam pa'i rjes song bas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i rjes song bas zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' dang 'dra bar mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mthong ba'o //
translated: By following the equality of space, he sees all dharmas, such as the Sutras, as equal.

original: kun nas zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid do //
analyzed: kun nas zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid do //
translated: In every way means in the nature of the outer and inner.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i chos de dag nyid dus rtag tu mthong bar ni rtag par yang ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i chos de dag nyid dus rtag tu mthong bar ni rtag par yang ngo //
translated: He always sees those dharmas as they are seen, which is to say, he sees them as they are.

original: de'i gnas thibs po nyes pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de'i gnas te rgyu'o //
analyzed: de'i gnas thibs po nyes pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos de'i gnas te rgyu'o //
translated: The dense thicket of that abode, the accumulation of faults, is the abode, the cause, of those dharmas of affliction.

original: thibs po zhes bya ba ni rjes su rtogs par dka' ba nyid do //
analyzed: thibs po zhes bya ba ni rjes su rtogs par dka' ba nyid do //
translated: The dense thicket is difficult to penetrate.

original: @164b nyes pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi bag chags kyi ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: @164b nyes pa bsags pa zhes bya ba ni kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos rnams kyi bag chags kyi ngo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The accumulation of faults is the habitual tendencies of the dharmas of affliction.

original: thub pas gsungs pa'i legs chos gzhag pa /
analyzed: thub pas gsungs pa'i legs chos gzhag pa /
translated: The good dharma taught by the Sage is

original: rtsa ba chos kyi dbyings la de bla bzhag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: rtsa ba chos kyi dbyings la de bla bzhag / ces bya ba la /
translated: The root is the realm of reality, and the mind is placed on that.

original: rtsa ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis dmigs pa gang la blo nges par bzhag pa ste /
analyzed: rtsa ba dang bcas pa'i sems kyis dmigs pa gang la blo nges par bzhag pa ste /
translated: The mind with its root is placed on the meditative object, and the mind is settled on that.

original: de bzhin nyid de la'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid de la'o //
translated: That is reality.

original: de la rtsa ba'i sems ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa'i ston pa bsdus pa la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba'i sems ni gang de bzhin gshegs pa ma lus pa'i ston pa bsdus pa la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The root mind is that which is focused on the summary of the teaching of all the Tathagatas.

original: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin par blta'o //
analyzed: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes yin par blta'o //
translated: And that should be regarded as non-conceptual intuition.

original: dran pa'i rgyud ni rtog pa tsam shes nas //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dran pa'i rgyud ni rtog pa tsam shes nas // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The stream of memory is the mere concept.

original: de yang rtsa ba'i sems la gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rtsa ba'i sems la gnas pa ste /
translated: That is also based on the root mind.

original: bstan pa'i rjes la thob pa'i don te /
analyzed: bstan pa'i rjes la thob pa'i don te /
translated: It is the object obtained subsequently to the teaching.

original: 'das pa dran pa ni dran pa ni dran pa'i rgyud de gang rnam par rtog pa tsam du gyur pa'o //🔽rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i rjes la thob pa de dag gnyi gas kyang /
analyzed: 'das pa dran pa ni dran pa ni dran pa'i rgyud de gang rnam par rtog pa tsam du gyur pa'o // rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i rjes la thob pa de dag gnyi gas kyang /
translated: The stream of memory is the memory of the past. It is the mere concept which becomes the memory.

original: yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol te sangs rgyas nyid du'o //
analyzed: yon tan rgya mtsho'i pha rol te sangs rgyas nyid du'o //
translated: Both the non-conceptual intuition and the subsequently-attained intuition go beyond the ocean of virtues to Buddhahood.

original: brtan myur te byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
analyzed: brtan myur te byang chub sems dpa' nyid do //
translated: and firm and swift, which is the bodhisattva stage.

original: tshigs su bcad pa de rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don ni dang pos ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa de rnams kyi bsdus pa'i don ni dang pos ni tshogs kyi lam mo //
translated: The summary meaning of these verses: the first verse is about the path of accumulation.

original: gnyis pa'i phyed kyis ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i phyed kyis ni sbyor ba'i lam mo //
translated: The first half of the second verse is about the path of preparation.

original: phyed phyi ma dang gsum pas ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma dang gsum pas ni mthong ba'i lam mo //
translated: The second half and the third verse are about the path of seeing.

original: bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: bzhi pas ni bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The fourth verse is about the path of cultivation.

original: lnga pas ni mthar phyin pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lnga pas ni mthar phyin pa'i lam mo //
translated: The fifth verse is about the path of conclusion.

original: gang gi tshe zhugs pa de'i tshe lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la kun tu spyod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni kun tu spyod pa sbyor ba thams cad du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhugs pa de'i tshe lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa yin pa'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug la kun tu spyod pa'i sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni kun tu spyod pa sbyor ba thams cad du sbyor ba'o //
translated: When one has entered, then the application of practice in the six perfections is called the application of practice in the perfections because of the purity of superior intention.

original: bstan pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rab tu ldan pa'i shin tu zab pa de dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: bstan pa la mos pa zhes bya ba ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang rab tu ldan pa'i shin tu zab pa de dag la yang ngo //
translated: Faith in the teaching is that of one who is endowed with the six perfections and who has faith in the very profound teachings.

original: ro myang ba yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: ro myang ba yid la byed pa ste /
translated: It is attention that savors.

original: de dag gi yon tan mthong bar ro myang ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi yon tan mthong bar ro myang ba'o //
translated: It is the savoring of the vision of their virtues.

original: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni ji lta bu'i lhag pa'i bsam pas mchog tu pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa nges pa de lta bu bdag dang sems can thams cad kyis thob par gyur cig ces de lta bu mngon par dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba yid la byed pa ni ji lta bu'i lhag pa'i bsam pas mchog tu pha rol tu phyin pa thob pa nges pa de lta bu bdag dang sems can thams cad kyis thob par gyur cig ces de lta bu mngon par dga' ba'o //
translated: The attention of delight is the delight in the thought: “May I and all beings attain the perfection of the supreme aspiration just as it is attained by those who are certain of the supreme perfections.”

original: re zhig lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa de dag nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin /
analyzed: re zhig lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa de dag nyid kyi mtshan nyid gang yin /
translated: What is the characteristic of those very pure aspirations?

original: gang gis de dag yongs su bzung ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis de dag yongs su bzung ba yin zhe na /
translated: By what are they embraced?

original: gang gi rjes thogs su tshigs su bcad pa dag gis de'i mtshan nyid ston par byed pa de /🔽de la re zhig mos pas spyod pa'i sa la tshogs legs @165a * //
analyzed: gang gi rjes thogs su tshigs su bcad pa dag gis de'i mtshan nyid ston par byed pa de / de la re zhig mos pas spyod pa'i sa la tshogs legs @165a * //
translated: The following verses show their characteristics.

original: par bsags pa dang / dkar po'i chos rnams kun rdzogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: par bsags pa dang / dkar po'i chos rnams kun rdzogs pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, on the stage of action in faith, the accumulations are well gathered and the virtuous natures are completely fulfilled.🔽Having attained the sharpest acquiescence, one is established in the supreme stage.🔽Having attained the sharpest acquiescence, one is established in the supreme stage.

original: bzod rnon thob dang zhes bya ba ni chung ngu la sogs pa bzod pa rnams pa gsum las bzod pa'i mchog pa gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzod rnon thob dang zhes bya ba ni chung ngu la sogs pa bzod pa rnams pa gsum las bzod pa'i mchog pa gnas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The supreme acquiescence is the three kinds of acquiescence, weak, etc. The supreme stage is the stage of action in faith.

original: gang la dmigs nas dag par 'gyur pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gang la dmigs nas dag par 'gyur pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to show what is to be focused on in order to become pure, he says:

original: theg chen la zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: theg chen la zhes bya ba ste /
translated: In the Great Vehicle.

original: gang du zhe na /
analyzed: gang du zhe na /
translated: Where?

original: zab cing rgya che bstan pa la'o //
analyzed: zab cing rgya che bstan pa la'o //
translated: In the teaching of the profound and the vast.

original: de nyid ni rang gi theg pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ni rang gi theg pa ste /
translated: That itself is one's own vehicle,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi'o //
translated: that of the bodhisattvas.

original: de la bzod pa ni chos bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa ni chos bdag med pa'o //
translated: There, the profound is the selflessness of phenomena.

original: rgya che ba ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni nam mkha' mdzod la sogs pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: The vast is the sky-treasury meditative stabilization and so forth.🔽In order to show what kind of attention purifies, he says:🔽If one realizes all phenomena are mere conceptualization,

original: yid la byed pa ji lta bus rnam par dag pa de bstan pa'i phyir gal te rtog pa tsam du chos thams cad rtogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yid la byed pa ji lta bus rnam par dag pa de bstan pa'i phyir gal te rtog pa tsam du chos thams cad rtogs pa de'i ngo bo nyid de bstan par bya ste /
translated: one's nature is shown to be pure,

original: 'dod pa dang ni mos pa dag / dag pa bsam pa dag pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ni mos pa dag / dag pa bsam pa dag pa nyid yin no //
translated: with pure desire and pure interest.

original: de la 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'o //
translated: There, desire is strong aspiration.

original: mos pa ni dad pa'o //
analyzed: mos pa ni dad pa'o //
translated: Interest is faith.

original: de'i rtags gang yin pa de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i rtags gang yin pa de bstan par bya ste /
translated: The signs of that will be shown.

original: snga la sogs su ni thog mar bsam pa dag pa'o //
analyzed: snga la sogs su ni thog mar bsam pa dag pa'o //
translated: In the first and so forth, first is the pure intention.

original: der zhes bya ba ni bam pa dag pa der sangs rgyas rnams ni mthong bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: der zhes bya ba ni bam pa dag pa der sangs rgyas rnams ni mthong bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: There, in that pure book, one sees the buddhas.

original: de ni rtags so //
analyzed: de ni rtags so //
translated: This is the sign.

original: chos kun zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus so //
analyzed: chos kun zhes bya ba ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i dus so //
translated: All phenomena refers to the time of meditative equipoise.

original: de'i phan yon gang yin pa de bstan par bya bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phan yon gang yin pa de bstan par bya bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the benefits of that, it says:

original: de la gnas pa ni byang chub nye bar rtogs gyur nas te /
analyzed: de la gnas pa ni byang chub nye bar rtogs gyur nas te /
translated: Dwelling in that, one realizes the nearness of enlightenment.

original: de thob par byed pa'i thabs rnyed pas tshegs med par 'thob par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i thabs rnyed pas tshegs med par 'thob par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: One attains it without difficulty, because one has found the means to attain it.

original: bsam pa dag pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu ci 'dra ba dang / ji lta bu'i bzod pa dang / dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu'i yid la byed pa dang / rtags gang yin pa de tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis bstan te /
analyzed: bsam pa dag pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu ci 'dra ba dang / ji lta bu'i bzod pa dang / dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / ji lta bu'i yid la byed pa dang / rtags gang yin pa de tshigs su bcad pa de dag gis bstan te /
translated: The purity of attitude, the kind of cause, the kind of patience, the object, the kind of attention, and the sign are taught by those verses.

original: de dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ni lhag pa'i bsam pa dag pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: These are the divisions of the body of pure attitude.

original: chud za ba'i rgyu 'chal pa'i shes rab ces bya ba la /
analyzed: chud za ba'i rgyu 'chal pa'i shes rab ces bya ba la /
translated: The cause of loss is called bad wisdom.

original: de la shes rab 'chal pa'i ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: de la shes rab 'chal pa'i ni phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ste /
translated: The one with faulty wisdom is the one who grasps perversely,

original: ji ltar mu stegs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mu stegs pa lta bu'o //
translated: like the tīrthikas.

original: des kyang de chud za bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des kyang de chud za bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He also causes it to be wasted.

original: lhag ma'i don ni go sla ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma'i don ni go sla ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the rest is easy to understand.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen pos grangs rnam par gzhag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang / gnyen pos grangs rnam par gzhag pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yang dag par 'grub pa'i gzhi'i gnas kyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The classification of the perfections in terms of their antidotal function and the classification of the perfections in terms of their basis for accomplishing all the qualities of a buddha.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis chos rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos pos ni rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam grangs gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyis chos rnams kyi rgyu'i dngos pos ni rnam par gzhag pa'i rnam grangs gnyis pa ste /
translated: The second classification of the perfections is in terms of the fact that they are the cause of all the qualities of a buddha.

original: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug las lhag pa @165b yang ma yin zhing chad pa yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir pha rol tu phyin pa drug las lhag pa @165b yang ma yin zhing chad pa yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: Therefore, the perfections are neither more than six nor less,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du de
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba med pa la brten nas sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams kyi de kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brten pa'i shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yang dag par ji lta ba bzhin du de
translated: Since one realizes the thatness of the buddhadharmas in dependence on nondistraction, the perfection of wisdom that is based on the perfection of meditative stabilization correctly realizes thatness just as it is.

original: kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kho na nyid rtogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what it means.

original: 'di dag gi don lhag ma ni go sla ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gi don lhag ma ni go sla ba'o //
translated: The meaning of the rest of these is easy to understand.

original: gang gi phyir rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gsum pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang rjes su mthun pas zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam par gzhag pa'i rgyu gsum pa ni sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba dang rjes su mthun pas zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The third reason for positing the perfections is because they are in harmony with bringing all sentient beings to full maturity.

original: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba nyid la rjes su mthun pa'i phyir na 'di ltar drug tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can thams cad yongs su smin par bya ba nyid la rjes su mthun pa'i phyir na 'di ltar drug tu 'gyur te /
translated: Since they are in harmony with bringing all sentient beings to full maturity, they are six in number.

original: de'i phyir na yang drug tu rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang drug tu rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Therefore they are also posited as six.

original: sems mnyam pa rnams mnyam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: sems mnyam pa rnams mnyam par gzhag par bya ba'i phyir bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of meditation is for the sake of meditative concentration of those whose minds are not concentrated.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnams rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pa rnams rnam par thar par bya ba'i phyir shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The perfection of wisdom is for the sake of liberation of those whose minds are concentrated.

original: yongs su smin par byed pas so //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pas so //
translated: Because they bring to full maturity.

original: gdams par bya ba rnams par zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdams par bya ba rnams par zhes bya ba ni gdams ngag sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Those who are to be instructed are to be given instruction, that is, the instruction is to be given to them.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba thob ce na /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams mtshan nyid gang dang ldan pas pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba thob ce na /
translated: What are the characteristics of generosity, etc. by which they attain the name “perfection”?

original: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa dag la yang sbyin pa la sogs pa yod pas des na 'di dag gi mtshan nyid nges par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'jig rten pa dang nyan thos la sogs pa dag la yang sbyin pa la sogs pa yod pas des na 'di dag gi mtshan nyid nges par brjod par bya ste /
translated: Since generosity, etc. also exist for mundane beings and sravakas, etc., therefore their characteristics must be stated.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid la gnas dam pa zhes bya bas ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi mtshan nyid la gnas dam pa zhes bya bas ni 'di ltar byang chub kyi sems gnas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The highest reality of the six perfections is called the highest abode, because the thought of enlightenment is the abode.

original: dngos po dam pa zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid mtha' dag kun du sbyong ba ni gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po dam pa zhes bya ba ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid mtha' dag kun du sbyong ba ni gzhan yod pa ma yin la /
translated: The highest thing is called the highest purification of all that is internal and external, because there is nothing else.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dir dngos po mtha' dag yongs su spyod pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'dir dngos po mtha' dag yongs su spyod pa yin no //
translated: The bodhisattva is the one who enjoys all things here.

original: ched du bya ba dam pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa gang sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i ched du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ched du bya ba dam pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa gang sems can thams cad la phan pa dang / bde ba'i ched du byed pa'o //
translated: The highest aim is called the aim of giving, which is for the benefit and happiness of all beings.

original: thabs la mkhas pa dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba ste /🔽sbyin par bya bar yang ma yin /🔽sbyin pa por yang ma yin la /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'dir 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i thabs la mkhas pas yongs su bzung ba ste / sbyin par bya bar yang ma yin / sbyin pa por yang ma yin la /
translated: The highest skill in means is called the skill in means which consists in the purification of the three sectors.

original: len pa por yang rtog par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: len pa por yang rtog par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One should not imagine that there is a gift, a giver, or a recipient.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin par gyur ba'o //🔽yongs su bsngo ba @166a * //
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis yongs su zin par gyur ba'o // yongs su bsngo ba @166a * //
translated: Thus, the transcendences are embraced by nonconceptual intuition.

original: dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o //🔽rnam par dag pa dam pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis tshe sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams te /
analyzed: dam pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu yongs su bsngo ba'o // rnam par dag pa dam pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis tshe sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba nyid kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams te /
translated: The highest dedication is the dedication of the transcendences to the realization of unexcelled true and complete enlightenment.

original: de yang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag las rnam par grol ba kun tu sgrub par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa dag las rnam par grol ba kun tu sgrub par gyur pa'o //
translated: The highest purification is the purification of the transcendences by the realization of buddhahood, which is the attainment of liberation from the obscurations of the afflictions and the knowable.🔽Is every generosity a perfection?

original: sbyin pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin nam /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa yang de yin nam zhes dris pa'i phyogs de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa yang de yin nam /🔽pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa de sbyin pa yang de yin nam zhes dris pa'i phyogs de bstan par bya ste /
translated: Or is every perfection a generosity?

original: sbyin pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa gang yin pa de pha rol tu phyin pa ma yin pa ni gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang bral ba'o //
translated: Generosity that is not a perfection is that which is devoid of the six perfections.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa ni yin la sbyin pa ma yin pa ni tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis yongs su bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa ni yin la sbyin pa ma yin pa ni tshul khrims la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis yongs su bsdus pa'o //
translated: That which is a perfection but not generosity is the six perfections included in ethics and so on.

original: sbyin pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang yin la pha rol tu phyin pa yang yin pa ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: That which is both generosity and a perfection is generosity included in the six perfections.

original: sbyin pa yang ma yin pa pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa ni tshul khrims la sogs pa drug po de dag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa yang ma yin pa pha rol tu phyin pa yang ma yin pa ni tshul khrims la sogs pa drug po de dag dang bral ba'o //
translated: That which is neither generosity nor a perfection is that which is devoid of those six, ethics and so on.

original: de bzhin du mu bzhi po thams cad la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du mu bzhi po thams cad la blta bar bya'o //
translated: The same should be applied to all four possibilities in the same way.

original: nges pa'i tshig blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig blta bar bya ste /
translated: The verbal roots should be examined.

original: re zhig thams cad kyi spyi'i nges pa'i tshig ni pha rol tu phyin pa ni pa ste /
analyzed: re zhig thams cad kyi spyi'i nges pa'i tshig ni pha rol tu phyin pa ni pa ste /
translated: First, the verbal root of all perfections in general is pāramitā.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi mchog tu phyin pas des na pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa thams cad kyi mchog tu phyin pas des na pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of generosity and so on is the supreme of all the generosity and so on of mundane beings, sravakas, and pratyekabuddhas, because it is the cause of the attainment of the great enlightenment.

original: so so'i ni rgyu'i dus na ser sna ma bcom par sbyin pa gtong bar mi byed pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i dus na ni dbul ba lus 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: so so'i ni rgyu'i dus na ser sna ma bcom par sbyin pa gtong bar mi byed pa'i phyir dang / 'bras bu'i dus na ni dbul ba lus 'dzin par byed pa'i phyir dang / longs spyod chen po dang / bsod nams kyi tshogs sbyin par byed pas sbyin pa'o //
translated: Generosity is the cause of the destruction of stinginess at the time of the cause, because one does not practice generosity when stinginess is not destroyed. At the time of the result, it is the cause of the attainment of great wealth and the accumulation of merit, because it holds poverty at bay.

original: rgyu'i dus na 'chal ba'i tshul khrims zhi bar byed pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus na ngan 'gro zhi bar byed pa dang / bde 'gro dang ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pas tshul khrims so //
analyzed: rgyu'i dus na 'chal ba'i tshul khrims zhi bar byed pa dang / 'bras bu'i dus na ngan 'gro zhi bar byed pa dang / bde 'gro dang ting nge 'dzin thob par byed pas tshul khrims so //
translated: Morality is the cause of the pacification of immorality at the time of the cause, and at the time of the result, it is the cause of the pacification of the miserable realms, and the attainment of the happy realms and meditative concentration.

original: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi nges pa'i tshig ji ltar rigs pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The etymologies of all the perfections should be applied in the appropriate manner.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag la bde bar byed pas zhes bya ba la bdag nyid ngan 'gro dang / kho na du 'dzin pa dang / khro ba la sbyor bar mi byed cing /🔽pha rol dag kyang bde bar byed de /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag la bde bar byed pas zhes bya ba la bdag nyid ngan 'gro dang / kho na du 'dzin pa dang / khro ba la sbyor bar mi byed cing / pha rol dag kyang bde bar byed de /
translated: One acts for the happiness of oneself and others because one does not apply oneself to evil destinies, to self-conceit, or to anger, and🔽one makes others happy.

original: de dag la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de dag la sdug bsngal skyed par mi byed do //
translated: It is the cause of happiness for oneself and others, because it does not cause oneself to be bound to evil destinies, or to be bound to anger and conceit, and it causes others to be happy, because it does not cause them to suffer.🔽The five aspects of meditation should be understood as follows:

original: bsgom pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba de la kun tu spyod pa la sbyor ba ni kun tu spyod pa @166b la bsgom pa'o //🔽bya ba sgrub pa bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa shin tu sbyangs pa 'bad pa med pa mnga' bas kun tu spyod pa med bzhin du yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i gnas skabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rjes su bzung
analyzed: bsgom pa rnam pa lngar blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba de la kun tu spyod pa la sbyor ba ni kun tu spyod pa @166b la bsgom pa'o // bya ba sgrub pa bsgom pa zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa shin tu sbyangs pa 'bad pa med pa mnga' bas kun tu spyod pa med bzhin du yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi sku'i gnas skabs kyi pha rol tu phyin pas sems can rjes su bzung
translated: The meditation of practice is the practice of the transcendences.🔽The meditation of achievement of the task is the achievement of the transcendences, because it is the achievement of the task of the transcendences.

original: ba'i phyir bya ba sgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ba'i phyir bya ba sgrub pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The meditation of the absence of practice is the absence of practice of the transcendences, because the transcendences are achieved effortlessly.🔽The meditation of the purification of obstructions is the purification of the obstructions to the transcendences.🔽The meditation of the acquisition of excellence is the acquisition of the transcendences, because it is the acquisition of the transcendences in ever increasing measure.

original: de lta bu re zhig bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu re zhig bsgom pa'o //
translated: These are the five kinds of meditation.

original: de snyed kyi dus skad cig ma gcig tu zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de snyed kyi dus skad cig ma gcig tu zhes bya ba la /
translated: As many as those in a single instant.

original: gang de lta bu'i grangs med pa gsum la sogs pa'i tshad kyi dus skad cig ma gcig tu byas la /
analyzed: gang de lta bu'i grangs med pa gsum la sogs pa'i tshad kyi dus skad cig ma gcig tu byas la /
translated: Having made the measure of time of three countless eons and so forth into a single instant,

original: de lta bu'i skad cig mas ji srid byang chub par gyur pa de srid kyi dus su skad cig re re la bdag gi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtsa ba'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas blta bar bya ste go sla'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i skad cig mas ji srid byang chub par gyur pa de srid kyi dus su skad cig re re la bdag gi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa rtsa ba'i gzhung gi rjes su 'brangs nas blta bar bya ste go sla'o //
translated: for as long as one is enlightened by such an instant, for that long, in each instant, one should look at the root text beginning with “my body” and so forth, which is easy to understand.

original: rim pa de lta bu nyid kyis byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar de srid du de lta bu'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sems gcig nyid skyed par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: rim pa de lta bu nyid kyis byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar de srid du de lta bu'i tshul khrims la sogs pa'i sems gcig nyid skyed par byed pa nyid do //
translated: By that very process, for as long as one abides in the essence of enlightenment, one generates just that one mind of ethics and so forth.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba skad cig re re la spyod lam bzhi byed cing yo byad thams cad dang mi ldan pa yang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams mes yongs su gang ba skad cig re re la spyod lam bzhi byed cing yo byad thams cad dang mi ldan pa yang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even if the trichiliocosm were completely filled with fire, in each instant one would engage in the four activities, and one would not be endowed with all the requisites.

original: 'dis ni gnas med cing yo byad thams cad dang mi ldan pa nyid bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni gnas med cing yo byad thams cad dang mi ldan pa nyid bstan to //
translated: This shows that he has no abode and is not endowed with any possessions.

original: nges par byas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyang bshig par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni nges par bshig pa tsam gyis rnam par smin par mi nus par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: nges par byas pa'i sgrib pa thams cad kyang bshig par 'gyur na zhes bya ba ni nges par bshig pa tsam gyis rnam par smin par mi nus par 'dod pa'o //
translated: And he destroys all the obscurations that have been determined, that is, he is considered to be able to destroy those that have been determined, but not those that have not been determined.

original: yang nang na 'gror 'gro ba'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir bsam pa rgya chen po nyid ni mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: yang nang na 'gror 'gro ba'i gnyen po nyid yin pa'i phyir bsam pa rgya chen po nyid ni mi ngoms pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the vast aspiration is the insatiable aspiration, because it is the antidote to the internal movement of going.

original: 'di ltar de dag nyid rgyun ring por yang mi 'dor ba'i bsam pa de yod pas na rgyun ring po'i bsam pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag nyid rgyun ring por yang mi 'dor ba'i bsam pa de yod pas na rgyun ring po'i bsam pa ste /
translated: Since he does not abandon that aspiration even for a long time, it is the long-term aspiration.

original: rgyun ring du zhes bya ba ni dus ring du'o //
analyzed: rgyun ring du zhes bya ba ni dus ring du'o //
translated: For a long time means for a long period of time.

original: don lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: don lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The remaining meaning is easy to understand.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa dang / rab tu dbye ba bstan pa de bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i lus rnam par gzhag pa dang / rab tu dbye ba bstan pa de bshad par bya ste /
translated: The explanation of the presentation and divisions of the body of the perfections should be stated.

original: gang gi phyir sbyin pa rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyin pa rnam pa gsum yin zhe na /
translated: Why are there three types of generosity?

original: chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The generosity of Dharma, etc.

original: 'di ltar chos kyi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos kyi sbyin pa ni gzhan gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba nye bar brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: Thus, the gift of Dharma stabilizes the roots of virtue of others.

original: zang zing gi sbyin pa na 'di'i lus brtan par byed pa'o //
analyzed: zang zing gi sbyin pa na 'di'i lus brtan par byed pa'o //
translated: The gift of material goods stabilizes their bodies.

original: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni de nyid kyi sems brtan par byed pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa ni de nyid kyi sems brtan par byed pa ste /
translated: The gift of fearlessness stabilizes their minds.

original: de'i phyir rgyu des na sbyin pa rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu des na sbyin pa rnam pa gsum du bstan to //
translated: Therefore, for that reason, the three kinds of giving are taught.

original: tshul khrims kyang rab tu gnas pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims te /🔽lhag ma gnyis po dag gi don gyi @167a * //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyang rab tu gnas pa'i tshul khrims ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims te / lhag ma gnyis po dag gi don gyi @167a * //
translated: Morality is also threefold: the morality of restraint is the morality of the vow.🔽The other two moralities are the meaning of the words “and so on.”

original: gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they are the basis of the meaning of the other two moralities.🔽Thus, the morality of gathering virtuous natures by one who is established in the vow is the basis for the attainment of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: 'di ltar sdom pa la gnas pa'i dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub mngon par sgrub pas rten du gyur pa nyid dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pas rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdom pa la gnas pa'i dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams dang / byang chub mngon par sgrub pas rten du gyur pa nyid dang / sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyis sems can yongs su smin par byed pas rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: The morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings is the basis for the maturation of sentient beings.

original: bzod pa yang gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ni gang gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa la khro bar rab tu spong ba nyid do //🔽de'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa yang gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ni gang gzhan gyis gnod pa byed pa la khro bar rab tu spong ba nyid do // de'i dbang gis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: The forbearance of not retaliating for harm done to one is the complete abandonment of anger toward those who harm one.🔽The forbearance of accepting the suffering of cyclic existence is the power by which one does not turn back from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: gang gi stobs kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa des ldog par mi 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi stobs kyis 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal gang yin pa des ldog par mi 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The forbearance of accepting the suffering of cyclic existence is the power by which one does not turn back from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa ni yang chos gang la nges par brtag pa de la 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: chos la nges par rtogs pa'i bzod pa ni yang chos gang la nges par brtag pa de la 'dod pa ste /
translated: The forbearance of ascertaining the Dharma is the desire to ascertain the Dharma that has been taught.

original: de yang bshad ma thag pa'i bzod pa gnyis po dag gi rten du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de yang bshad ma thag pa'i bzod pa gnyis po dag gi rten du gyur pa'o //
translated: This is the basis of the two previously mentioned forbearances.

original: brtson 'grus kyi lus kyang rnam pa gsum du gzhag ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi lus kyang rnam pa gsum du gzhag ste /
translated: The body of effort is also presented in three aspects:

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan dag las /
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo sde gzhan dag las /
translated: Thus, the Blessed One has said in other sūtras:

original: brtan pa dang ldan pa pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spro ba can dang / pha rol gnon pa brtan pa dang / blangs pa mi 'dor zhing zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de dag brtson 'grus kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa gsum dang sbyar bar bya'o /
analyzed: brtan pa dang ldan pa pa dang / brtson 'grus dang ldan pa dang / spro ba can dang / pha rol gnon pa brtan pa dang / blangs pa mi 'dor zhing zhes gsungs pa'i tshig de dag brtson 'grus kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa gsum dang sbyar bar bya'o /
translated: The words “firm,” “endowed with effort,” “enthusiastic,” “steadfast in overcoming opposition,” and “not abandoning what has been taken up” should be applied to the three aspects of the body of effort.

original: de la go cha'i brtson 'grus ni brtan pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la go cha'i brtson 'grus ni brtan pa dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Among them, the armor-like effort is the firm one.

original: dang por sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ni brtson 'grus dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang por sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus ni brtson 'grus dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The effort of application at the beginning is the one endowed with effort.

original: sbyor ba'i dus su mi zhum pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa zhes bya bas dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du spro ba can dang / pha rol gnon pa brtan pa dang / blangs pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dus su mi zhum pa dang / mi 'khrugs pa dang / chog par mi 'dzin pa zhes bya bas dag rim pa ji lta ba bzhin du spro ba can dang / pha rol gnon pa brtan pa dang / blangs pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'di dag gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The three words “not discouraged,” “not agitated,” and “not satisfied” respectively teach “enthusiastic,” “steadfast in overcoming opposition,” and “not abandoning what has been taken up.”

original: gang gi phyir gang dag dang por bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi don du brtan pa dang yang ldan la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang dag dang por bla na med pa'i byang chub kyi don du brtan pa dang yang ldan la /
translated: Because those who are steadfast from the very beginning for the sake of unexcelled enlightenment,

original: sbyor ba'i dus su brtson 'grus dang ldan du zin kyang sems zhum par gyur na ma yin pas de lta bas na de'i gnyen por spro ba can te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dus su brtson 'grus dang ldan du zin kyang sems zhum par gyur na ma yin pas de lta bas na de'i gnyen por spro ba can te /
translated: and who are diligent at the time of practice, do not become discouraged. Therefore, the remedy for that is enthusiasm.

original: gang sems spro ba dang ldan pa de sems zhum par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang sems spro ba dang ldan pa de sems zhum par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One whose mind is enthusiastic does not become discouraged.

original: zhum pa ni 'dir sems 'gong pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: zhum pa ni 'dir sems 'gong pa'i bdag nyid du 'dod do //
translated: Here, discouragement is considered to be a state of mental contraction.

original: sems zhum pa med du zin kyang 'khrugs par gyur na sangs rgyas nyid las ldog par 'gyur bas des na de'i gnyen por mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus bstan te /
analyzed: sems zhum pa med du zin kyang 'khrugs par gyur na sangs rgyas nyid las ldog par 'gyur bas des na de'i gnyen por mi 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus bstan te /
translated: Even if one is not discouraged, if one becomes agitated, one turns away from buddhahood. Therefore, the remedy for that is taught as unwavering diligence.

original: de yang pha rol gnon pa brtan pa zhes bya bas pha rol gnon pa brtan pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de yang pha rol gnon pa brtan pa zhes bya bas pha rol gnon pa brtan pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: Moreover, unwavering steadfastness is taught by the phrase “steadfast in overcoming opposition.”

original: 'di ltar pha @167b rol gnon pa brtan pa nyid ni sdug bsngal gyis ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha @167b rol gnon pa brtan pa nyid ni sdug bsngal gyis ldog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: For in this way, unwavering steadfastness does not turn back due to suffering.

original: sdug bsngal gyis ldog par mi 'gyur du zin kyang gang nyung zad kyis chog par 'dzin na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur bas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis ldog par mi 'gyur du zin kyang gang nyung zad kyis chog par 'dzin na bla na med pa'i byang chub thob par mi 'gyur bas /
translated: Even if he were not to turn back from suffering, he would not attain unsurpassed enlightenment if he were to be satisfied with a little.

original: de'i phyir chog par mi 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya bar yang bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir chog par mi 'dzin pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya bar yang bstan te /
translated: Therefore, it is also called the effort of non-satisfaction,

original: cung zad kyis chog par mi gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cung zad kyis chog par mi gzung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which means that one should not be satisfied with a little.

original: de yang blangs pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
analyzed: de yang blangs pa mi 'dor ba zhes bya ba 'dis bstan te /
translated: Moreover, this is indicated by the phrase “not abandoning what has been undertaken.”

original: don de dag nyid kyis ni brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don de dag nyid kyis ni brtson 'grus rnam pa gsum bshad pa yin no //
translated: By these very topics, the three kinds of effort have been explained.

original: yang gnas pa'i bsam gtan ni gang gis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang gnas pa'i bsam gtan ni gang gis mthong ba'i chos la bde bar gnas pas gnas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the concentration of abiding is that by which one abides in a pleasant abiding in this very life.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa ni gang gis mngon par shes pa drug mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa ni gang gis mngon par shes pa drug mngon par bsgrub pa'o //
translated: The concentration of realization is that by which one realizes the six superknowledges.

original: bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni gang bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni gang bsam gtan la brten nas sems can gyi don byed pa ste /
translated: The concentration of accomplishing activities is that by which, in dependence on concentration, one acts for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: de ni bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: de ni bya ba sgrub pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: This is the concentration of the performance of action.

original: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum gyi don ni de dag nyid do /
analyzed: bsam gtan rnam pa gsum gyi don ni de dag nyid do /
translated: The meaning of the three kinds of concentration is just these.

original: shes rab kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa gsum gyi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi lus rnam par gzhag pa gsum gyi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the three bodies of wisdom is easy to understand.

original: 'di dag bsdus par ji ltar blta zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos rnams ji ltar bsdu zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag bsdus par ji ltar blta zhe na zhes bya ba ni pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos rnams ji ltar bsdu zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: How should one see the inclusion of all wholesome dharmas in these perfections?

original: gang gi phyir de dag tu 'di dag bsdus pa'i phyir 'di dag tu yang de dag bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag tu 'di dag bsdus pa'i phyir 'di dag tu yang de dag bsdus pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Because they are included in those, one should see that they are included in these.🔽How should one see the inclusion of all wholesome dharmas in these?

original: 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge ba'i chos thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams su 'dod do //🔽de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
analyzed: 'di dag gis dge ba'i chos thams cad bsdus zhes bya ba ni 'dir dge ba'i chos thams cad ni byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams su 'dod do // de'i mtshan nyid ces bya ba la /
translated: Here, all wholesome dharmas are considered to be the factors of enlightenment.🔽The characteristic of that is wisdom.

original: de'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab to //
analyzed: de'i mtshan nyid ni shes rab to //
translated: The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.

original: de'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mthun pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The cause of that is vigor.🔽The result of that is meditative concentration.🔽The basis of that is morality.🔽The accumulation of that is giving.🔽The

original: de ni ji ltar mngon par shes pa dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan gzhan dag gi yang rgyur mthun par gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni ji ltar mngon par shes pa dang / stobs bcu la sogs pa'i yon tan gzhan dag gi yang rgyur mthun par gyur ba'o //
translated: It is the cause of the other qualities such as the superknowledges and the ten powers.

original: de dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa ni de dang mthun par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa ni de dang mthun par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The concordant side should be understood as faith, etc.

original: gang yang dkar po'i chos rnams thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams des bstan to //
analyzed: gang yang dkar po'i chos rnams thams cad yang dag par bsdus pa pha rol tu phyin pa rnams des bstan to //
translated: The perfections are taught as the collection of all the virtuous dharmas.

original: de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad ji ltar bsdus pa de bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos thams cad ji ltar bsdus pa de bstan par bya'o //
translated: The afflicted dharmas should be taught as the collection of all the counteragents to those.

original: de la de'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid 'dod chags pa la sogs pa dag go //🔽de'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhi ste /
analyzed: de la de'i mtshan nyid de zhes bya ba ni de'i mtshan nyid 'dod chags pa la sogs pa dag go // de'i gzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhi ste /
translated: The characteristic of that is desire, etc.

original: ji ltar ser sna'i gzhi dang / ma dad pa nyid dang / lta ba log pa la sogs @168a * //
analyzed: ji ltar ser sna'i gzhi dang / ma dad pa nyid dang / lta ba log pa la sogs @168a * //
translated: The basis of that is the basis of stinginess, lack of faith, wrong views, etc.

original: pa'o ; / de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: pa'o ; / de'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ser sna dang / 'chal ba'i tshul khrims dang / khro ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of that is the result of stinginess, immorality, anger, etc.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi phan yon bstan par bya bas ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa 'di dag gi phan yon bstan par bya bas ni /
translated: The benefits of these perfections are shown by the following verse.

original: kha na ma thob pa med par mngon par mtho ba ste /
analyzed: kha na ma thob pa med par mngon par mtho ba ste /
translated: One is elevated without offense,🔽not like the heretic,

original: ji ltar phyir rol pa'i lta bu ni ma yin te de dag gi mngon par mthon ba nyid yin na yang kha na ma thob pa dang bcas pas dman pa nyid yin pa dang / yang de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: ji ltar phyir rol pa'i lta bu ni ma yin te de dag gi mngon par mthon ba nyid yin na yang kha na ma thob pa dang bcas pas dman pa nyid yin pa dang / yang de dag ni mi rtag pa nyid yin pas so //
translated: because even though they are elevated, they are inferior because they are accompanied by offense, and because they are impermanent.

original: yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni mi rtag pa ma yin te /
