analyzed: yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni mi rtag pa ma yin te /
translated: The result of the perfections is not impermanent,

original: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang de ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi don yin gyi /
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // yang de ni bdag 'ba' zhig gi don yin gyi /
translated: because it is said to last until the seat of enlightenment.🔽It is not for one's own sake alone,

original: gzhan gyi ma yin pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi ma yin pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: but for the sake of others as well.

original: gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni sems can gyi don bya bar nye bar gnas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir pha rol tu phyin pa'i 'bras bu ni sems can gyi don bya bar nye bar gnas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the result of the perfections is established in the performance of the aims of sentient beings.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi 'bras bu'i phan yon ni /
translated: The benefits of the result of all the perfections are

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa 'di dag yin no //
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa la sogs pa 'di dag yin no //
translated: these: being without offense, and so on.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sum brgya pa la sogs pa las pha rol tu phyin pa gcig bstan par byas pa der gang thams cad bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba de'i dgongs par gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sum brgya pa la sogs pa las pha rol tu phyin pa gcig bstan par byas pa der gang thams cad bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba de'i dgongs par gang yin zhe na /
translated: In the Perfection of Wisdom in Three Hundred Lines and so on, one perfection is taught, and in that, all are taught. What is the intention there?

original: gcig la rab tu sbyor ba na thams cad kyi byed pa 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: gcig la rab tu sbyor ba na thams cad kyi byed pa 'gro bar 'gyur ro zhes dgongs pa yin no //
translated: When one is engaged in one, the activity of all is present.

original: de la sbyin pa byed pa ni lus dang ngag bsdams nas sbyin par byed pa ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa byed pa ni lus dang ngag bsdams nas sbyin par byed pa ni de'i tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i byed pa yin no //
translated: There, the activity of the perfection of morality is the giving of one who gives, having restrained body and speech.

original: sbyin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu shes pa nyid ni shes rab kyi byed pa ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu shes pa nyid ni shes rab kyi byed pa ste /
translated: The function of wisdom is the knowledge of the cause and result of generosity.

original: lhag ma rnams kyi byed pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma rnams kyi byed pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The function of the others should be applied in the same way.

original: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i byed brag las brtsams pa ni shes bya chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu po kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba'i don gyi bar du'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu dang 'bras bu'i byed brag las brtsams pa ni shes bya chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu po kun tu 'gro ba'i don dang / gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba'i don gyi bar du'o //
translated: The ten aspects of the knowable dharmadhatu, from the meaning of omnipresence up to the meaning of mastery over the doors of dharanis and samadhis, are presented in terms of the distinctions of cause and result.

original: de la shes bya chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu ni lus dang sa la shes bya'i rnam pa re re ste /
analyzed: de la shes bya chos kyi dbyings rnam pa bcu ni lus dang sa la shes bya'i rnam pa re re ste /
translated: The ten aspects of the knowable dharmadhatu are the individual aspects of the knowable in relation to the body and the levels.

original: de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis mi shes pa yin pas de'i phyir de lta bu'i ma rig pa'i gnyen por sa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i dbang gis mi shes pa yin pas de'i phyir de lta bu'i ma rig pa'i gnyen por sa bcu pa'o //
translated: Since they are not known due to the power of ignorance, the ten grounds are established as the antidotes to such ignorance.

original: yang na de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu las sa bcur gzhag ste ;
analyzed: yang na de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu las sa bcur gzhag ste ;
translated: Alternatively, the ten grounds are established from the ten aspects that are incompatible with the dharmadhatu.

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam pa bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten aspects that are incompatible with the dharmadhatu?

original: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / bden pa la lus la sogs pas phyin ci log tu sgrub pa dang dbul ba nyid do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo nyid dang / bden pa la lus la sogs pas phyin ci log tu sgrub pa dang dbul ba nyid do //
translated: The three are: the state of ordinary person, the practice of the body, etc., in a manner contrary to the truth, and poverty.

original: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa brjod pa nyid do //🔽nyon mongs pa phra ba kun tu rgyu ba ste /
analyzed: thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa brjod pa nyid do // nyon mongs pa phra ba kun tu rgyu ba ste /
translated: The three are: the expression of learning, reflection, and meditation.🔽The three are: the subtle, the manifest, and the innate.

original: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la @168b lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa'i 'jig tshogs la @168b lta ba la sogs pas bsdus pa'o //
translated: The subtle is that which is included in the innate afflicted view of the self, etc.

original: de yang chung ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yid la byed pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun tu spyod pa'i ring du song ba nyid ni phra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang chung ba'i rnam pa nyid kyi phyir dang / yid la byed pa dang bcas pa'i dmigs pa nyid kyi phyir dang / kun tu spyod pa'i ring du song ba nyid ni phra ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that the subtle is so called because it is of a weak form, because it is the object of mental attention, and because it is far removed from practice.

original: theg pa dman pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mtshan ma rgya chen po la kun tu spyod pa dang ; mtshan ma phra mo la kun tu spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med par mngon par 'du byed pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang /
analyzed: theg pa dman pas mya ngan las 'da' ba dang / mtshan ma rgya chen po la kun tu spyod pa dang ; mtshan ma phra mo la kun tu spyod pa dang / mtshan ma med par mngon par 'du byed pa dang sems can gyi don byed pa la mngon par 'du byed pa med pa dang /
translated: The inferior vehicle is nirvāṇa, the extensive signs are the practice of the extensive signs, the subtle signs are the practice of the subtle signs, the signless is the formation of the signless, and the non-formation in the benefit of sentient beings is the non-formation in the benefit of sentient beings.

original: thob par bya ba'i chos la gtso bor bya ba med pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i chos la gtso bor bya ba med pa'o //
translated: The Dharma to be attained is the foremost activity.

original: de la sngon du 'gro ba'i don las brtsams pa ni chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: de la sngon du 'gro ba'i don las brtsams pa ni chos kyi dbyings kun tu 'gro ba ste /
translated: Regarding this, the meaning of the preliminary is the all-pervasiveness of the dharmadhātu.

original: 'di ltar chos gang yang bdag med pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar chos gang yang bdag med pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'o //
translated: Thus, there is no Dharma that is not the identity of selflessness.

original: mchog gi don zhes bya bas ni de ni sa gnyis pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mchog gi don zhes bya bas ni de ni sa gnyis pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The meaning of supreme is the wisdom of the second ground.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i don gyi mchog ni gong du theg pa chen po'i chos bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i don gyi mchog ni gong du theg pa chen po'i chos bstan pa'i rgyu mthun pa'o //
translated: The supreme of the concordant meaning is the concordance with the teaching of the Mahāyāna Dharma above.

original: mchog ces bya ba ni sa gsum par gyur pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: mchog ces bya ba ni sa gsum par gyur pa'i ye shes so //
translated: The meaning of supreme is the wisdom that has become the third ground.

original: gang la bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pa de ni kun tu 'dzin pa can te /
analyzed: gang la bdag tu 'dzin pa yod pa de ni kun tu 'dzin pa can te /
translated: Whoever has the notion of self is one who grasps.

original: ji ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan no //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag tu 'dzin pa med pa ni byang gi sgra mi snyan no //
translated: The absence of the notion of self is like that of the Uttarakurus.

original: de la 'di ltar bu'i chos kyi dbyings thob par gyur ba ni gang la yang bdag gir 'dzin pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la 'di ltar bu'i chos kyi dbyings thob par gyur ba ni gang la yang bdag gir 'dzin pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Therein, the attainment of the realm of Dharma, which is like a son, is not the arising of the notion of mine.

original: 'di ltar de lta bu'i ye shes ni bzhin pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar de lta bu'i ye shes ni bzhin pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, such gnosis arises from the womb.

original: de nyid rgyu tha dad pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid rgyu tha dad pa med pa ste /
translated: That itself is the absence of a difference in cause.

original: ji ltar mig la sogs pa sems can so so la yod pa rnams nyid tha dad pa ma yi par shes pa de ni lnga pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar mig la sogs pa sems can so so la yod pa rnams nyid tha dad pa ma yi par shes pa de ni lnga pa'o //
translated: Just as the eyes, etc., which exist in each sentient being are not different, so is the fifth.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yi pa ste dag pa nyid kyi ye shes de ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa ni rang bzhin gyis kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yin pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa ma yi pa ste dag pa nyid kyi ye shes de ni drug pa'o //
translated: The absence of defilement is the absence of defilement because it is not naturally defiled. That pure gnosis is the sixth.

original: mdo sde la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi don tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi ye shes ni bdun pa'o //
analyzed: mdo sde la sogs pa sna tshogs kyi don tha dad pa med pa nyid kyi ye shes ni bdun pa'o //
translated: The seventh is the knowledge that the meaning of the various scriptures, such as the Sutras, is not different.

original: de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa bri ba med cing sbel bas rnam par byang ba la 'phel med pa dang / rgyu mtshan la dbang ba'i gnas dang / zhing la dbang ba'i gnas shes pa de ni brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa bri ba med cing sbel bas rnam par byang ba la 'phel med pa dang / rgyu mtshan la dbang ba'i gnas dang / zhing la dbang ba'i gnas shes pa de ni brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eighth is the knowledge that the purification of the elimination of the passions is without decrease or increase, and the knowledge that the bases of mastery are the bases of mastery over the signs and the bases of mastery over the field.

original: de la mtshan la dbang ba ni 'di ltar de 'dod par gyur na mtshan ma de mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan la dbang ba ni 'di ltar de 'dod par gyur na mtshan ma de mngon sum du byed par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: In this context, mastery over the signs means that one can make the signs appear at will.

original: zhing la dbang ba ni ji ltar gser gyi rang bzhin du sgyur bar 'dod na yang der 'gyur ba de ni de la dbang pa'o //
analyzed: zhing la dbang ba ni ji ltar gser gyi rang bzhin du sgyur bar 'dod na yang der 'gyur ba de ni de la dbang pa'o //
translated: Mastery over the field means that one can transform it into gold, etc., at will.

original: so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas ni dgu pa'o //🔽lus la sogs pa'i las la dbang ba'i gnas @169a * //
analyzed: so so yang dag par rig pa'i ye shes la dbang ba'i gnas ni dgu pa'o // lus la sogs pa'i las la dbang ba'i gnas @169a * //
translated: The ninth is the base of the knowledge of the analytical knowledges.

original: ni bcu pa'o //
analyzed: ni bcu pa'o //
translated: The tenth is the base of mastery over action, such as the transformation of objects.

original: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba nyid kyi gnas kyi don kyang bcu pa ste /
analyzed: gzungs dang ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo la dbang ba nyid kyi gnas kyi don kyang bcu pa ste /
translated: The tenth is the meaning of the abode, which is mastery over the doors of retention and concentration.

original: ma rig pa 'di yang nyan thos rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa 'di yang nyan thos rnams kyis ni nyon mongs pa can ma yin te /
translated: This ignorance is not afflicted for sravakas,

original: gang gi phyir de dag sa la mi 'jug pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag sa la mi 'jug pas so //
translated: because they do not enter the levels.

original: dang po nyid kyis thams cad rab tu rtogs par gyur na /
analyzed: dang po nyid kyis thams cad rab tu rtogs par gyur na /
translated: If they fully comprehend all at the very outset,🔽why do they posit the individual stages?

original: yang ci'i phyir so so'i rim pa gzhag par byed ces rgol ba la des lan gdab pa'i phyir gang la gnas pa'i gnas pa de'i dbang gis sa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir so so'i rim pa gzhag par byed ces rgol ba la des lan gdab pa'i phyir gang la gnas pa'i gnas pa de'i dbang gis sa rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: In response to this objection, in order to respond, the levels are posited by the power of the abodes that are the bases.

original: ji ltar dang po nyid kyis thams cad yang dag par so sor rtogs na ci'i phyir dang po la rab tu dga' ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar dang po nyid kyis thams cad yang dag par so sor rtogs na ci'i phyir dang po la rab tu dga' ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: If they fully comprehend all at the very outset, why is the first called the very joyful?

original: 'di ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi don yang dag par bsgrub pa'i nus pa de'i tshe dang thob pa yin pas so //
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag dang gzhan gyi don yang dag par bsgrub pa'i nus pa de'i tshe dang thob pa yin pas so //
translated: Because at that time they obtain the ability to accomplish the welfare of both self and other.

original: yang nyan thos rnams kyis de kho na nyid du mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na ni bdag gi don yang dag par bsgrub pa'i nus pa ni thob kyi /
analyzed: yang nyan thos rnams kyis de kho na nyid du mngon par rtogs pa'i dus na ni bdag gi don yang dag par bsgrub pa'i nus pa ni thob kyi /
translated: Moreover, when the śrāvakas have realized reality, they have attained the ability to accomplish their own goal.

original: de dag gis gzhan gyi don gyis ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: de dag gis gzhan gyi don gyis ni ma yin pas /
translated: But they do not have the ability to accomplish the goals of others,

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ji lta bu de lta bu'i dga' ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ji lta bu de lta bu'i dga' ba 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: so they do not experience the joy that bodhisattvas do.

original: ci'i phyir dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis de rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims can du gyur pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dri ma med pa zhes bya ba ni gang gis de rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims can du gyur pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: Why is it called stainless? It is because they become naturally moral,

original: dang po bzhin du so sor brtags pa'i tshul khrims can ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang po bzhin du so sor brtags pa'i tshul khrims can ni ma yin no //
translated: not just moral through reflection as they were before.

original: des na 'di thar 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma ring du byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na 'di thar 'tshal ba'i tshul khrims kyi dri ma ring du byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, since this morality removes the stain of desire for liberation,

original: de ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims can nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims can nyid yin no //
translated: they become naturally moral.

original: gang gi phyir sa gsum pa la 'od byed pa'o zhes bya zhes na 'di ltar de ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa de las 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sa gsum pa la 'od byed pa'o zhes bya zhes na 'di ltar de ni ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa de las 'bral bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Why is the third ground called The Luminous? Because, in this way, one does not separate from the meditative stabilization,

original: de las nyams pa med pa na theg pa chen po'i chos kyi snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: de las nyams pa med pa na theg pa chen po'i chos kyi snang ba 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: and because the light of the Mahāyāna Dharma arises, since there is no falling away from it.

original: gang gi phyir bzhi ba la 'od 'phro ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bzhi ba la 'od 'phro ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the fourth ground called The Radiant?

original: 'di ltar de yas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag la gnas par gyur ba na ;
analyzed: 'di ltar de yas byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos de dag la gnas par gyur ba na ;
translated: Because, in this way, one who has become established in those dharmas that are factors of enlightenment

original: de la gnas par gyur ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg par byed pas so //
analyzed: de la gnas par gyur ba nyid kyis nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad sreg par byed pas so //
translated: burns up all the afflictions and secondary afflictions, just by being established in them.

original: ci'i phyir sa lnga pa la shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya bas zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa lnga pa la shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya bas zhe na /
translated: Why is the fifth ground called Hard to Overcome?

original: gang gis de bden par shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang bstan bcos la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa kun tu sgrub par byed pa na de dag 'gal bas shin tu dka' ba dang / de gnyis 'gal ba yang mngon par sgrub par byed pa na sdug bsngal bas shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis de bden par shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i bzo dang bstan bcos la sogs pa rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa kun tu sgrub par byed pa na de dag 'gal bas shin tu dka' ba dang / de gnyis 'gal ba yang mngon par sgrub par byed pa na sdug bsngal bas shin tu sbyang dka' ba zhes bya'o //
translated: And when one accomplishes those two that are contradictory, that is very difficult to train in because it is painful.

original: yang gang gi phyir drug pa la mngon du gyur ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang gi phyir drug pa la mngon du gyur ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the sixth called the manifest?

original: 'di ltar des rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa la @169b gnas par gyur pa na //
analyzed: 'di ltar des rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba shes pa la @169b gnas par gyur pa na //
translated: Because when one abides in the knowledge of dependent origination,

original: de nas de rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos na yin rnam par dag pa'i chos kyang ma yin /
analyzed: de nas de rnam par mi rtog pa la gnas pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya bas kun nas nyon mongs pa'i chos na yin rnam par dag pa'i chos kyang ma yin /
translated: then by the power of the wisdom of non-conceptual abiding, the so-called perfection of wisdom, one sees that afflicted phenomena are neither pure nor impure,

original: bdun pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang ldan pa dang / brgyad pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur pas so /
analyzed: bdun pa mngon par 'du byed pa dang ldan pa dang / brgyad pa mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la mngon du phyogs par gyur pas so /
translated: The seventh is endowed with manifest activity; the eighth is directed to the absence of manifest activity.

original: ci'i phyir sa bdun pa la ring du song ba zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa bdun pa la ring du song ba zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the seventh stage called Gone Afar?

original: 'di ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa de'i mthar 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin pa dang / gang gi phyir mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par gyur bas so //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i spyod pa de'i mthar 'gro bar 'gyur ba yin pa dang / gang gi phyir mtshan ma thams cad kyis mi bskyod pas mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas par gyur bas so //
translated: Because it is the culmination of the practice that is born of application, and because it is endowed with manifest activity, since it cannot be shaken by any sign.

original: ci'i phyir sa brgyad pa la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa brgyad pa la mi g-yo ba zhes bya ba zhe na /
translated: Why is the eighth stage called the Immovable?

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis bskyod par mi nus pa ste /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / mngon par 'du byed pa thams cad kyis bskyod par mi nus pa ste /
translated: Because it cannot be shaken by the signless or by any manifest activity.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the stage of direct engagement, because it is entered spontaneously, and because it is free of discursive thought.

original: ci'i phyir sa dgu pa la legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa dgu pa la legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the ninth stage called Good Intelligence?

original: legs pa'i blo ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
analyzed: legs pa'i blo ni legs pa'i blo gros te /
translated: Good intelligence is good understanding.

original: 'dir so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'dir blo gros kyi sgras bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir so so yang dag par rig pa ni 'dir blo gros kyi sgras bstan te /
translated: Here, the analytical knowledges are indicated by the word “intellect.”

original: ye shes de ni 'dir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ye shes de ni 'dir legs pa'i blo gros zhes bya'o //
translated: That wisdom is called “good intellect.”

original: ci'i phyir sa bcu pa la chos kyi sprin zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sa bcu pa la chos kyi sprin zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why is the tenth stage called the Cloud of Dharma?

original: gang gis chos thams cad bsdus pa la dmigs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad bsdus pa la dmigs pa'o //
translated: It is the objective support for the gathering of all dharmas.

original: 'di ltar de la ye shes ni sprin lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar de la ye shes ni sprin lta bu'o //
translated: Thus, in this stage, wisdom is like a cloud.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni char gyi chu lta bu'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs kyi sgo rnams ni char gyi chu lta bu'o //
translated: The doors of concentration and retention are like rain.

original: de yang ye shes de'i khong na gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de yang ye shes de'i khong na gnas pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is located within that wisdom.

original: 'di ltar nam mkha' sprin gyis khebs par byas nas gnas pa ltar 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis kyang sgrib pa rgya chen po rnams mi mngon par byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar nam mkha' sprin gyis khebs par byas nas gnas pa ltar 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis kyang sgrib pa rgya chen po rnams mi mngon par byed do //
translated: Thus, just as a cloud covers the sky and remains there, so the wisdom that has the mixed dharmas as its object makes the great obscurations invisible.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sprin gyis nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa ltar chos kyi skus byang chub sems dpa'i rten la rgyas par 'gengs so //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sprin gyis nam mkha' rgyas par 'gengs pa ltar chos kyi skus byang chub sems dpa'i rten la rgyas par 'gengs so //
translated: In order to perfect the Dharma Body means that just as clouds fill the entire sky, the Dharma Body fills the entire support of the Bodhisattva.

original: 'dir 'gengs pa ni spros pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir 'gengs pa ni spros pa'o //
translated: Here, filling is elaboration.

original: 'grub pas thob pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang gis sa 'di rnams bsgom pa las mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'grub pas thob pa ni zhes bya ba ni gang gis sa 'di rnams bsgom pa las mthar phyin par 'gyur ba'o zhes blta bar bya'o //
translated: Attainment by acquisition means that one should see that these stages are perfected through the cultivation of meditation.

original: ji ltar sa 'di dag re re zhing bsgom par sgom par 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba ni sa rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: ji ltar sa 'di dag re re zhing bsgom par sgom par 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ba ni sa rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: The teaching on how each of these stages is cultivated in meditation is in five parts:

original: yang de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag bsgom pa na de dag gnyi ga yang rnam pa lngas bsgoms te /
analyzed: yang de ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong dag bsgom pa na de dag gnyi ga yang rnam pa lngas bsgoms te /
translated: Moreover, when tranquility and insight are cultivated, both are cultivated in five ways.

original: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi gnas skabs thams cad 'jig par byed @170a * //
analyzed: skad cig re re la gnas ngan len gyi gnas skabs thams cad 'jig par byed @170a * //
translated: In each moment, all the conditions of negative tendencies are destroyed.

original: pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gnas ngan len zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi bag chags zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gnas ngan len zhes bya ba nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa'i sa bon thog ma med pa'i dus can gyi bag chags zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The term “pa” means that which is called “negative reflex,” the seeds of the afflictive obstructions and the obstructions to omniscience, the predispositions that have existed since beginningless time.🔽The collection of those obstructions is called “destruction” because it weakens the wisdom of serenity and insight that focuses on mixed phenomena in each instant,

original: sgrib pa de'i tshogs de ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ye shes kyi skad cig re re la stobs chung bar byed pa'am /
analyzed: sgrib pa de'i tshogs de ni 'dres pa'i chos la dmigs pa'i zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gi ye shes kyi skad cig re re la stobs chung bar byed pa'am /
translated: or because it destroys the collection of wisdom.

original: tshogs 'jig par byed pa ni 'dir 'jig par byed par bzhed do //🔽yang stobs chung bar byed pa ni 'jig par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs 'jig par byed pa ni 'dir 'jig par byed par bzhed do // yang stobs chung bar byed pa ni 'jig par byed pa'o //
translated: Here, “destroys” means “destroys.”

original: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: sna tshogs kyi 'du shes dang bral ba ste /
translated: It is free from the perception of multiplicity.🔽It is the attainment of joy in the joy of Dharma.

original: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob pa dang zhes bya ba la phyogs bcur rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba rab tu shes pa ste /
analyzed: chos kyi kun dga' la dga' ba thob pa dang zhes bya ba la phyogs bcur rnam pa yongs su ma chad pa'i chos kyi snang ba rab tu shes pa ste /
translated: It is the knowledge of the light of Dharma that is not limited in the ten directions,

original: gzhung ba ton legs par byang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhung ba ton legs par byang ba bzhin no //
translated: like a well-written text.

original: rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba la dgos pa yongs su grub pa dang rab tu ldan pa ni 'di'i rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan rnam
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan ma rnam par brtags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba zhes bya ba la dgos pa yongs su grub pa dang rab tu ldan pa ni 'di'i rnam par dag pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i mtshan rnam
translated: The non-imagined signs that are conducive to purification arise in him.

original: par brtags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: par brtags pa ma yin pa rnams de la kun tu 'byung ba ste /
translated: The non-imagined signs that are conducive to purification arise in him, who is endowed with the accomplishment of the purpose.

original: 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ni dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: 'dir sangs rgyas nyid ni dgongs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'o zhes 'dod do //
translated: Here, Buddhahood is considered to be the fulfillment of the intention.🔽In order to perfect and to accomplish the Dharma Body, he takes up the causes that are higher than the high.

original: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni de la yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa bcu pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku yongs su rdzogs pa dang yongs su grub par bya ba'i phyir gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin par byed ces bya ba ni de la yongs su rdzogs pa ni sa bcu pa'o //
translated: Here, the perfection is the tenth stage.

original: yongs su grub pa ni bcu gcig pas sangs rgyas kyis sa la chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su grub pa ni bcu gcig pas sangs rgyas kyis sa la chos kyi sku yongs su grub pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the eleventh, the stage of the Buddha, where the Dharma Body is accomplished.

original: gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyu de las kyang sangs rgyas kyis sa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gong ma bas ches gong ma'i rgyu yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar rgyu de las kyang sangs rgyas kyis sa'i bar du 'jug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The cause that is superior to the superior is the cause that is superior to the cause of the first ground, which is the cause of the second ground, and so on.

original: gtsor ni sa bcu dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sgom par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gtsor ni sa bcu dag tu pha rol tu phyin pa bcu sgom par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The ten perfections are cultivated in the ten grounds.

original: 'di ltar sa bcu pa las 'byung ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sa bcu pa las 'byung ba bzhin du ste /
translated: This is because, as it says in the Ten Grounds Sutra,

original: dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par 'jug pa nas ji srid bcu pa la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gtso bor 'jug pas na bcu po dag tu bcu bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par 'jug pa nas ji srid bcu pa la ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i bar gtso bor 'jug pas na bcu po dag tu bcu bstan pa yin la /
translated: on the first ground, the perfection of generosity is cultivated to a greater degree than the others, and on the tenth ground, the perfection of wisdom is cultivated to a greater degree than the others.🔽Thus, the ten perfections are taught in the ten grounds.

original: 'di ltar yangs thams cad la thams cad kyang bsgom par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar yangs thams cad la thams cad kyang bsgom par bya ba yin no //
translated: However, all ten perfections are cultivated on all ten grounds.

original: drug tu ni drug ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: drug tu ni drug ces bya ba ni go rims bzhin bstan pa yin te /
translated: The six perfections are taught in six grounds in the order in which they are taught.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa phyi nas bstan la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa phyi nas bstan la /
translated: Thus, the perfection of generosity is taught first,

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du bstan pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa sngon du bstan pa lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not like the perfection of wisdom, which is taught first.

original: phyi ma bzhi ni ji ltar bstan par bya ba bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma bzhi ni ji ltar bstan par bya ba bzhi pa'o //
translated: The latter four are the four things that are to be done, as they are taught.

original: gong du pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa bstan pa der thabs la @170b mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag kyang 'dus par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: gong du pha rol tu phyin pa drug pa bstan pa der thabs la @170b mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa bzhi po dag kyang 'dus par 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: In the above, the six perfections are taught. Therein, the four perfections beginning with skillful means are included.

original: gang yang bcur bstan pa der ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang bcur bstan pa der ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyid ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: In the ten perfections that are taught, the perfection of wisdom is nonconceptual wisdom itself.

original: de'i rjes la thob pas bsdus pa nyid pas ni de las gzhan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes la thob pas bsdus pa nyid pas ni de las gzhan pa'i thabs la mkhas pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin par 'gyur ro //
translated: The other perfections, such as skillful means, are included in the subsequent attainment.

original: des na phyi ma rnams la 'di dag sgom par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na phyi ma rnams la 'di dag sgom par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, these are cultivated in the latter perfections.

original: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba de ston par byed pa na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa ni zhes bya ba de ston par byed pa na sems can thams cad dang thun mong du zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of skill in means is taught by “in common with all sentient beings” and so on.

original: de la thun mong nyid ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams sems can rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la thun mong nyid ni dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams sems can rnams la ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung bar byed pa'o //
translated: Therein, the commonality is that the roots of virtue are accumulated for sentient beings just as they are.

original: de yang bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang bstan par bya ste /
translated: And that should be taught.

original: gang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pas byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'dod pas byang chub mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes bya ba de lta bu'i bsam pa dang mthun pa'o //
translated: “Whoever desires to attain unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment should fully awaken to enlightenment and then work for the welfare of all sentient beings.” Such is the thought that is in accord with that.

original: des na gang su dag de lta bu'i sems dang / de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo bas sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes bya ba des ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong du thabs la mkhas pa'i shes rab dang snying rje dag bstan te /
analyzed: des na gang su dag de lta bu'i sems dang / de lta bu'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su bsngo bas sems can thams cad kyi don bya'o zhes bya ba des ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong du thabs la mkhas pa'i shes rab dang snying rje dag bstan te /
translated: By this, he shows the wisdom and compassion that are shared in common with all sentient beings, and the skill in means.

original: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams snying rjes ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byed do //
analyzed: 'di ltar pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis dge ba'i rtsa ba bsags pa rnams snying rjes ni sems can thams cad dang thun mong du byed do //
translated: Thus, by compassion, the roots of merit that are collected by the six perfections are shared in common with all sentient beings.

original: shes rab kyis ni brgya byin la sogs pa nyid du yang yongs su sngo bar mi byed do //
analyzed: shes rab kyis ni brgya byin la sogs pa nyid du yang yongs su sngo bar mi byed do //
translated: By wisdom, he does not dedicate them even to the state of Sakra, etc.

original: des nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: des nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Then, the afflictions do not arise,

original: yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yongs su shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are fully understood.

original: 'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la /
analyzed: 'khor ba yang yongs su mi gtong la /
translated: And he does not abandon cyclic existence,

original: der yang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni thabs la mkhas par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: der yang kun nas nyon mongs pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur ba ni thabs la mkhas par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: and the afflictions do not arise there. This is skill in means.

original: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thabs la mkhas pa'o //
translated: This is skill in means.

original: gang smon lam sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen sdud pa de lta bu ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las yin te /
analyzed: gang smon lam sna tshogs kyi rgyu'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen sdud pa de lta bu ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las yin te /
translated: The action of the perfection of vows is the attraction of the conditions for the various perfections through the power of various vow-causes.

original: smon lam nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: smon lam nyid kyi pha rol tu phyin pa ni smon lam gyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The perfection of vows itself is the perfection of vows.

original: phyin ma la zhes bya ba la phyi ma'i rgyu mtshan ni phyi ma ste 'di ni rgyu mtshan bdun pa yin te /
analyzed: phyin ma la zhes bya ba la phyi ma'i rgyu mtshan ni phyi ma ste 'di ni rgyu mtshan bdun pa yin te /
translated: The future is the sign of the future. This is the seventh reason.

original: de'i tshe smon lam sna tshogs bsgom pas des ni phyi ma la 'di dag rnams sgom par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe smon lam sna tshogs bsgom pas des ni phyi ma la 'di dag rnams sgom par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: At that time, one cultivates various vows. By that, one cultivates these in the future.

original: de'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen sdud pa 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i dbang gis pha rol tu phyin pa sna tshogs kyi rkyen sdud pa 'thob bo //
translated: By the power of that, one attains the attraction of the conditions for the various perfections.

original: mdo gzhan las stobs gnyis bstan pa ni @171a * //
analyzed: mdo gzhan las stobs gnyis bstan pa ni @171a * //
translated: The teaching of two powers in another sutra is

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bsgom pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bsgom pa'i stobs so //
translated: the power of discernment and the power of cultivation.

original: yang gal te bsgom pa'i stobs med pa ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gal te bsgom pa'i stobs med pa ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: If there is no power of cultivation, one engages by the power of discernment.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan nas pha rol tu phyin pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa gang gis pha rol tu phyin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan nas pha rol tu phyin pa rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: By which perfections does one, having overcome the resistances to the perfections, cause the perfections to arise uninterruptedly?

original: 'di dag ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: These are the perfections of power.

original: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las gang yin pa de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i las gang yin pa de bstan par bya ste /
translated: The function of the perfection of knowledge should be explained.

original: ye shes des ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa rnam par 'jog pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes des ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pa gang yin pa rnam par 'jog pa ste /
translated: By that knowledge, one establishes the perfection of the nonconceptual intuition which is the essence of the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gis chos la longs spyod pa myong ba dang / lhan cig tu chos dang ldan pa'i don dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i don yang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos la longs spyod pa myong ba dang / lhan cig tu chos dang ldan pa'i don dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i don yang ye shes kyi pha rol tu phyin pas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: By that one experiences the enjoyment of the Dharma, and the meaning of the Dharma, and the meaning of the evolutionary development of living beings, is established by the perfection of knowledge.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs de pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs de pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because that Dharma method is included in the Piṭaka of the Perfections.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod ni theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad do //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod ni theg pa chen po'i chos thams cad do //
translated: Therein, the Piṭaka of the Perfections is all the teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: sa bcu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod nyid yin gyi nyan thos kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sa bcu pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs 'di yang pha rol tu phyin pa'i sde snod nyid yin gyi nyan thos kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: And this Dharma method of the tenth stage is just the Piṭaka of the Perfections, not that of the Disciples.

original: de bsdus pa nyid kyi yang phyir na yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bsgom pa ni sa thams cad la 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bsdus pa nyid kyi yang phyir na yang pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad bsgom pa ni sa thams cad la 'byung bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: And because it is included in that, the cultivation of all the perfections occurs on all the stages.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byams thams cad du sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad kyis kyang rab tu bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir sa 'di rnams ni shin tu mchog tu gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs de ni yul gyi mchog nyid du bstan la
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing rab 'byams thams cad du sangs rgyas byung ba thams cad kyis kyang rab tu bsgoms pa yin pa'i phyir sa 'di rnams ni shin tu mchog tu gyur pa nyid yin pa'i phyir chos kyi rnam grangs de ni yul gyi mchog nyid du bstan la
translated: Because all the Buddhas who have appeared in all the infinite Buddha-fields have also cultivated these stages, they are extremely supreme. Therefore, that Dharma method is taught as the supreme object,

original: dang por bstan pa yang yin no //
analyzed: dang por bstan pa yang yin no //
translated: and it is also the first teaching.

original: yang yul de ni shin tu gnas par gyur pa yin pa dang / nye ba na gnas pa'i yul gzhan gyi gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis de ni mchog yin no //
analyzed: yang yul de ni shin tu gnas par gyur pa yin pa dang / nye ba na gnas pa'i yul gzhan gyi gtso bor gyur pa nyid kyis de ni mchog yin no //
translated: Moreover, that object is extremely stable and is the best because it is the principal object that is present.

original: gang zag lnga ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang zag lnga ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis rdzogs par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Five persons are completed by three incalculable eons.

original: de la re zhig mos pas spyod pas na mos pas spyod pa ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig mos pas spyod pas na mos pas spyod pa ste /
translated: Among them, one who practices through faith is one who practices through faith.

original: de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sa bskal pa grangs med pa gcig gis rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: He is completed by one incalculable eon of the stage of practice through faith.

original: gang yongs su rdzogs pas ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / de kho na nyid so sor rig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yongs su rdzogs pas ni lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / de kho na nyid so sor rig par 'gyur ro //
translated: By perfecting that, the superior intention becomes pure and one realizes reality.

original: de ni yang sa bcu po thams cad du lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas spyod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni yang sa bcu po thams cad du lhag pa'i bsam pa rnam par dag pas spyod par 'gyur ro //
translated: He then practices through the purity of the superior intention on all ten stages.

original: de ni yang sa drug pa la ni mtshan ma dang @171b bcas par spyod do //
analyzed: de ni yang sa drug pa la ni mtshan ma dang @171b bcas par spyod do //
translated: He then practices with signs on the sixth stage.

original: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med par spyod cing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bdun pa la ni mtshan ma med par spyod cing mngon par 'du byed pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: On the seventh, he practices signlessness but with effort.

original: grangs med pa gnyis pas grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: grangs med pa gnyis pas grub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: He accomplishes it by the second incalculable eon.

original: brgyad pa la zhugs pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: brgyad pa la zhugs pa ni mngon par 'du byed pa med pa yin te /
translated: On the eighth, he practices without effort,

original: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: but he has not perfected the practice without effort.

original: ; mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni dgu pa dang bcu pa la yin te /
analyzed: ; mngon par 'du byed pa med pa la spyod pa yongs su rdzogs pa nyid ni dgu pa dang bcu pa la yin te /
translated: He perfects the practice without effort on the ninth and tenth stages.

original: gang zag de'i ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas so //
analyzed: gang zag de'i ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum pas so //
translated: He accomplishes it by the third incalculable eon.

original: de lta bu dag ni gang zag gcig la rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i khyad par gzhan rnam par lngar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni gang zag gcig la rgyun du zhugs pa dang / lan cig phyir 'ong ba dang / phyir mi 'ong ba rnam par gzhag pa bzhin du rnam par gzhag pa'i khyad par gzhan rnam par lngar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Such persons are classified as five types, like the classification of stream-enterers, once-returners, and nonreturners.

original: gang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa de thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'khor ba na gnas pa'i tshe sbyin pa la sogs pa byin pas kyang 'di ltar sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang phrad par gyur
analyzed: gang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis byang chub sems dpa' bsgom pa rdzogs par 'gyur zhes bstan pa de thog ma med pa'i dus nas 'khor ba na gnas pa'i tshe sbyin pa la sogs pa byin pas kyang 'di ltar sangs rgyas 'byung ba dang phrad par gyur
translated: The three incalculable eons are taught to be the time required for a bodhisattva to complete the path of meditation. But since the bodhisattva has practiced generosity and so on in cyclic existence from beginningless time, he has met with the appearance of buddhas and has received their instructions.

original: pas gang de lta bu'i bskal pa grangs med pa gsum po de dang po gang nas brtsams nas bstan pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: pas gang de lta bu'i bskal pa grangs med pa gsum po de dang po gang nas brtsams nas bstan pa yin zhe na /
translated: So from what point are the three incalculable eons counted?

original: de tshigs su bcad pas bstan par bya ste /🔽bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang // zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de tshigs su bcad pas bstan par bya ste / bzang dang smon pa'i stobs can dang // zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is indicated in the following verse.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can du 'gyur ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs can du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can du 'gyur ba dang / smon lam gyi stobs can du 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has the power of virtue and the power of prayer

original: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la dge ba'i rtsa ba'i stobs can ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva who has the power of virtue is not overcome by counteragents.

original: smon lam gyi stobs kyis ni rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa yin par blta bar bya'o //🔽sems brtan khyad par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: smon lam gyi stobs kyis ni rtag tu dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa yin par blta bar bya'o // sems brtan khyad par 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: By the power of aspiration, one should see that one always meets with spiritual friends.🔽The steadfastness of mind and the progress are

original: sems bskyed pa brtan pa can du 'gyur ba dang khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sems bskyed pa brtan pa can du 'gyur ba dang khyad par du 'gro bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: the steadfastness of the generation of the Thought and the progress.

original: de la sems bskyed pa brtan pa ni /
analyzed: de la sems bskyed pa brtan pa ni /
translated: Therein, the steadfastness of the generation of the Thought

original: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi dbang gis byang chub kyi sems yongs su mi gtong bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: is to be seen as the non-abandonment of the Thought of Enlightenment by the power of the spiritual friend.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba nyid ni skye ba gzhan dang gzhan du mthong ba'i chos nyid la dge ba rnams 'phel bar 'gyur zhing nyams par mi 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba nyid ni skye ba gzhan dang gzhan du mthong ba'i chos nyid la dge ba rnams 'phel bar 'gyur zhing nyams par mi 'gyur bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: The progress is to be seen as the increase of the virtues in this very life and the non-decrease of them in other lives.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: ji ltar byas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa nyan thos la sogs pa dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa nyan thos la sogs pa dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that the training of the Bodhisattvas is superior to that of the Sravakas, etc.?

original: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: The superiority of the division

original: 'di ltar nyan thos rnams la ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims gcig pu yod kyi dge @172a * //🔽ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyang ma yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos rnams la ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims gcig pu yod kyi dge @172a * // ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyang ma yin /
translated: Thus, the śrāvakas have only the morality of restraint,🔽not the morality of acquiring virtue,🔽and not the morality of benefitting sentient beings.🔽The morality of acquiring virtue is superior to the morality of restraint.

original: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyang ma yin no //🔽thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la /🔽de la rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni thun mong gi'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don byed pa'i tshul khrims kyang ma yin no // thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la / de la rang bzhin gyis kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa srog gcod pa la sogs pa ni thun mong gi'o //
translated: The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of acquiring virtue is superior to the morality of restraint.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.

original: sa brko ba dang rtsva gcod pa la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: sa brko ba dang rtsva gcod pa la sogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.

original: gang yang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bslab pa phyi ma rnams so //
analyzed: gang yang bcas pa'i kha na ma tho ba'i bslab pa phyi ma rnams so //
translated: The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.🔽The morality of benefitting sentient beings is superior to the morality of acquiring virtue.

original: nyan thos kyi ltung bar 'gyur ba de la byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbyar gyi nang du nyan thos rnams song bar gyur na ltung ba yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ltung bar 'gyur ba de la byang chub sems dpa'i ltung ba med do zhes bya ba ni ji ltar dbyar gyi nang du nyan thos rnams song bar gyur na ltung ba yin no //
translated: The morality of benefitting sentient beings is

original: sems can gyi don mthong la ma song na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ltung ba yin la /
analyzed: sems can gyi don mthong la ma song na byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ltung ba yin la /
translated: If he sees that it is for the benefit of sentient beings, but does not go, it is a downfall for bodhisattvas.

original: song na ni ltung ba med do //
analyzed: song na ni ltung ba med do //
translated: If he goes, there is no downfall.

original: kha na ma tho ba med par sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la kha na ma tho ba med pas phan 'dogs par byed kyi /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med par sems can thams cad la phan 'dogs pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad la kha na ma tho ba med pas phan 'dogs par byed kyi /
translated: “Without reproach, he benefits all sentient beings” means that he benefits all sentient beings without reproach.

original: ji ltar bud med khyer la shog ces bya ba lta bus ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar bud med khyer la shog ces bya ba lta bus ni ma yin te /
translated: He does not do it by saying, for example, “Bring me a woman,”

original: gang gi phyir yang de ni gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba yin pas kha na ma tho ba med par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gi phyir yang de ni gzhan gyis yongs su gzung ba yin pas kha na ma tho ba med par yang ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: because in that case, how could it be without reproach, since she belongs to someone else?

original: de bas na de dang 'dra ba'i don gzhan yang yongs su spangs la kha na ma tho ba med pas phan gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na de dang 'dra ba'i don gzhan yang yongs su spangs la kha na ma tho ba med pas phan gdags par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he should avoid other similar things and benefit them without reproach.

original: sems kyi ltung ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod ba dang gnod sems la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ltung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sems kyi ltung ba zhes bya ba ni gang 'dod ba dang gnod sems la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ltung ba yin gyi /
translated: “Mental downfalls” are thoughts of desire, malice, and so on, which are downfalls for bodhisattvas.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi ni ma yin no //
translated: but not for the śrāvakas.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sogs pa gsum ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sogs pa gsum ni pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If the three trainings in higher morality, etc. are in essence the perfections,

original: ci'i phyir de pha rol tu phyin pa las tha dad du rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de pha rol tu phyin pa las tha dad du rnam par gzhag par bya zhe na /
translated: why are they established separately from the perfections?

original: gang gi phyir tha dad du rnam par gzhag par bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir tha dad du rnam par gzhag par bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
translated: We will show why they are established separately.

original: 'di ltar bslab pa rnams phan tshun rgyu'i ngo bo rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bslab pa rnams phan tshun rgyu'i ngo bo rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Thus the trainings are established as having each other as their nature.

original: tshul khrims la brten nas ni /
analyzed: tshul khrims la brten nas ni /
translated: On the basis of morality,

original: bsam gtan bskyed par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan bskyed par bya ba yin no //
translated: one should generate meditative concentration.

original: bsam gtan la brten nas ni shes rab bskyed par bya ba yin no //🔽sna tshogs dang tshad med pa'i bslab pa rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas ni shes rab bskyed par bya ba yin no // sna tshogs dang tshad med pa'i bslab pa rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: On the basis of meditative concentration, one should generate wisdom.🔽The vastness of the training in the various and immeasurable perfections

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa sna tshogs pa dang tshad med pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bslab pa sna tshogs pa dang tshad med pa ste /
translated: is the various and immeasurable trainings of the bodhisattvas.

original: gang gi phyir des sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / de dag la phan 'dogs pa ni dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir des sems can yongs su smin par byed pa dang / de dag la phan 'dogs pa ni dgongs pa'o //
translated: Because he brings beings to maturity and benefits them, that is his intention.

original: bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar des sems can tshad med pa'i bsod nams @172b kyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin gyi nyan thos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams tshad med pa yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar des sems can tshad med pa'i bsod nams @172b kyi tshogs yongs su 'dzin gyi nyan thos rnams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: He takes up immeasurable merit means that he takes up the accumulation of merit of immeasurable beings, but not the Sravakas.

original: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni de la phan pa la 'god pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la phan pa dang bde bar bya ba'i bsam pa yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni de la phan pa la 'god pa ni phan pa'i bsam pa'o //
translated: He takes up the intention to bring about the welfare and happiness of all beings means that he establishes them in welfare, which is the intention of welfare.

original: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la 'bras bu ci yod pa de gang zag 'dis thob par gyur cig ces bya ba ni bde ba'i bsam pa'o //
analyzed: gang dge ba'i rtsa ba 'di la 'bras bu ci yod pa de gang zag 'dis thob par gyur cig ces bya ba ni bde ba'i bsam pa'o //
translated: Whatever fruit there is of this wholesome action, may this person obtain it means the intention of happiness.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la brten pa rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul khrims 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rten du 'gyur gyi nyan thos rnams kyi ni ma yin🔽no / // / bam po drug pa /🔽zab pa nyid ni gang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam pa de lta bus zhes bya ba de la /
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la brten pa rgya che ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir tshul khrims 'di ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi rten du 'gyur gyi nyan thos rnams kyi ni ma yin no / // / bam po drug pa / zab pa nyid ni gang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam pa de lta bus zhes bya ba de la /
translated: The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.🔽The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.🔽The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.🔽The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ba de lta bu'i thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam pa'i nus pa can du 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ste /🔽gal te re zhig 'di ltar shes te /🔽gang zag 'di ni 'dir mi dge ba mtshams med pa la sogs pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes gal te pha rol gyi sems shes par gyur na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ba de lta bu'i thabs la mkhas pa'i rnam pa'i nus pa can du 'gyur ba de bstan par bya ste / gal te re zhig 'di ltar shes te / gang zag 'di ni 'dir mi dge ba mtshams med pa la sogs pa dang ldan par bya'o zhes gal te pha rol gyi sems shes par gyur na /
translated: The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.

original: gal te de las bzlog par bya ba'i thabs gzhan med na /
analyzed: gal te de las bzlog par bya ba'i thabs gzhan med na /
translated: The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.🔽The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.🔽The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.🔽The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.🔽The profound aspect of the bodhisattva's morality is that it is the basis for the unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment, but not for the disciples' enlightenment.

original: 'di nges par 'di ltar bsad na ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di nges par 'di ltar bsad na ni bde 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur la /
translated: If I definitely kill this person, he will go to a happy rebirth.🔽If I definitely do this action, I will definitely go to a bad rebirth.

original: nges par las 'di byas na ni nges pa kho nar ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur bar shes shing de lta bur rig par gyur na /
analyzed: nges par las 'di byas na ni nges pa kho nar ngan 'gror 'gro bar 'gyur bar shes shing de lta bur rig par gyur na /
translated: Having understood and known this,

original: gang 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar sems bskyed par bya ste /
translated: I will generate the thought

original: 'di ltar yang bdag gis las 'di byas pas bdag ngan song du 'gro ba de ni 'dod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang bdag gis las 'di byas pas bdag ngan song du 'gro ba de ni 'dod kyi /
translated: “I will do this action and go to a bad rebirth, but🔽I will not apply myself to this slight present suffering and I will obtain future happiness.”

original: 'di da ltar gyi sdug bsngal cung zad la sbyar bas ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba thob par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes des 'di ltar sman pa dang 'dra ba'i sems bskyed nas bsad par gyur kyang bsod nams ma yin pa med kyi /
analyzed: 'di da ltar gyi sdug bsngal cung zad la sbyar bas ma 'ongs pa'i bde ba thob par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes des 'di ltar sman pa dang 'dra ba'i sems bskyed nas bsad par gyur kyang bsod nams ma yin pa med kyi /
translated: Having generated the thought that is like a doctor, even though I kill, I will not have demerit.

original: bsod nams nyid mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: bsod nams nyid mang du 'phel bar 'gyur te /
translated: Merit will increase.

original: gang bsod nams nyid mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba des na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang bsod nams nyid mang du 'phel bar 'gyur ba des na myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rjes su thob par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Since merit increases, I will quickly obtain unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: 'di lta bu ni shin tu zab pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni shin tu zab pa'o //
translated: This is very profound.

original: gang yang sprul pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i zab pa'i tshul khrims su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gang yang sprul pa'i lus dang ngag gi las kyang byang chub sems dpa'i zab pa'i tshul khrims su rig par bya ste /
translated: One should know that the bodhisattva’s profound morality also includes the magical creation of physical and verbal karma.

original: des rgyal srid kyang byed cing sems can la gtse ba sna tshogs bstan nas sems can 'dul ba la 'god do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des rgyal srid kyang byed cing sems can la gtse ba sna tshogs bstan nas sems can 'dul ba la 'god do zhes bya ba la /
translated: Even though he is a king, he manifests various kinds of harm to sentient beings and then establishes them in the practice of controlling the mind.

original: gang yang sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sprul pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang sprul pa'i ngo bo nyid ni sprul pa ste /
translated: The essence of a magical creation is a magical creation.

original: 'di ltar de yang rgyal po me yis gzhon nu nor bzangs la ji @173a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar de yang rgyal po me yis gzhon nu nor bzangs la ji @173a * //
translated: As King Agni declared to the youth Sudhana,

original: ltar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ltar bstan pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: “I have practiced this kind of morality.”🔽By manifesting various kinds of birth stories,

original: skyes pa'i rabs sna tshogs bstan pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thams cad sgrol gyi skyes pa'i rabs 'byung ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs sna tshogs bstan pas zhes bya ba ni ji ltar thams cad sgrol gyi skyes pa'i rabs 'byung ba lta bu ste /
translated: as in the story of Viśvantara,

original: der byang chub sems dpas bram ze la bu sbyin par gtong ba de ni sprul pa yin te /
analyzed: der byang chub sems dpas bram ze la bu sbyin par gtong ba de ni sprul pa yin te /
translated: the bodhisattva gives his children to a brahman, but they are magical creations.

original: sems can gzhan la gnod pa byed pas sems can gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni ma yin na yang /
analyzed: sems can gzhan la gnod pa byed pas sems can gzhan la phan 'dogs pa ni ma yin na yang /
translated: It is not that he benefits other sentient beings by harming other sentient beings.

original: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan la gnod pa byas nas sems can gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa 'di lta bu ni zab pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' sems can gzhan la gnod pa byas nas sems can gzhan la phan 'dogs par byed pa 'di lta bu ni zab pa yin no //
translated: But it is profound in that the bodhisattva benefits other sentient beings by harming other sentient beings.

original: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po de dag nyid ni yang 'dul ba bsgrags pa zhes bya ba shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde las brgya stong du mar bstan to //
analyzed: khyad par rnam pa bzhi po de dag nyid ni yang 'dul ba bsgrags pa zhes bya ba shin tu rgyas pa'i mdo sde las brgya stong du mar bstan to //
translated: These four kinds of superiority are taught in the sutra called the Vinaya-Upadeśa in hundreds of thousands of ways.

original: lhag pa'i sems las brtsams nas theg pa chen po'i chos las dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs kyi /
analyzed: lhag pa'i sems las brtsams nas theg pa chen po'i chos las dmigs pa zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams theg pa chen po'i chos la dmigs kyi /
translated: With regard to superior mind, the object is the Mahayana Dharma, because the bodhisattvas take the Mahayana Dharma as their object,

original: nyan thos rnams ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni ma yin no //
translated: but the śrāvakas do not.

original: theg pa chen po snang ba dang / bsod nams thams cad yang dag par bsags pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: theg pa chen po snang ba dang / bsod nams thams cad yang dag par bsags pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po zhes bya ba la /
translated: In the sutras called the Mahāyāna-āloka, the Sarva-puṇya-saṃbāra, and the Samādhi-rāja,

original: ting nge 'dzin smos pa ni 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs las gang gi phyir nyan thos rnams la ni gcig tsam yang med do //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin smos pa ni 'di lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin sna tshogs las gang gi phyir nyan thos rnams la ni gcig tsam yang med do //
translated: The mention of concentration is because the disciples do not have even one of these various concentrations.

original: gnyen pos rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por rnam par gnas pa ste ji ltar khye'u rags pa ni phra mos 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par gnas pa'i
analyzed: gnyen pos rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir sgrib pa thams cad kyi gnyen por rnam par gnas pa ste ji ltar khye'u rags pa ni phra mos 'byin par byed pa de bzhin du kun gzhi rnam par shes pa la rnam par gnas pa'i
translated: The analysis of antidotes is because it is the abode of the antidotes to all obscurations, just as a coarse grain is removed by a fine grain, so the coarse seeds of the afflicted states that abide in the container consciousness are removed by the antidote, the container consciousness.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon bag chags zhes bya ba rags pa ni gnyen po phar mos 'byin par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i sa bon bag chags zhes bya ba rags pa ni gnyen po phar mos 'byin par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “The seeds of the afflicted states that abide in the container consciousness are called perfuming and are removed by the antidote.”

original: las su rung ba nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni las su rung ba bsam gtan gang la bde bar gnas na gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba der skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: las su rung ba nyid kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni las su rung ba bsam gtan gang la bde bar gnas na gang du sems can gyi don mthong ba der skye bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The analysis of suitability for action is because the bodhisattva is born in whatever realm he sees to be suitable for the benefit of sentient beings, by means of the suitability for action of the meditative development of the superknowledges.

original: der yang bsam gtan nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der yang bsam gtan nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And he does not lose his meditative concentration there.

original: de lta bu ni nyan thos rnams la med do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni nyan thos rnams la med do //
translated: Such is not the case for the Sravakas.

original: mngon par sgrub pas rab tu dbye ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa ni mngon par shes pa bsam gtan gyis mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par sgrub pas rab tu dbye ba dang zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa ni mngon par shes pa bsam gtan gyis mngon par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The classification of the superknowledges in terms of their accomplishment is as follows: the superknowledge of the mind of another is accomplished by the concentration of being without conflict; the superknowledge of the divine eye and the superknowledge of the divine ear are accomplished by the concentration of limitless space; the superknowledge of magical power and the superknowledge of recollecting past lives are accomplished by the concentration of the sphere of nothingness.

original: las kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las kyis rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The classification of the superknowledges in terms of their action is as follows:

original: g-yo bar byed pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams g-yo bar byed pa'o 'bar bar byed pa ni de dag nyid 'bar bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo bar byed pa ni 'jig rten gyi khams rnams g-yo bar byed pa'o 'bar bar byed pa ni de dag nyid 'bar bar byed pa'o //
translated: The superknowledge of magical power has the action of moving, because it moves the world systems. It has the action of burning, because it burns the world systems with its light.

original: khyab par byed pa ni 'od kyis khyab par byed par blta @173b bar bya'o //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa ni 'od kyis khyab par byed par blta @173b bar bya'o //
translated: It has the action of pervading, because it pervades with its light.

original: ston pa ni gang gzhan gyis mi nus pa de'i 'od kyis gzhan 'jig rten gyi khams du ma'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa mthong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa ni gang gzhan gyis mi nus pa de'i 'od kyis gzhan 'jig rten gyi khams du ma'i sangs rgyas la sogs pa mthong bar byed pa'o //
translated: It has the action of revealing, because it reveals with its light the Buddhas and so on in many world systems that are otherwise invisible.

original: gzhan gyi dngos por bsgyur ba ni sa la sogs pa rnams chu nyid la sogs par bsgyur bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos por bsgyur ba ni sa la sogs pa rnams chu nyid la sogs par bsgyur bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: It has the action of transforming, because it transforms earth into water and so on.🔽The classification of the superknowledges in terms of their object is as follows: the superknowledge of the divine eye has the action of seeing all forms in the ten directions.

original: 'gro ba ni skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams du mar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni skad cig gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams du mar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going is going to many world-realms in one instant.

original: 'ong ba nyid ni de dag nyid nas so //
analyzed: 'ong ba nyid ni de dag nyid nas so //
translated: Coming is coming from those very places.

original: sdud pa ni rdul phra rab gcig gi nang du 'jig rten gyi khams du ma chud par byas na yang de la 'phel ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sdud pa ni rdul phra rab gcig gi nang du 'jig rten gyi khams du ma chud par byas na yang de la 'phel ba med pa'o //
translated: Gathering is gathering many world-realms into one atom without increasing the atom.

original: rgyas par byed pa ni rdul phra rab gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams 'gengs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par byed pa ni rdul phra rab gcig gis 'jig rten gyi khams tshad med pa rnams 'gengs par byed pa'o //
translated: Expanding is expanding one atom to fill immeasurable world-realms.

original: gzugs thams cad lus su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus la bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs su du ma thams cad ston pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs thams cad lus su 'jug pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lus la bya ba rnam pa sna tshogs su du ma thams cad ston pa'o //
translated: Entering all forms into the body is displaying all the various activities of the body in the body.

original: skal pa mnyam pas 'gro ba ni ji ltar gdul bya'i don du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams la kha dog dang dbyibs dag de dang mthun pas mnyam par 'gro ba ste ;
