analyzed: skal pa mnyam pas 'gro ba ni ji ltar gdul bya'i don du sum cu rtsa gsum pa rnams la kha dog dang dbyibs dag de dang mthun pas mnyam par 'gro ba ste ;
translated: Going with the same fortune means going to the Thirty-Three Gods and so on in a form that matches their color and shape in order to benefit those to be tamed.

original: de bzhin du thams cad du sbyar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du thams cad du sbyar ro //
translated: This should be applied in the same way to all.

original: snang bar byed pa ni rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: snang bar byed pa ni rab tu gsal bar byed pa'o //
translated: Illuminating is illuminating.

original: mi snang bar byed pa ni rab tu mi snang ba'o //
analyzed: mi snang bar byed pa ni rab tu mi snang ba'o //
translated: The power of invisibility is the power of complete invisibility.

original: dbang nyid du byed pa ni ji ltar bdud sangs rgyas nyid du byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dbang nyid du byed pa ni ji ltar bdud sangs rgyas nyid du byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: The power of mastery is the power to make demons into buddhas.

original: gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul rab tu 'joms pa ni gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul rab tu 'joms pa ni gzhan gyi rdzu 'phrul zil gyis gnon par byed pa'o //
translated: The power of subjugating the magic of others is the power to overpower the magic of others.

original: spobs pa sbyin pa ni 'dri ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: spobs pa sbyin pa ni 'dri ba nyid la'o //
translated: The power of giving eloquence is the power to give eloquence to those who ask.

original: dran pa sbyin pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa ni nyan pas ting nge 'dzin sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa sbyin pa dang / bde ba sbyin pa ni nyan pas ting nge 'dzin sbyin pa'o //
translated: The power of giving mindfulness and bliss is the power to give concentration to those who listen.

original: 'od zer gtong ba'i rdzu 'phrul chen po ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sdud pa'o //
analyzed: 'od zer gtong ba'i rdzu 'phrul chen po ni 'jig rten gyi khams gzhan nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams sdud pa'o //
translated: The power of emitting light rays is the power to gather bodhisattvas from other world systems.

original: rdzu 'phrul chen po mngon par sgrub pa ni chen por gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul te /
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul chen po mngon par sgrub pa ni chen por gyur pa'i rdzu 'phrul te /
translated: The power of accomplishing great miracles is the power of great miracles.

original: bstan ma thag pa de dag nyid yin te de dag ni nyan thos rnams la med do //
analyzed: bstan ma thag pa de dag nyid yin te de dag ni nyan thos rnams la med do //
translated: These are the powers that have just been explained, and they do not exist for the sravakas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni dka' ba spyod pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni dka' ba spyod pa yin no zhes gsungs pa'i dka' ba spyod pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the practice of austerities that is mentioned in the statement, “The bodhisattva practices austerities”?

original: dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag thams cad kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: dka' ba spyod pa rnam pa bcu po de dag thams cad kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: These are the ten kinds of difficult tasks.

original: de la mi 'byed par kun nas nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba spyod pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'byed pa ni 'dir ma thar pa'o //
analyzed: de la mi 'byed par kun nas nyon mongs pa med par dka' ba spyod pa zhes bya ba ni mi 'byed pa ni 'dir ma thar pa'o //
translated: Therein, the difficult task of being unperturbed in the absence of afflictions means that one is unperturbed in the absence of afflictions.

original: 'di lta bu ni thar pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni thar pa yin te /
translated: This is liberation.

original: gang 'khor ba las kyang ma grol la /
analyzed: gang 'khor ba las kyang ma grol la /
translated: One is not liberated from cyclic existence,

original: de nyid du kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid du kun nas nyon mongs pa yang ma yin pa'o //
translated: but is also not afflicted in that very .

original: lhag ma dka' ba spyod pa dgu ni don go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma dka' ba spyod pa dgu ni don go sla'o //
translated: The remaining nine difficult tasks are easy to understand.

original: dgongs te gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: dgongs te gsungs pa'i dgongs pa bstan par bya ste /
translated: The intention of the intentional statements should be explained.

original: de la @174a * //
analyzed: de la @174a * //
translated: Therein,

original: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sbyin phod pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na byang chub sems dpa' sbyin phod pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: how is a bodhisattva generous?

original: sems can thams cad bdag nyid lta bur rtogs pas de'i phyir des sbyin pa byin par gyur pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
analyzed: sems can thams cad bdag nyid lta bur rtogs pas de'i phyir des sbyin pa byin par gyur pa ma yin no zhes dgongs so //
translated: Because he realizes that all sentient beings are like himself, therefore he does not give gifts.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa 'dod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa 'dod pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is he desirous of giving?

original: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'di ltar 'dod pa med pa ste /
analyzed: kha na mtho ba dang bcas pa'i sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'di ltar 'dod pa med pa ste /
translated: Giving, etc. that is accompanied by what is objectionable is not like that.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa nyid la 'dod par byed pas ro myang ba med pa'i don te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sbyin pa nyid la 'dod par byed pas ro myang ba med pa'i don te /
translated: The bodhisattva is intent on giving, etc. that is free of objectionable elements.

original: ro myang bar mi byed ces bya bar bzhed do //
analyzed: ro myang bar mi byed ces bya bar bzhed do //
translated: Thus, the meaning of “without relishing” is that one does not relish.

original: des na ro mi myang ba ni ro myang ba med pa'i sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: des na ro mi myang ba ni ro myang ba med pa'i sbyin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “without relishing” is giving that is free of relishing.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mos pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mos pa yin zhe na /
translated: How does one have conviction in giving?

original: gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyis sbyin pa byed pa thob pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag nyid kyis sbyin pa byed pa thob pa yin gyi /
translated: Because one has attained the ability to give oneself,

original: gang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi rkyen gyis 'gro ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: and not because one is impelled by another.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la 'jug par byed pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: How does one engage in giving?

original: rang bzhin gyis sbyin pa gtong pa yin zhes bya ba dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sbyin pa gtong pa yin zhes bya ba dgongs pa ste /
translated: The idea is that one gives naturally.

original: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis kyang 'jug par dgos pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bdag nyid kyis kyang 'jug par dgos pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not necessary to engage oneself,

original: ser sna shin tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ser sna shin tu spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because stinginess has been completely abandoned.

original: des na gzhan dag bzhugs pa la yang nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gzhan dag bzhugs pa la yang nus pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, he is also able to help others.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la mngon par dga' ba yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is he one who delights in giving?

original: res 'ga' zhig 'ga' sbyin par byed pa ma yin gyi rtag tu ci bdog pa sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig 'ga' sbyin par byed pa ma yin gyi rtag tu ci bdog pa sbyin pa'o //
translated: He does not give sometimes and not at other times; he always gives whatever he has.🔽How is he one who gives greatly?

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa la che ba yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa la che ba yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is not distracted from the gift.🔽He should give while in meditative concentration, without distraction.🔽How is he one who gives purely?🔽He is not attached to the gift.🔽He should give without attachment.🔽How is he one who gives with respect?

original: snying po med pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa ste /
analyzed: snying po med pa ni rnam par g-yeng ba med pa ste /
translated: He is not contemptuous of the recipient.🔽He should give with a respectful attitude.🔽How is he one who gives without discrimination?🔽He does not discriminate between worthy and unworthy recipients.

original: de ni 'di ltar mnyam par bzhag pas sbyin zhing g-yeng ba med pas sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni 'di ltar mnyam par bzhag pas sbyin zhing g-yeng ba med pas sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He should give without discriminating between worthy and unworthy recipients.🔽How is he one who gives abundantly?

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa dag pa yin zhes bya ba la /🔽'byung ba ni rab tu gnas pa ste /🔽ser sna rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa dag pa yin zhes bya ba la / 'byung ba ni rab tu gnas pa ste / ser sna rtsa ba nas 'byin par byed pa ste /
translated: He gives the very best of whatever he has.🔽He should give the very best of whatever he has.🔽How is he one who gives with a sense of shame?🔽He is ashamed to fail to give alms to a petitioner.

original: gal te ser sna rgyas par gyur na 'byin par byed cing nye bar 'byin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gal te ser sna rgyas par gyur na 'byin par byed cing nye bar 'byin par byed pa'o //
translated: He should give alms without failing, out of a sense of shame.🔽How is he one who gives with a sense of integrity?

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa mthar phyin pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa mthar phyin pa yin zhe na zhes bya ba la /
translated: He is conscientious about giving alms.🔽He should give alms with a sense of integrity.

original: gal te mtha' zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa la /
analyzed: gal te mtha' zhes bya ba mya ngan las 'das pa la /
translated: If nirvana is a “limit,”🔽

original: nyan thos bzhin du gnas par ma gyur na'o //
analyzed: nyan thos bzhin du gnas par ma gyur na'o //
translated: If the bodhisattva did not abide in nirvana, which is called the extreme,🔽like the sravakas.

original: 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de dag gi dbang du gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, he is not controlled by those adverse factors such as stinginess,

original: des sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: des sbyin pa la sogs pa'i dbang du gyur pa yin te /
translated: but he is controlled by generosity and so on,

original: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du ma gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not controlled by their adverse factors.

original: ji ltar na sbyin pa mi zad pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na sbyin pa mi zad pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is generosity inexhaustible?

original: zad pa med pa ni 'dir mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bzhed de /
analyzed: zad pa med pa ni 'dir mya ngan las 'das pa yin par bzhed de /
translated: Here, nirvana is accepted as being inexhaustible,

original: 'di ltar nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las @174b 'das pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las @174b 'das pa la gnas pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: because he does not abide in nirvana like the sravakas.

original: gang mdo sde las dge slong dag nga ni srog gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag gi dgongs pa gang gis gsungs pa de ston par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang mdo sde las dge slong dag nga ni srog gcod pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa de dag gi dgongs pa gang gis gsungs pa de ston par byed pa ste /
translated: The intention with which the Buddha spoke the sutra statements, such as “Monks, I am a murderer,” is taught by the following verse.

original: ji ltar na 'dod pas log par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'dod pas log par spyod pa yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is one a person who engages in sexual misconduct?

original: gang gi phyir 'dod pa 'di dag ni log pa yin no zhes de ltar spyod pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'dod pa 'di dag ni log pa yin no zhes de ltar spyod pa'o //
translated: One engages in sexual misconduct because one engages in these objects of desire as if they were wrong.

original: shes bya'i pha rol tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i pha rol tu phyin par byas nas gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: shes bya'i pha rol tu gnas pa zhes bya ba ni shes bya'i pha rol tu phyin par byas nas gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One abides in the perfection of the object of knowledge means that one abides having gone to the perfection of the object of knowledge.

original: ji ltar na log par lta ba can yin zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar na log par lta ba can yin zhes bya ba la /
translated: How is one a person who has wrong views?

original: gang thams cad du gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun tu brtags pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang thams cad du gtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa dag log pa nyid yin pa'i phyir kun tu brtags pa nyid dang / gzhan gyi dbang nyid yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba ste /
translated: One sees all that is included in form and so on as wrong because they are imaginary and dependent.

original: kun tu brtags pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang las log pa nyid du mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang las log pa nyid du mthong zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: One sees the imaginary as wrong in relation to the dependent.

original: lhag ma mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams ni go sla'o //
translated: The remaining ten nonvirtuous karmic paths are easy to understand.

original: yang mdo gzhan las gsungs pa'i rtag pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te zhes bya ba /
analyzed: yang mdo gzhan las gsungs pa'i rtag pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te zhes bya ba /
translated: Again, in another sutra it is said:🔽The dharmas of permanence are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of non-defilement are the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: mi gos pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te zhes gsungs pa'i bar la de dag la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mi gos pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te zhes gsungs pa'i bar la de dag la dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the intention in those statements?

original: de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ste /
translated: That will be explained.

original: rtag pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: rtag pa ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Permanence is the Dharma Body.🔽Therefore, that Dharma is called the dharmas of permanence.

original: de bas na chos de ni rtag pa'i chos rnams zhes bstan to //🔽chad pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa ji snyed pa dag de la yongs su chad par gyur pas de'i phyir don des na de ni chad pa'i chos rnams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de bas na chos de ni rtag pa'i chos rnams zhes bstan to // chad pa'i chos rnams zhes bya ba ni sgrib pa ji snyed pa dag de la yongs su chad par gyur pas de'i phyir don des na de ni chad pa'i chos rnams zhes brjod do //
translated: The dharmas of annihilation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.🔽The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: dmigs pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te zhes bya ba la /🔽sems can gyi spyod pa gnyen po dang bcas pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi nye bar dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa'i chos rnams ni sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams te zhes bya ba la / sems can gyi spyod pa gnyen po dang bcas pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi nye bar dmigs pa ste /
translated: The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of the Buddha.

original: des na chos de ni dmigs pa'i chos rnams so //
analyzed: des na chos de ni dmigs pa'i chos rnams so //
translated: The dharmas of observation are the dharmas of

original: mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dge ba'i chos rnams zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “non-virtuous entities” refers to

original: sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi gos pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: sgrib pa thams cad kyis mi gos pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: The phrase “is not defiled by any obscurations” refers to suchness.

original: de'i phyir chos de ni mi gos pa'i chos yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chos de ni mi gos pa'i chos yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, this entity is said to be “an undefiled entity.”

original: las kyi rab tu dbye ba ma bstan pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi las gang yin pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rab tu dbye ba ma bstan pas de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin rnams kyi las gang yin pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: Since the actions of the bodhisattvas’ meditative absorptions have not been presented in a topical discussion, their actions will now be presented.

original: de la ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgom par byed do //
analyzed: de la ting nge 'dzin la yang dag par brten nas byang chub sems dpa' rnams pha rol tu phyin pa rnams sgom par byed do //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattvas cultivate the perfections on the basis of meditative absorption.

original: de bzhin du de la yang dag par brten nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par @175a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du de la yang dag par brten nas sems can rnams yongs su smin par @175a * //
translated: Similarly, they bring sentient beings to maturity on the basis of meditative absorption.

original: byed do // rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa dag gis 'dun par byas nas 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: byed do // rdzu 'phrul la sogs pa dag gis 'dun par byas nas 'jug par byed do //
translated: They attract beings by means of their miraculous powers, etc., and then they cause them to enter the Buddha’s teaching.

original: de bzhin du de'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su sbyong bar byed de /
translated: In the same way, they refine the buddhafields by the power of meditative absorption.

original: sems la dbang thob par gyur na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du de gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byed do //
analyzed: sems la dbang thob par gyur na ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin du de gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du byed do //
translated: When one has attained mastery of mind, one can transform it into gold, etc., as one wishes.

original: de bzhin du de'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i stobs kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad sgrub par byed de /
translated: Similarly, by its power one accomplishes all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: de'i las ni de dag yin no //
analyzed: de'i las ni de dag yin no //
translated: These are its actions.

original: lhag pa'i shes rab brjod par bya ba'i dus la bab pas de brjod do //
analyzed: lhag pa'i shes rab brjod par bya ba'i dus la bab pas de brjod do //
translated: The time has come to speak of the perfection of wisdom, so let us speak of it.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni lhag pa'i shes rab tu 'dod do //
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni lhag pa'i shes rab tu 'dod do //
translated: Nonconceptual intuition is accepted as the perfection of wisdom.

original: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: sbyor pa las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor pa las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa ste /
translated: nonconceptual intuition born of preparation,

original: kun tu tshol ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang / dngos gzhi dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu tshol ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang / dngos gzhi dang / de'i rjes las thob pa'o //
translated: nonconceptual intuition of universal investigation, and nonconceptual intuition of the fundamental stage and its aftermath.

original: de la shes rab kyi dbang du byas pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab dang po'o //
analyzed: de la shes rab kyi dbang du byas pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab dang po'o //
translated: The first perfection of wisdom is from the standpoint of wisdom.

original: nang gi bdag nyid kyi shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: nang gi bdag nyid kyi shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second perfection of wisdom is from the standpoint of internal wisdom.

original: gang gnas pa'i shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gang gnas pa'i shes rab ni lhag pa'i shes rab gsum pa'o //
translated: The wisdom of abiding is the third, the wisdom of higher realization.

original: de la re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni bsgrub bar bya ba yin pas de'i de nyid ni 'bras bu yin la /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni bsgrub bar bya ba yin pas de'i de nyid ni 'bras bu yin la /
translated: Of these, the nonconceptual is the goal, and its reality is the result.

original: kun tu tshol ba ni rgyur gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: kun tu tshol ba ni rgyur gyur pa yin no //
translated: The search is the cause.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa de ni rjes la thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa yang yin pas de bsgrubs na gnyi ga yang bsgrub pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa de ni rjes la thob pa'i rgyur gyur pa yang yin pas de bsgrubs na gnyi ga yang bsgrub pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since that result is the cause of the subsequent attainment, when one accomplishes the latter, one accomplishes both.

original: de la dang por re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo brjod par bya'o //
translated: Now, first of all, the reality of nonconceptual intuition must be stated.

original: 'dir ngo bo nyid de ni mtshan nyid ces brjod de /
analyzed: 'dir ngo bo nyid de ni mtshan nyid ces brjod de /
translated: Here, that reality is called the characteristic.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: The bodhisattvas intuition

original: rnam rtog med pa'i ngo bo nyid //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i ngo bo nyid //
translated: is nonconceptual in essence.

original: rnam pa lnga ni rnam spangs shing //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni rnam spangs shing //
translated: It is devoid of five aspects

original: yang dag don la bkrar 'dzin med //
analyzed: yang dag don la bkrar 'dzin med //
translated: and does not grasp the real.

original: ces bya bar sbyor ro //
analyzed: ces bya bar sbyor ro //
translated: This is the connection.

original: rnam pa lnga ni yid la byed pa med pa tsam rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyid yin na gnyid log pa dang / ra ro ba dang / bag med pa la sogs pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ni yid la byed pa med pa tsam rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes nyid yin na gnyid log pa dang / ra ro ba dang / bag med pa la sogs pa yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes su thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the five aspects are just the absence of mental activity, and are nonconceptual wisdom itself, then it follows that sleep, intoxication, and carelessness would be nonconceptual wisdom.

original: yang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog par 'dod na /
analyzed: yang rnam par rtog pa dang bcas rnam par dpyod pa dang bcas pa'i sa las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog par 'dod na /
translated: If you assert that nonconceptuality transcends the stage of conceptual analysis,

original: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs pa thams cad kyang rnam par mi rtog par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it follows that all the second concentration and so on would be nonconceptual.

original: de lta yin na ni 'jig rten pas kyang rnam par mi rtog pa thob par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni 'jig rten pas kyang rnam par mi rtog pa thob par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would follow that nonconceptuality would be attained by worldly beings.

original: yang na gang du sems dang sems @175b las byung ba mi 'jug pa 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la sogs pa de'i gnas skabs rnam par mi rtog par 'dod na de ni ye shes nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang na gang du sems dang sems @175b las byung ba mi 'jug pa 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa la sogs pa de'i gnas skabs rnam par mi rtog par 'dod na de ni ye shes nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If you assert that the state in which mind and mental factors do not engage, such as the state of nondiscernment and the cessation of discriminations and feelings, is nonconceptual, then that state would not be wisdom.

original: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dus na sems med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i dus na sems med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no mind at the time of the meditative attainment of cessation, etc.

original: yang na gzugs kyi ngo bo bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'dod na yang de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs bems po yin pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang bems po nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gzugs kyi ngo bo bzhin du rnam par shes pa 'dod na yang de'i phyir ji ltar gzugs bems po yin pa bzhin du rnam par shes pa yang bems po nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Or, if you assert consciousness to be like the nature of form, then just as form is matter, consciousness would also be matter.

original: yang na gang de kho na nyid kyi don la bkra bar 'dzin par zhugs pa de rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
analyzed: yang na gang de kho na nyid kyi don la bkra bar 'dzin par zhugs pa de rnam par mi rtog pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if one who engages in apprehending the meaning of reality as variegated is nonconceptual,

original: de nyid ni rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid ni rnam par rtog par 'gyur te /
translated: then that would be conceptual,

original: 'di ni de kho na nyid do zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'di ni de kho na nyid do zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is realized that this is reality.

original: de lta bu'i rnam pa 'di lnga yongs su spangs pa'i ye shes kyis de kho na nyid kyi don la gal te zhugs par gyur na ni de kho na nyid kyi don ni 'di'o zhes de 'o na nyid kyi don la bkra bar 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam pa 'di lnga yongs su spangs pa'i ye shes kyis de kho na nyid kyi don la gal te zhugs par gyur na ni de kho na nyid kyi don ni 'di'o zhes de 'o na nyid kyi don la bkra bar 'dzin par mi 'gyur ro
translated: If one who has entered the meaning of reality by means of the wisdom that completely abandons these five aspects would apprehend the meaning of reality as variegated, then one would not apprehend the meaning of reality as “this is reality.”

original: // de lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de kho na nyid kyi don la dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: // de lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi mtshan nyid de kho na nyid kyi don la dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: Such is the characteristic of nonconceptual intuition, which does not focus on the meaning of reality.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa bzhin du sna tshogs kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not of the nature of multiplicity, like visual consciousness, is what is meant.

original: don 'di dag nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa dang po yang bstan par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: don 'di dag nyid kyis tshigs su bcad pa dang po yang bstan par gyur pa yin no //
translated: By these very points, the first verse is also taught.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid bstan nas gnas gang la 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid bstan nas gnas gang la 'byung bar 'gyur ba bstan par bya ste /
translated: Having thus taught the essence, he must teach the basis upon which it occurs.

original: de ltar bstan pa'i ye shes de'i gnas ni sems yin no //
analyzed: de ltar bstan pa'i ye shes de'i gnas ni sems yin no //
translated: The basis of that intuition taught in this way is mind.

original: gal te de'i gnas sems yin na sems ni sems par byed pas na sems zhes bya ba yin pas sems kyi gnas la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
analyzed: gal te de'i gnas sems yin na sems ni sems par byed pas na sems zhes bya ba yin pas sems kyi gnas la 'jug par 'gyur ba ni rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya bar mi rigs so //
translated: If the basis is mind, since mind is called mind because it thinks, it is not reasonable to call the entry into the mind basis nonconceptual.

original: yang sems med pa yin na ni de ni shes pa ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang sems med pa yin na ni de ni shes pa ma yin pa thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if it is without mind, it would be obtained as nonknowledge.

original: skyon gnyi ga spang bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: skyon gnyi ga spang bar bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: In order to avoid both faults, a verse:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gnas //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gnas // zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is not conceptual, and is the basis of that.

original: de'i gnas ni sems ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i gnas ni sems ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the mind, nor is it not the mind.🔽It is said to be the mind, and is called the bodhisattvas’ knowledge.🔽The knowledge of the bodhisattvas is not conceptual, and is the basis of that.

original: don la mi sems pa'i phyir ro //🔽sems med pa yang ma yin te ;
analyzed: don la mi sems pa'i phyir ro // sems med pa yang ma yin te ;
translated: The basis of that is not the mind, because it does not think about objects.

original: gang de'i gnas sems kyi 'phen pa'i gnas skabs las de 'byung bar gyur pas na de sems kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang de'i gnas sems kyi 'phen pa'i gnas skabs las de 'byung bar gyur pas na de sems kyi rgyu las byung ba'i phyir te /
translated: Nor is it not the mind, because it arises from the mind’s projection, from the state of the mind’s projection. Therefore, it arises from the mind as its cause.

original: de'i phyir sems kho na zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems kho na zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be the mind. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: rgyu gang las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu gang las 'byung bar 'gyur ba de tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni /
translated: The verse shows the cause from which it arises:

original: byang chub @176a * //
analyzed: byang chub @176a * //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas🔽is not conceptual, and is the basis of that.🔽It is not the mind, nor is it not the mind.

original: sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: It is said to be the mind, and is called the bodhisattvas’ knowledge.🔽The knowledge of the bodhisattvas is not conceptual, and is the basis of that.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzhi //🔽thos pa'i bag chags brjod bcas pa'i //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i gzhi // thos pa'i bag chags brjod bcas pa'i //
translated: The basis of that is not the mind, because it does not think about objects.🔽Nor is it not the mind, because it arises from the mind’s projection, from the state of the mind’s projection. Therefore, it arises from the mind as its cause.🔽Therefore, it is said to be the mind. This is the meaning of the verse.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse shows the cause from which it arises:

original: gang gzhan gyis bstan pa thos pa la bag chags so //
analyzed: gang gzhan gyis bstan pa thos pa la bag chags so //
translated: The other is the latent impression that comes from hearing the teaching of others.

original: gang bag chags kyi rgyu las ni yid kyi brjod pa yid la byed pa ste /
analyzed: gang bag chags kyi rgyu las ni yid kyi brjod pa yid la byed pa ste /
translated: The mental attention of verbal expression of the mind comes from the cause of latent impressions.

original: de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni tshul bzhin yid la byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called proper mental attention.

original: yang ye shes de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de de las gzhan pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa la /🔽byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: yang ye shes de'i dmigs pa gang yin pa de de las gzhan pa'i tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa la / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: Moreover, the verse that teaches the object of that knowledge, which is different from the above, says:🔽The object of the knowledge of the bodhisattvas

original: rnam rtog med pa'i dmigs pa ni //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i dmigs pa ni // zhes bya ba la /
translated: is nonconceptual.

original: de la gang kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad ni brjod par bya ba med pa yin pas na chos rnams brjod du med pa nyid do //
analyzed: de la gang kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos thams cad ni brjod par bya ba med pa yin pas na chos rnams brjod du med pa nyid do //
translated: Therein, all phenomena that are the imagined nature are inexpressible, and thus phenomena are inexpressible.

original: yang de'i brjod du med pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de'i brjod du med pa nyid gang yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is their inexpressibility?

original: bdag med de bzhin nyid kyang de //
analyzed: bdag med de bzhin nyid kyang de //
translated: Selflessness and suchness are also that.

original: da ni gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pa ste /
analyzed: da ni gang zag dang chos kyi bdag med pa ste /
translated: Now, the selflessness of persons and phenomena is

original: kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi bdag med pa'o //
translated: the selflessness of the imagined nature.

original: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de /
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni de nyid de /
translated: Its nature is just that.

original: de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Thatness.

original: des na chad par lta bar ma gyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: des na chad par lta bar ma gyur cig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, may I not fall into the view of annihilation.

original: yang de la dmigs par byed pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de la dmigs par byed pa'i rnam pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: Moreover, what is the aspect of the objective support that is focused on?

original: de ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: de ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: A verse shows that.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas🔽is nonconceptual and

original: rnam par mi rtog rnam pa ni //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog rnam pa ni //
translated: has the aspect of nondifferentiation

original: zhes bya dmigs pa de nyid la //🔽mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa'o //🔽zhes bya ba la ;
analyzed: zhes bya dmigs pa de nyid la // mtshan ma med pa gang yin pa'o // zhes bya ba la ;
translated: with regard to that very objective support.

original: ye shes de ni de bzhin nyid de la mnyam par 'byung bas mtshan ma med pa tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes de ni de bzhin nyid de la mnyam par 'byung bas mtshan ma med pa tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: That knowledge is nondifferentiated in aspect with regard to thatness, because it arises equally with respect to thatness.

original: 'di ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni rnam pa'o //
translated: This is the aspect.

original: ji ltar mig gis gzugs rnams 'dzin pa na de la sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba nyid kyi rnam pa dang / gzugs sngon po la sogs pa nyid gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mig gis gzugs rnams 'dzin pa na de la sngon po la sogs pa mthong ba nyid kyi rnam pa dang / gzugs sngon po la sogs pa nyid gzhan ma yin pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the eye, in apprehending forms, has the aspect of seeing only blue, etc. , and the form is blue, etc. , and nothing else,

original: 'dir yang ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dag gzhan ma yin pa ni rnam pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang ye shes dang de bzhin nyid dag gzhan ma yin pa ni rnam pa'o //
translated: so here also the nondifferentiation of knowledge and thatness is the aspect.

original: yang gal te chos thams cad brjod du med pa yin na de lta na gang la rnam par rtog par byed ce na /
analyzed: yang gal te chos thams cad brjod du med pa yin na de lta na gang la rnam par rtog par byed ce na /
translated: If all phenomena are inexpressible, then what is it that is imagined?

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i rang bzhin te /
translated: It is the nature of what arises from the combination of letters.

original: don du / rnam brtags de las gzhan du min //
analyzed: don du / rnam brtags de las gzhan du min //
translated: The meaning is imagined, not otherwise.

original: de bas na de las gzhan du ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de las gzhan du ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not otherwise.

original: yang ji ltar byas nas she na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar byas nas she na /
translated: How is it done?

original: de bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: It is established.

original: yi ge phan tshun sbyor bas na /
analyzed: yi ge phan tshun sbyor bas na /
translated: Because letters are combined,

original: don de sbyor las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: don de sbyor las byung ba yin te /
translated: the meaning arises from the combination.

original: yi ge gzhan dang gzhan dag lhan cig tu brjod pa'i don ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i do yin te /
analyzed: yi ge gzhan dang gzhan dag lhan cig tu brjod pa'i don ni sbyor ba las byung ba'i do yin te /
translated: The meaning that is expressed by the combination of one letter with another is the meaning that arises from the combination.

original: ji ltar mig ces bya ba lta bu'i yi ge rnam par ma chad par @176b brjod pa'i don ni 'di ltar sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar mig ces bya ba lta bu'i yi ge rnam par ma chad par @176b brjod pa'i don ni 'di ltar sbyor ba ste /
translated: For example, the meaning that is expressed by the uninterrupted utterance of the letters “eye” is like this:

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba ni de yin no //
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba ni de yin no //
translated: That is what is to be imagined.

original: chos thams cad brjod par bya ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa de gang gis grub pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos thams cad brjod par bya ba med pa yin no zhes bstan pa de gang gis grub pa yin zhe na /
translated: If it is taught that all phenomena are inexpressible, by what is that established?

original: 'di ltar / brjod pa med par brjod ces la //
analyzed: 'di ltar / brjod pa med par brjod ces la //
translated: Without expression, there is no expression.

original: shes pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: The cognition does not engage.

original: rjod par byed pa la ma byang ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba yod na yang de'i blor mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa la ma byang ba'i phyir brjod par bya ba yod na yang de'i blor mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if there is an object of expression, the mind does not turn to it because of unfamiliarity with the expression.

original: yang gal te rjod par byed pa ni brjod par bya ba'i blo 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: yang gal te rjod par byed pa ni brjod par bya ba'i blo 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you say that the expression is the mind of the object of expression,

original: 'gal ba'i phyir na brjod la min te /
analyzed: 'gal ba'i phyir na brjod la min te /
translated: it is not so, because of contradiction.

original: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid do //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba mtshan nyid gzhan yin pa'i phyir 'gal ba nyid do //
translated: There is contradiction because the expression and the object of expression have different characteristics.

original: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dag ;
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dag ;
translated: The expression and the object of expression🔽are not the same.

original: de phyir thams cad brjod du med //🔽ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: de phyir thams cad brjod du med // ces bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, everything is inexpressible.

original: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dag rgyu de'i phyir brjod du med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rjod par byed pa dang / brjod par bya ba dag rgyu de'i phyir brjod du med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression and the object of expression are inexpressible for that reason.

original: yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de gang gi rten yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes de gang gi rten yin zhe na /
translated: Again, what is the basis of that nonconceptual wisdom?

original: rnam par mi rtog ye shes de /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog ye shes de /
translated: That nonconceptual wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa'i de rjes la //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i de rjes la //
translated: is the bodhisattva’s subsequent attainment.

original: thob par bya ba'i rten yin te //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i rten yin te //
translated: It is the basis for attaining the goal.

original: gang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ye shes de'i rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyi rjes la byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thob par 'gyur bas de'i phyir ye shes de'i rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the bodhisattva's practice is attained subsequent to the nonconceptual intuition, therefore that intuition is its basis.

original: de ni 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de ni 'phel bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: It increases.

original: de'i phyir de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni rten du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de lta bu'i byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i phyir yang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni rten du 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, because such a bodhisattva practice increases, nonconceptual intuition is its basis.

original: yang de'i grogs gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang de'i grogs gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is its companion?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i grogs //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i grogs //
translated: is the companion of nonconceptuality.

original: lam gnyis su ni brjod pa de //
analyzed: lam gnyis su ni brjod pa de //
translated: The path is said to be twofold,

original: pha rol phyin lnga'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: pha rol phyin lnga'i rang bzhin no //
translated: having the nature of the five perfections.

original: de la lam gnyis ni tshogs kyi lam dang // rten gyi lam mo //
analyzed: de la lam gnyis ni tshogs kyi lam dang // rten gyi lam mo //
translated: The two paths are the path of equipment and the path of support.

original: de la tshogs kyi lam ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi lam ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o //
translated: The path of accumulation is the perfections of generosity, morality, patience, and effort.

original: rten gyi lam ni bsam gtan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
analyzed: rten gyi lam ni bsam gtan gyis pha rol tu phyin pa ste /
translated: The path of support is the perfection of meditation,

original: gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par byung ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsam gtan la brten nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sngar bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa las yang dag par byung ba dge ba'i rtsa ba dang / bsam gtan la brten nas rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba de 'byung bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: because the perfection of wisdom, which is called nonconceptual wisdom, arises from the roots of virtue that arise from the perfections taught above and depend on meditation.

original: sangs rgyas nyid ma thob kyi bar du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes des rnam par smin pa gang sgrub par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid ma thob kyi bar du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes des rnam par smin pa gang sgrub par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Until buddhahood is attained, what is the karmic maturation that is accomplished by that nonconceptual wisdom?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: The maturation of the bodhisattvas

original: rnam rtog med pa'i @177a * //🔽rnam smin ni /
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i @177a * // rnam smin ni /
translated: is nonconceptual.

original: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor gnyis su ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas dkyil 'khor gnyis su ste //
translated: It is in two buddha mandalas.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gnyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi dkyil 'khor gnyis ni longs spyod rdzogs pa'i dkyil 'khor dang / sprul pa'i dkyil 'khor te /
translated: The two circles of the buddhas are the circle of the enjoyment body and the circle of the emanation body.

original: gang gi tshe gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa'i rnam par smin pa ni sprul pa'o //
analyzed: gang gi tshe gang gis rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba la zhugs pa'i rnam par smin pa ni sprul pa'o //
translated: When one enters into the practice of non-conceptuality, the emanation body is the evolutionary development of that practice.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i don thob pa de'i rnam par smin pa ni longs spyod rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i don thob pa de'i rnam par smin pa ni longs spyod rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The enjoyment body is the evolutionary development of the attainment of the meaning of non-conceptuality.

original: de dag nyid kyi don bstan pa ni /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi don bstan pa ni /
translated: The meaning of those two is indicated in the verse:

original: sbyor ba dang ni thob pas so //🔽zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang ni thob pas so // zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: By practice and by attainment.

original: ye shes de'i rgyu mthun pa gang yin zhes na /
analyzed: ye shes de'i rgyu mthun pa gang yin zhes na /
translated: What is the natural outcome of that knowledge?

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas

original: rnam rtog med pa'i rgyu mthun ni //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i rgyu mthun ni //
translated: Is the natural outcome of non-conceptuality.🔽In the future lives

original: phyi ma phyi ma'i tshe rnams su //
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma'i tshe rnams su //
translated: Of those who have attained the non-conceptual🔽The natural outcome of non-conceptuality

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Is the circle of the enjoyment body.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis po dag phyi ma phyi ma'i tshe la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rgyu mthun pas /
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i dkyil 'khor gnyis po dag phyi ma phyi ma'i tshe la rnam par rtog pa med pa'i rgyu mthun pas /
translated: The two circles just explained are the circle of the enjoyment body and the circle of the emanation body. The circle of the enjoyment body is the natural outcome of the practice of non-conceptuality. The circle of the emanation body is the natural outcome of the attainment of the meaning of non-conceptuality.

original: khyad par du mi 'gro bar 'dod //
analyzed: khyad par du mi 'gro bar 'dod //
translated: One does not progress to a higher stage.🔽

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: and does not go to a special place.

original: gang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bye brag tu gyur ba de nyid de'i rgyu mthun par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes bye brag tu gyur ba de nyid de'i rgyu mthun par blta bar bya'o //
translated: That very non-conceptual intuition is to be regarded as the natural outcome of that cause.

original: de ji ltar nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar nges par 'byung bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does it come forth?

original: de la / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes //🔽rnam rtog med pa'i nges 'byung ni //
analyzed: de la / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes // rnam rtog med pa'i nges 'byung ni //
translated: The knowledge of the bodhisattvas

original: zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la //
translated: is the emergence of non-conceptual intuition.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba ni nges par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The emergence is the going to the ultimate,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽thob pa dang ni grub phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // thob pa dang ni grub phyir ro //
translated: which is synonymous with nirvana.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is for the sake of attainment and of accomplishment.

original: ye shes de dang po thob pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ye shes de dang po thob pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: At first, one comes to possess the attainment of that intuition.

original: de nas skal pa brgya stong du ma na grub pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro //🔽sa bcu dag tu shes bya ste //
analyzed: de nas skal pa brgya stong du ma na grub pa dang ldan par 'gyur ro // sa bcu dag tu shes bya ste //
translated: Then, after many hundreds of thousands of eons, one comes to possess its accomplishment.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is to be known on the ten stages.

original: dang po nas brtsams nas rim pa 'di nyid kyis sa dang po la ni thob pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dang po nas brtsams nas rim pa 'di nyid kyis sa dang po la ni thob pa tsam du 'gyur ro //
translated: Beginning with the first stage, it is the mere attainment of that intuition.

original: dus phyis ni chen po nyid du 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: dus phyis ni chen po nyid du 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Later, one attains the great stage.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, one attains nirvana through three incalculable eons.

original: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de srid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i mthar nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis de srid kyis rnam par mi rtog pa'i mthar nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, bodhisattvas definitely emerge to the limit of nonconceptuality in that time.

original: mthar thug par 'gro ba gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: mthar thug par 'gro ba gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the ultimate?

original: 'di ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis thob par gyur pa ni mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bshad ma thag pa'i rim pa 'di nyid kyis thob par gyur pa ni mthar thug pa ste /
translated: That which is attained by the very process just explained is the ultimate.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes /
translated: The knowledge of bodhisattvas

original: rnam rtog med pa'i mthar thug pa //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i mthar thug pa //
translated: reaches the limit of nonconceptuality.

original: dag pa'i sku gsum thob phyir dang // zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: dag pa'i sku gsum thob phyir dang // zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: Because they attain the three pure bodies.

original: dag pa smos pa ni 'dir 'di ltar sku gsum po sa dang po nyid du thob pa yin la /
analyzed: dag pa smos pa ni 'dir 'di ltar sku gsum po sa dang po nyid du thob pa yin la /
translated: The mention of pure indicates that the three bodies are attained on the first bodhisattva level,

original: @177b bcu pa la ni shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: @177b bcu pa la ni shin tu rnam par dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: but on the tenth they become extremely pure.

original: dbang gi mthong ni thob phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang gi mthong ni thob phyir ro //
translated: Because they attain the limit of power.

original: zhes bya ba ni dag pa'i sku gsum 'ba' zhig thob pas mthar thug par 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dag pa'i sku gsum 'ba' zhig thob pas mthar thug par 'gro ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the ultimate, because one attains only the three pure bodies.

original: gang yang ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dbang bcu po de dag thob pas kyang yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa dang / 'chad par 'gyur ba'i dbang bcu po de dag thob pas kyang yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: One should also see that it is due to attaining the nonconceptual intuition and the ten masteries to be explained below.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa de'i phan yon gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa de'i phan yon gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the benefits of that nonconceptuality?

original: de la re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par gsum ste /
analyzed: de la re zhig rnam par mi rtog pa ni rnam par gsum ste /
translated: To begin with, nonconceptuality is threefold:

original: sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang rtsa bas te /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa dang rtsa bas te /
translated: nonconceptuality that is acquired through practice, nonconceptuality that is innate,

original: gang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'o //
analyzed: gang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid dang / rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'o //
translated: and nonconceptuality that is attained subsequently to the nondiscriminative.

original: de las sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni gang byang chub sems dpa' des dang por pha rol po las rnam par mi rtog pa thob pa la de nas bdag nyid kyis rigs pas dpyad nas lhag par mos par byed cing /
analyzed: de las sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid ni gang byang chub sems dpa' des dang por pha rol po las rnam par mi rtog pa thob pa la de nas bdag nyid kyis rigs pas dpyad nas lhag par mos par byed cing /
translated: The nonconceptuality that is acquired through practice is that which the bodhisattva first hears from another, and then, having analyzed it with reasoning, he becomes convinced of it.

original: lhag par mos pa de la brten nas gang nges par zhugs pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya bas /
analyzed: lhag par mos pa de la brten nas gang nges par zhugs pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa zhes bya bas /
translated: In particular, based on that aspiration, the non-conceptual wisdom that definitely enters that suchness becomes non-conceptual.

original: de lta bu nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: That suchness becomes non-conceptual.

original: sbyor ba las byung ba de'i phan yon gang zhe na /
analyzed: sbyor ba las byung ba de'i phan yon gang zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of that which arises from application?

original: rnam rtog med pa'i ye shes de //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i ye shes de //
translated: That non-conceptual wisdom

original: gos pa med de /
analyzed: gos pa med de /
translated: is unstained,

original: nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: like space.

original: gang gis ma gos she na /
analyzed: gang gis ma gos she na /
translated: By what is it unstained?

original: de bstan pa /
analyzed: de bstan pa /
translated: That is shown:

original: sdig pa sna tshogs drag rnams kyis so //
analyzed: sdig pa sna tshogs drag rnams kyis so //
translated: by various strong misdeeds.

original: rgyu gang gis ma gos pa de bstan pa /
analyzed: rgyu gang gis ma gos pa de bstan pa /
translated: The cause by which it is unstained is shown:

original: dad pa tsam dang mos pa yis //
analyzed: dad pa tsam dang mos pa yis //
translated: by mere faith and aspiration.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: dad pa tsam dang / gang rnam par mi rtog pa la lhag par mos pa de ni de'i phyir ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i gnyen po nyid yin zhing /
analyzed: dad pa tsam dang / gang rnam par mi rtog pa la lhag par mos pa de ni de'i phyir ngan 'gror 'gro ba'i gnyen po nyid yin zhing /
translated: mere faith and aspiration for non-conceptuality is the antidote for going to lower realms,

original: sgrib pa spangs par gyur bas mi gos pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa spangs par gyur bas mi gos pa'o //
translated: and by abandoning obscurations, it is unstained.

original: rtsa ba rnams par mi rtog pa'i phan yon yang /
analyzed: rtsa ba rnams par mi rtog pa'i phan yon yang /
translated: The benefit of the root non-conceptuality is also

original: gos pa med de na ma mkha' bzhin /
analyzed: gos pa med de na ma mkha' bzhin /
translated: unstained, like space.

original: gang zhe na /
analyzed: gang zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: rnam rtog med pa'i ye shes de //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa'i ye shes de //
translated: That nonconceptual intuition🔽is attained, and is endowed with the accomplishment of the stages.

original: gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang gis she na /
translated: By what?

original: sgrib pa kun las so //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun las so //
translated: By being free from all obscurations.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: thob pa dang grub pa dang ldan pas na //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: thob pa dang grub pa dang ldan pas na // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: By being endowed with attainment and accomplishment.

original: sa rnams thob pa dang ldan pa dang / grub pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sa rnams thob pa dang ldan pa dang / grub pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with the attainment of the stages and endowed with accomplishment.

original: 'dis ni sgrib pa de'i gnyen po nyid bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgrib pa de'i gnyen po nyid bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows that it is the antidote to those obscurations.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'i phan yon ji lta bu yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'i phan yon ji lta bu yin zhe na /
translated: What is the benefit of the post-meditation of nonconceptuality?

original: de yang rnam rtog med pa'i ye shes de //
analyzed: de yang rnam rtog med pa'i ye shes de //
translated: That nonconceptual intuition

original: gos pa med de nam mkha' bzhin //
analyzed: gos pa med de nam mkha' bzhin //
translated: is unsoiled, like space.

original: 'jig rten dag na rnam rgyu yang //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na rnam rgyu yang //
translated: Although it moves in the world,

original: 'jig rten chos kyi rtag mi gos //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'jig rten chos kyi rtag mi gos // zhes bya ba la /
translated: it is never soiled by worldly things.

original: ye shes de nyid kyis ni sems can gyi don mthong nas srid pa dag tu yang skye bar 'gyur @178a * //
analyzed: ye shes de nyid kyis ni sems can gyi don mthong nas srid pa dag tu yang skye bar 'gyur @178a * //
translated: That intuition, seeing the benefit of sentient beings, is born in the world.

original: la ; de 'jig rten du skyes par gyur na yang de la 'jig rten gyi chos kyis ni mi gos te /
analyzed: la ; de 'jig rten du skyes par gyur na yang de la 'jig rten gyi chos kyis ni mi gos te /
translated: And although it is born in the world, it is never soiled by worldly things.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos ni rnyed pa dang ma rnyed pa dang / grags pa dang / ma grags pa dang / bstod pa dang / smad pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal zhes bya'o //
translated: The mundane dharmas are called gain and loss, fame and disgrace, praise and blame, pleasure and pain.

original: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de yang rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is non-imagination.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it arises from non-imaginative wisdom.

original: gang ye shes gsum po de dag nyid kyi bye brag ni ji ltar de dag bstan pa bzhin du de yang bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gang ye shes gsum po de dag nyid kyi bye brag ni ji ltar de dag bstan pa bzhin du de yang bstan par bya'o //
translated: The distinction of those three knowledges should be taught just as they are taught.

original: ji ltar lkugs pas don ni myong 'dod ltar te /
analyzed: ji ltar lkugs pas don ni myong 'dod ltar te /
translated: Like a mute experiencing something,

original: brjod pa med pa ltar sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa ni de bzhin no //
analyzed: brjod pa med pa ltar sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par mi rtog pa ni de bzhin no //
translated: like that is the non-imagination arising from application, which is inexpressible.

original: ji ltar lkugs pas don myong dang ste brjod pa med pa de lta bu de ni dngos gzhig rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar lkugs pas don myong dang ste brjod pa med pa de lta bu de ni dngos gzhig rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: Like a mute experiencing something, inexpressible, like that is the non-imagination of the main part.

original: ma lkugs pas ni don myong ltar te /
analyzed: ma lkugs pas ni don myong ltar te /
translated: Like a non-mute experiencing something,

original: brjod pa ltar de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: brjod pa ltar de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: As stated, so should the non-conceptual post-attainment be viewed as following the non-conceptual.

original: 'dir brjod pa ni yi ge brjod pa yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: 'dir brjod pa ni yi ge brjod pa yin par bzhed do //
translated: Here, it is held that the expression is the expression of the syllables.

original: rmongs pas don ni myong 'dod dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rmongs pas don ni myong 'dod dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Desiring to experience the object through delusion,

original: 'dir tha snyad la ma byang ba ni rmongs pa yin par bzhed do //
analyzed: 'dir tha snyad la ma byang ba ni rmongs pa yin par bzhed do //
translated: Here, it is held that the unskillful in convention is delusion.

original: rmongs pa 'di dag kyang ye shes gsum dang dpe yang lkugs pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa 'di dag kyang ye shes gsum dang dpe yang lkugs pa bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And these delusions should be applied to the three knowledges and the example of the mute.

original: lnga pos don ni myong 'dod dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lnga pos don ni myong 'dod dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Desiring to experience the object through the five,

original: lnga smos pas ni rtog pa med pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams bsdus bar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: lnga smos pas ni rtog pa med pa'i mig la sogs pa rnams bsdus bar blta bar bya'o //
translated: By mentioning the five, the non-conceptual eye and so forth should be seen as included.

original: de dag gi 'dod pa dang myong ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad lkugs pa bzhin du ye shes gsum dang sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: de dag gi 'dod pa dang myong ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad lkugs pa bzhin du ye shes gsum dang sbyar ba'o //
translated: And their desire and experience, all like the mute, are applied to the three knowledges.

original: yid kyis don ni myong ba ltar //
analyzed: yid kyis don ni myong ba ltar //
translated: Like the mind experiencing the object,

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Here,

original: ji ltar yid kyis don la rnam par rtog cing nyams su myong ba ltar de'i rjes las thob pas nyams su myong ba yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar yid kyis don la rnam par rtog cing nyams su myong ba ltar de'i rjes las thob pas nyams su myong ba yang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as the mind conceives and experiences the object, so the subsequently acquired cognition experiences it in the same way.

original: rnam par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It conceives it, that is, it has the same object as the mind.

original: bstan bcos ma shes pas bstan bcos 'dod pa lta bu ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos ma shes pas bstan bcos 'dod pa lta bu ni sbyor ba las byung ba'o //
translated: The subsequently acquired cognition is like the desire for the treatise when the treatise is not understood.

original: ji ltar bstan bcos de'i chos dang don myong ba lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan bcos de'i chos dang don myong ba lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual, like the experience of the Dharma and its meaning in that treatise.

original: 'dir chos ni yi ge tsam du bzhed do //
analyzed: 'dir chos ni yi ge tsam du bzhed do //
translated: Here, the Dharma is considered to be mere letters.

original: ji ltar bstan bcos shes pas chos dang don myong ba de lta bur ni de'i rjes las thob par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bstan bcos shes pas chos dang don myong ba de lta bur ni de'i rjes las thob par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The subsequently acquired cognition should be regarded as being like the experience of the Dharma and its meaning by one who knows the treatise.

original: go rims smos pa ni 'dir chos dang don dang ye shes kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: go rims smos pa ni 'dir chos dang don dang ye shes kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The order in which the Dharma, its meaning, and the knowledge of that meaning are taught is mentioned here.

original: mi zhig mig ni btsums pa ltar //
analyzed: mi zhig mig ni btsums pa ltar //
translated: One who is like a person with eyes closed

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su @178b bcad pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa gnyis po de dag gi bye brag bstan to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su @178b bcad pa ni rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i rjes las thob pa gnyis po de dag gi bye brag bstan to //
translated: These verses and so on teach the difference between the nondiscriminated and the subsequently attained.

original: nam mkha' bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Like space,

original: ji ltar nam mkha' khyab pa dang / ma gos ba dang / mi rtog pa dang / brtag pa dang / brtag par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang chos thams cad la ro gcig pa stong pa nyid kyis khyab pas na khyab pas na khyab pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' khyab pa dang / ma gos ba dang / mi rtog pa dang / brtag pa dang / brtag par bya ba ma yin pa de bzhin du rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyang chos thams cad la ro gcig pa stong pa nyid kyis khyab pas na khyab pas na khyab pa'o //
translated: just as space is all-pervading, unsoiled, nonconceptual, inconceivable, and indescribable, so also is the nondiscriminating intuition, all-pervading by means of the voidness that is the one taste of all things.

original: chos thams cad kyi ma gos pas na gos pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad kyi ma gos pas na gos pa med pa'o //
translated: It is unsoiled by any things.

original: rang nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis rnam par mi rtog pas na rnam par rtog pa med pa'o //
translated: It is nonconceptual by its very nature.

original: gzhan gyis brtag par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyis brtag par bya ba ma yin pa nyid kyis rnam par brtag par bya ba ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is inconceivable because it cannot be conceived by others.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni de ltar blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes ni de ltar blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus should the nondiscriminating intuition be viewed.

original: de la gzugs ni snang ba ltar //
analyzed: de la gzugs ni snang ba ltar //
translated: Form is like an appearance in the sky.

original: de yi rjes thob shes de 'dra //
analyzed: de yi rjes thob shes de 'dra //
translated: Postmeditational cognition is like that.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' la gzugs kyi snang ba rnam par brtags pa ltar /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' la gzugs kyi snang ba rnam par brtags pa ltar /
translated: Just as the appearance of form in the sky is imagined,

original: de bzhin du de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i rjes las thob pa'i ye shes blta bar bya ste /
translated: so should the postmeditational cognition be seen.

original: rnam par brtag par bya ba la rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽yang gal te de lta bu'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu bsgos pa'i sangs rgyas nyid des sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: rnam par brtag par bya ba la rnam par rtog pa med pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // yang gal te de lta bu'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes kyis rab tu bsgos pa'i sangs rgyas nyid des sems can gyi rnam par rtog pa med pa de bzhin du /
translated: The meaning is that it is not a conceptualization in regard to what is imagined.

original: de'i sems can gyi don mdzad pa yang rnam par rtog pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /🔽de tshigs su bcad pas nor bu dang sil snyan gyi dpes bstan pa /
analyzed: de'i sems can gyi don mdzad pa yang rnam par rtog pa med par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na / de tshigs su bcad pas nor bu dang sil snyan gyi dpes bstan pa /
translated: If, in that Buddhahood which is thus saturated with nonconceptual intuition, the benefit of beings is accomplished without conceptualization, just like the nonconceptualization of those beings, how is that?🔽That is indicated by a verse on the example of the jewel and the musical instrument.

original: ji ltar nor bu sil snyan dag / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ji ltar nor bu sil snyan dag / ces bya ba la /
translated: The verse says:

original: ji ltar yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnam par rtog pa med pa bzhin du yang sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don gyi las byed pa dang / lha rdzas kyi sil snyan rnams ma brdungs par yang der skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa bzhin du sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba ba lta na /
analyzed: ji ltar yid bzhin gyi nor bu rnam par rtog pa med pa bzhin du yang sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa'i don gyi las byed pa dang / lha rdzas kyi sil snyan rnams ma brdungs par yang der skyes pa'i sems can rnams kyi 'dod pa bzhin du sgra 'byung bar 'gyur ba ba lta na /
translated: Just as a wish-fulfilling jewel, without any discursive thought, performs the function of fulfilling wishes, and just as divine musical instruments, without being played, produce sounds according to the wishes of those born in that place,

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bzhin du yang phrin las rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa mi mnga' bzhin du yang phrin las rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: so also, without any discursive thought, the various functions of the Buddhas occur.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i zab pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i zab pa nyid brjod par bya ste /
translated: The profundity of nonconceptuality should be stated.

original: ci ye shes de gzhan gyi dbang zhes brjod pa'i rnam par brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la 'jug gam /
analyzed: ci ye shes de gzhan gyi dbang zhes brjod pa'i rnam par brtag par bya ba'i dngos po la 'jug gam /
translated: Is that pristine wisdom engaged in the thing to be imagined, which is called “dependent,”

original: 'on te gzhan zhig la dmigs des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: 'on te gzhan zhig la dmigs des cir 'gyur /
translated: or does it have another object? What is the consequence of that?

original: gal te rnam par brtag par bya ba la dmigs ni na de'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid mi dmigs so //
analyzed: gal te rnam par brtag par bya ba la dmigs ni na de'i rnam par mi rtog pa nyid mi dmigs so //
translated: If it has as its object that which is to be imagined, then its nonconceptuality is not tenable.

original: gzhan la mi dmigs so zhes na /🔽de'i dmigs pa gzhan ni med pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: gzhan la mi dmigs so zhes na / de'i dmigs pa gzhan ni med pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: If you say that it does not have another object,

original: de la ma yin gzhan la min //🔽zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la ma yin gzhan la min // zhes bya ste /
translated: then it does not have an object, because it has no other object.

original: de la re zhig de la ni ma yin @179a * //
analyzed: de la re zhig de la ni ma yin @179a * //
translated: It is not in that, nor in another.

original: te ; rnam par brtag par bya ba la dmigs pa ni mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: te ; rnam par brtag par bya ba la dmigs pa ni mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not in that, because it is not the object of conceptual differentiation,

original: rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is non-conceptual.

original: gzhan la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it in another,

original: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes brjod pa'i chos de nyid kyi chos nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir gzhan gyi dbang zhes brjod pa'i chos de nyid kyi chos nyid la dmigs pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it has as its object the reality of that dharma which is called the other-dependent.

original: de'i chos nyid dang chos de dag ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhen pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //🔽de'i phyir rnam par brtag par bya ba la dmigs pa'am /
analyzed: de'i chos nyid dang chos de dag ni gcig pa nyid dang gzhen pa nyid du brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do // de'i phyir rnam par brtag par bya ba la dmigs pa'am /
translated: The reality of that and those dharmas cannot be said to be either the same or different.

original: gzhan la dmigs pa yin zhes brjod par mi bya'o //🔽gzhan yang de shes pa yin nam /
analyzed: gzhan la dmigs pa yin zhes brjod par mi bya'o // gzhan yang de shes pa yin nam /
translated: Therefore, it cannot be said that it has as its object that which is to be conceptually differentiated,🔽or that it has another object.

original: yang na ma yin /
analyzed: yang na ma yin /
translated: Moreover, is that knowledge or not?

original: des cir 'gyur /
analyzed: des cir 'gyur /
translated: What is the consequence if it is?🔽What is the consequence if it is not?

original: gal te shes pa yin na ni de ji ltar rtogs med par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te shes pa yin na ni de ji ltar rtogs med par 'gyur /
translated: If it is consciousness, then how can it be non-conceptual?

original: 'on te mi shes pa'i ngo bo yin na ni ji ltar na ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te mi shes pa'i ngo bo yin na ni ji ltar na ye shes rnam par mi rtog pa zhes brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: But if it is by nature non-conscious, then how can it be called non-conceptual wisdom?

original: shes dang mi shes pa ma yin //
analyzed: shes dang mi shes pa ma yin //
translated: It is neither consciousness nor non-consciousness.

original: zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: This is indicated by the line:

original: re zhig de shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig de shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is neither consciousness nor non-consciousness.

original: 'di ltar sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo ltar mi 'jug pas so ;🔽/ de mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sbyor ba las byung ba'i rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes kyi ngo bo ltar mi 'jug pas so ; / de mi shes pa yang ma yin te /
