translated: First, it is not consciousness because it does not engage in the way that conceptual wisdom arisen from preparation does.

original: gang gi phyir sbyor ba las byung ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes rgyur gyur ba las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sbyor ba las byung ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa'i ye shes rgyur gyur ba las de byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is also not non-consciousness because it arises from the cause of conceptual wisdom arisen from preparation.

original: de la ma yin gzhan la min //
analyzed: de la ma yin gzhan la min //
translated: It is neither in that nor in another.

original: shes dang mi shes pa ma yin //
analyzed: shes dang mi shes pa ma yin //
translated: It is neither consciousness nor non-consciousness.

original: zhes bya ba'i don gzhan yang gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de la yang ma yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don gzhan yang gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa de la yang ma yin te /
translated: The meaning of this line is as follows: It is not in that, because it does not engage in the way that conceptual wisdom does.

original: des na shes pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: des na shes pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is not consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir chos nyid la 'jug pas de las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos nyid la 'jug pas de las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Because it engages reality, it is not other than that.

original: des na mi shes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na mi shes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not ignorance.

original: de ni snga ma phyi mas bshad par gyur pa ma yin no //🔽shes bya dang ni khyad med pa'i //
analyzed: de ni snga ma phyi mas bshad par gyur pa ma yin no // shes bya dang ni khyad med pa'i //
translated: It is not explained by the former or the latter.

original: shes gang de ni mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: shes gang de ni mi rtog nyid //
translated: The knowledge that is not different from the object of knowledge

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: is non-conceptual.

original: gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'jug pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor 'jug pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba lta bu ni rnam par mi rtog pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Here, that which arises from the application of engaging in the nature of apprehended and apprehender is not non-conceptual.

original: gang yang gzung ba dang shes bya tha mi dad par 'jug pas mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang yang gzung ba dang shes bya tha mi dad par 'jug pas mnyam pa nyid du 'jug pa de ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid do //
translated: However, that which engages in equality by engaging in the non-difference of apprehended and object of knowledge is non-conceptual.

original: ye shes de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo la mi gnas pa nyid do //
analyzed: ye shes de ni gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bo la mi gnas pa nyid do //
translated: That knowledge does not abide in the nature of apprehended and apprehender.

original: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las /
analyzed: gang yang bcom ldan 'das kyis mdo gzhan las /
translated: Moreover, in another sutra, the Blessed One said:

original: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes gsungs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: chos thams cad rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes gsungs pa de bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: All phenomena are non-conceptual. In order to demonstrate that,

original: chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: chos rnams thams cad rang bzhin gyis //
translated: All phenomena are by nature

original: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: free from conceptualization.

original: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha @179b tshig go //
analyzed: chos thams cad ni rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa med pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha @179b tshig go //
translated: The meaning of this is that all phenomena are by nature free from conceptualization.

original: gang gi phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: rnam par brtag bya med pas na //🔽zhes byas ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par brtag bya med pas na // zhes byas ba ste /
translated: Because there is nothing to be conceptualized.

original: gang gi phyir brtag par bya ba'i dngos po med pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brtag par bya ba'i dngos po med pas so //
translated: Because there is nothing to be conceptualized.🔽Since there is nothing that is a real entity to be conceptualized,🔽phenomena are by nature free from conceptualization.

original: gang yang de ltar rnam par brtag par bya ba med pas rang bzhin gyis chos rnams rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir des na sems can thams cad gang gi phyir thar par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang yang de ltar rnam par brtag par bya ba med pas rang bzhin gyis chos rnams rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin pa de'i phyir des na sems can thams cad gang gi phyir thar par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Since this is so, why is it that all sentient beings are not liberated?

original: 'di ltar / shes gang de ni mi rtog nyid //
analyzed: 'di ltar / shes gang de ni mi rtog nyid //
translated: The answer is: That knowledge is itself nonconceptual.

original: ces bya bas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin na yang sems can la thar pa med par bstan pa ni gang yang rnam par rtog pa mi brten pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya bas chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid yin na yang sems can la thar pa med par bstan pa ni gang yang rnam par rtog pa mi brten pa nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: still liberation is not impossible for sentient beings, because they do not rely on conceptualization.

original: des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: des chos thams cad rang bzhin gyis rnam par mi rtog pa nyid yin na yang /
translated: Although all phenomena are by nature nonconceptual,

original: gal te der rtogs pa'i ye shes skyes par gyur na des mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te der rtogs pa'i ye shes skyes par gyur na des mngon sum du mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: if the nonconceptual gnosis were to arise in them, they would see it directly.

original: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni rnam par mi rtog pa nyid do //
translated: That is nonconceptual.

original: des kyang grol bar 'gyur te skyes par ma gyur na ni grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des kyang grol bar 'gyur te skyes par ma gyur na ni grol bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: And they would be liberated by it, but if it did not arise, they would not be liberated.

original: de'i phyir ye shes de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir ye shes de ni rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: That is why that gnosis is nonconceptual.

original: ye shes gsum pa de rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'phen pa dang / goms pa las byung bas rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes gsum pa de rnams kyi rab tu dbye ba bstan par bya ba'i phyir rgyu dang 'phen pa dang / goms pa las byung bas rab tu dbye ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ste /
translated: To show the classification of that third gnosis, it is said that it is classified as causal, projected, and habitual.

original: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba ni rnam par gsum ste /🔽'di ltar kha cig ni rigs kyi stobs las /
analyzed: de la rnam par mi rtog pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba ni rnam par gsum ste / 'di ltar kha cig ni rigs kyi stobs las /
translated: The application that is non-conceptual is threefold:🔽Some arises from the power of the lineage.

original: kha cig ni 'phen pa'i stobs las ;
analyzed: kha cig ni 'phen pa'i stobs las ;
translated: Some arises from the power of impetus.

original: kha cig ni da ltar gyi dus su goms pa'i stobs las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni da ltar gyi dus su goms pa'i stobs las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Some arises from the power of cultivation in the present life.

original: de la rigs kyi stobs las ni der rgyu gyur pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi stobs las ni der rgyu gyur pa las 'byung bar 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: Among these, that which arises from the power of the lineage is the cause for that which is to be attained.

original: de 'phen pa'i stobs las ni de skyes pa snga ma la goms par byas pa'i rgyu nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'phen pa'i stobs las ni de skyes pa snga ma la goms par byas pa'i rgyu nyid las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which arises from the power of impetus is the cause for that which is cultivated in a previous birth.

original: gang goms pa'i stobs las da ltar gyi skye ba nyid la skyes bu byed pa'i stobs kyi rgyu las de 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang goms pa'i stobs las da ltar gyi skye ba nyid la skyes bu byed pa'i stobs kyi rgyu las de 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: That which arises from the power of cultivation in the present life is the cause for that which is produced by the power of the person in this very birth.

original: chos shes pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / spros pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos shes pa dang / phyin ci ma log pa dang / spros pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Because of the knowledge of reality, because of non-error, and because of the absence of conceptual differentiation, there is non-conceptualization.

original: de la chog shes pas rnam par mi rtog pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i mthar phyin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: de la chog shes pas rnam par mi rtog pa ni thos pa dang bsams pa las byung ba'i mthar phyin pa yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Non-conceptuality through contentment should be regarded as the culmination of what is derived from listening and reflection.

original: chog shes pa las rnam par mi rtog pa ni chog shes pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes de ltar byas nas thos pa'am bsams pa gang gis blo gang gi mthar phyin par gyur pa de ni so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i
analyzed: chog shes pa las rnam par mi rtog pa ni chog shes pas rnam par mi rtog pa'o zhes de ltar byas nas thos pa'am bsams pa gang gis blo gang gi mthar phyin par gyur pa de ni so so'i skye bo'i sa la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i
translated: Non-conceptuality through contentment is non-conceptuality through contentment. Having made this distinction, that which is the culmination of any mind through listening or reflection is the arising of contentment for the bodhisattva who is abiding in the stage of ordinary beings.

original: chog shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba @180a * //
analyzed: chog shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba @180a * //
translated: This is the arising of contentment.

original: ste ; de ni re zhig 'di tsam mo zhes de ltar byas pa'i don 'dis chog shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: ste ; de ni re zhig 'di tsam mo zhes de ltar byas pa'i don 'dis chog shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: This is the non-conceptuality of contentment through the meaning of this much for the time being.

original: don gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chog shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: don gzhan yang 'jig rten pa'i chog shes pa'i rnam par mi rtog par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, non-conceptuality through mundane contentment should be regarded as non-conceptuality.

original: gang srid pa'i rtse mor phyin par gyur pa de ni mya ngan las 'da' bar blta bas de'i pha rol na rtogs par bya ba gzhan med do zhes chog shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang srid pa'i rtse mor phyin par gyur pa de ni mya ngan las 'da' bar blta bas de'i pha rol na rtogs par bya ba gzhan med do zhes chog shes pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The thought that there is nothing more to be realized beyond that is the arising of satisfaction.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par rtog pa nyan thos la sogs pa rnams yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: The non-erroneous conceptualization should be regarded as that of the Sravakas and so on,

original: gang gi phyir de dag rnams kyi de ko na nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i ye shes de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci ma log pa rnam pa bzhi las de rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log tu rnam par mi rtogs pa'i
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag rnams kyi de ko na nyid rab tu rtogs pa'i ye shes de ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i phyin ci ma log pa rnam pa bzhi las de rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa phyin ci log tu rnam par mi rtogs pa'i
translated: because their gnosis that realizes reality is non-erroneous in the four aspects of impermanence and so on, and does not conceptualize in the erroneous aspects of permanence and so on.

original: phyir ro // yang spros pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: phyir ro // yang spros pa med pas rnam par mi rtog pa ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi yin par blta bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the non-conceptualization through the absence of conceptual elaborations should be regarded as that of the Bodhisattvas,🔽because they have eliminated the conceptual elaborations of subject and object.

original: gang gi phyir chos thams cad nas byang chub kyi bar la yang spros pa med par rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir chos thams cad nas byang chub kyi bar la yang spros pa med par rnam par mi rtog pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: Because all phenomena up to enlightenment are free from conceptual elaboration, he does not conceptualize them.

original: yang spros pa med pa ni gang gi yul las yang dag par 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: yang spros pa med pa ni gang gi yul las yang dag par 'das pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i shes pa'i yul las yang dag par 'das pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, the absence of conceptual elaboration should be understood as transcending the domain of the world and as transcending the domain of mundane knowledge.

original: gang gi phyir tshig gis bstan par mi nus pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i shes pas shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir tshig gis bstan par mi nus pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i shes pas shes par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it cannot be taught by words and cannot be known by mundane knowledge.

original: yang rnam pa mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa de yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga blta bar bya ba yin pas rtogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'dres pa dang / 'byor ba la dpyod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yang rnam pa mi rtog pa'i rjes las thob pa de yang rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga blta bar bya ba yin pas rtogs pa dang / rjes su dran pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa dang / 'dres pa dang / 'byor ba la dpyod pa tha dad pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: Moreover, that subsequent to the absence of conceptualization should be regarded as having five aspects, because it is analyzed as understanding, recollection, establishment, mixture, and mastery.

original: de yang rtogs pa la dpyod pa dang / rjes su dran pa la dpyod pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa la dpyod pa dang / 'dres pa la dpyod pa dang / 'byor ba la dpyod pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga yin no /
analyzed: de yang rtogs pa la dpyod pa dang / rjes su dran pa la dpyod pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa la dpyod pa dang / 'dres pa la dpyod pa dang / 'byor ba la dpyod pa zhes bya ba ste rab tu dbye ba rnam pa lnga yin no /
translated: Moreover, it is fivefold: analysis of realization, analysis of recollection, analysis of presentation, analysis of mixture, and analysis of mastery.

original: de la rtog pa la dpyod pa ni /
analyzed: de la rtog pa la dpyod pa ni /
translated: Analysis of realization is

original: gang rtogs pa'i dus nyid na bdag gis di ltar rtogs so zhes dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: gang rtogs pa'i dus nyid na bdag gis di ltar rtogs so zhes dpyod pa ste /
translated: the analysis of the thought “I have realized this” at the time of realization.

original: khong du chud pa ni 'dir dpyod pa yin par 'dod do //
analyzed: khong du chud pa ni 'dir dpyod pa yin par 'dod do //
translated: Here, understanding is considered to be analysis.

original: rjes su dran pa la dpyod pa ni gang langs pa na bdag gis rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs so zhes dran pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su dran pa la dpyod pa ni gang langs pa na bdag gis rnam par mi rtog pa rtogs so zhes dran pa'o //
translated: Analysis of recollection is the recollection of the thought “I have realized nonconceptuality” when one arises from meditative equipoise.

original: rnam par gzhag pa la dpyod pa ni gang pha rol la bdag gis rtogs pa de ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa la dpyod pa ni gang pha rol la bdag gis rtogs pa de ston par byed pa'o //
translated: Analysis of presentation is the presentation of one’s realization to others.

original: @180b 'dres pa la dpyod pa ni gang chos thams cad 'dres shing bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis mthong ba ste /
analyzed: @180b 'dres pa la dpyod pa ni gang chos thams cad 'dres shing bsdus pa la dmigs pa'i ye shes kyis mthong ba ste /
translated: Analysis of mixture is the seeing of all phenomena mixed and included in the object of the wisdom that observes them.

original: 'di ltar rten gnas gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar rten gnas gyur pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the basis is transformed.

original: rten gnas gyur pa de nyid las ni 'gyur ba la dpyod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rten gnas gyur pa de nyid las ni 'gyur ba la dpyod par 'gyur te /
translated: From the transformation of the basis, there is the analysis of mastery,

original: gang ci bsams pa de thams cad 'byor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang ci bsams pa de thams cad 'byor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because whatever is thought of is mastered.

original: de yang ji ltar sa la sogs pa yang de ltar brtags na gzhan gser la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de yang ji ltar sa la sogs pa yang de ltar brtags na gzhan gser la sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: And that is like earth, etc., which when imagined as gold, etc., become gold, etc.

original: yang de ni brtags pas 'byor bar 'gyur bas na 'byor ba la dpyod pa ste /
analyzed: yang de ni brtags pas 'byor bar 'gyur bas na 'byor ba la dpyod pa ste /
translated: And that is the analysis of mastery, because mastery is attained through imagination.

original: ji ltar dpyod pa de bzhin du 'byor bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar dpyod pa de bzhin du 'byor bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Just as it is analyzed, so it is attained.

original: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan zin to //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pa'i rnam par gzhag pa bstan zin to //
translated: The presentation of the non-conceptual has been explained.

original: sgrub par byed pa ma bstan pas de ston par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa ma bstan pas de ston par byed pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Since the means of accomplishment has not been explained, a verse to teach it:🔽In the desire realm, animal, human,

original: yid dags dud 'gro mi rnams dang // kha rnams ji ltar 'os 'os su //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: yid dags dud 'gro mi rnams dang // kha rnams ji ltar 'os 'os su // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and god destinies, as is appropriate.

original: dud 'gro rnams kyis chu la /
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams kyis chu la /
translated: In the desire realm, animals, humans, and gods, as is appropriate.

original: yi dags rnams kyis thang du dang / mi rnams kyis mi gtsang ba dang / dud 'gro phag la sogs pas gtsang bar mthong ba dang / mi rnams la zas de dag gtsang ba la /
analyzed: yi dags rnams kyis thang du dang / mi rnams kyis mi gtsang ba dang / dud 'gro phag la sogs pas gtsang bar mthong ba dang / mi rnams la zas de dag gtsang ba la /
translated: For humans, that food is pure,

original: lha rnams la de dag mi gtsang ba de ltar byas nas /
analyzed: lha rnams la de dag mi gtsang ba de ltar byas nas /
translated: but for gods it is impure.

original: dngos gcig yid ni tha dad par mthong bas na don rnams grub pa med par 'dod par bya'o //
analyzed: dngos gcig yid ni tha dad par mthong bas na don rnams grub pa med par 'dod par bya'o //
translated: Thus, since one object is seen differently by different minds, one should accept that objects are not established.

original: de la bden pa nyid du ma grub pas don gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de la bden pa nyid du ma grub pas don gang yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Since they are not established as real, no object exists at all.

original: des na rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par shes pa dmigs pa med pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, consciousness is without an object.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni dmigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is without an object.

original: 'di'i dmigs pa ni rmi lam ji lta ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di'i dmigs pa ni rmi lam ji lta ba bzhin no //
translated: Its object is like a dream.🔽Just as the past and future are its objects,

original: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la de dmigs pa dang / ji ltar me long dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul lta bu yin pas de tshigs su bcad pas ston pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa dang ma 'ongs pa la de dmigs pa dang / ji ltar me long dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi spyod yul lta bu yin pas de tshigs su bcad pas ston pa ni /
translated: and just as it is like a mirror and the domain of concentration, a verse is taught.

original: 'das sogs de bzhin phyi lam dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'das sogs de bzhin phyi lam dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: and so on.

original: de yang phye snga mas phyi ma dang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phye snga mas phyi ma dang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: And the former should be seen as corresponding to the latter in order.

original: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar yod pa ma yin pa'i dmigs pa ni /
translated: Thus, the non-existent object is

original: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dmigs pa yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the object does not exist.

original: dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa nyid do //
translated: It is just the non-existence of the object.

original: de nyid la dmigs pa ni de la dmigs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid la dmigs pa ni de la dmigs pa ste /
translated: The object of that is the object of that,

original: rang gi gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs brnyan la dmigs pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is to say, it is just the object of one's own reflection.

original: de yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dag go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan dag go rims bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: And that should be applied in order to the past, the future, dreams, and reflections.

original: don ni don du grub na ni //🔽ye shes rtog pa med mi 'gyur //
analyzed: don ni don du grub na ni // ye shes rtog pa med mi 'gyur //
translated: If the object were established as an object,

original: zhes byas ba la /🔽gal te don gyi ngo bo nyid du yod na ni nges na rnam par mi rtog @181a * //
analyzed: zhes byas ba la / gal te don gyi ngo bo nyid du yod na ni nges na rnam par mi rtog @181a * //
translated: there would be no non-conceptual cognition.

original: pa'i ye shes med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i ye shes med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of the object existed, then there would be no non-conceptual cognition.

original: 'on te de med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de med pa'i ngo bo nyid ni 'dod pa yin no zhe na /
translated: But if you maintain that the nature of that nonexistence is accepted,

original: des na rnam par mi rtog pa de med pas na sangs rgyas nyid kyang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par mi rtog pa de med pas na sangs rgyas nyid kyang 'thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then, since that nonconceptualization does not exist, buddhahood would not be attained.

original: des na nges par 'di ltar 'dod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: des na nges par 'di ltar 'dod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: Therefore, you must definitely accept this.

original: byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob dang // zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' dbang thob dang // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained power

original: dbang thob par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbang thob par gyur pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: has the power of aspiration,

original: mos dbang gis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i dbang gis de lta bu med pa'i sa la sogs pa dag 'di ltar gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mos dbang gis zhes bya ba ni bsam pa'i dbang gis de lta bu med pa'i sa la sogs pa dag 'di ltar gser la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du 'gyur ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: and by the power of aspiration, nonexistents such as earth, etc., become existent in the nature of gold, etc.

original: bsam gtan pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan gyi yang ngo ;🔽;'di la rnam par 'byed grub pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan pa'i zhes bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa gzhan gyi yang ngo ; ;'di la rnam par 'byed grub pa //
translated: The power of concentration refers to that of others, such as sravakas, etc.🔽This is the accomplishment of discernment.

original: zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni lhag mthong grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the accomplishment of insight.

original: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
analyzed: blo ldan zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa'o //
translated: The wise refers to the bodhisattva.

original: zhi ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa zhes bya ba'i don te nang gi bdag nyid kyi'o //
analyzed: zhi ba thob pa zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa zhes bya ba'i don te nang gi bdag nyid kyi'o //
translated: “Attainment of peace” means attainment of concentration.

original: chos kun yid la byed pa la //
analyzed: chos kun yid la byed pa la //
translated: With respect to the mental attention to all phenomena,

original: de ltar don du snang phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar don du snang phyir ro //
translated: it is like that, because of the appearance of the object.

original: zhes bya ba la 'di ltar ji lta ji ltar mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi don yid la byed pa na de la de lta de lta bur snang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la 'di ltar ji lta ji ltar mdo sde la sogs pa'i chos rnams kyi don yid la byed pa na de la de lta de lta bur snang bar 'gyur te /
translated: In this way, just as one mentally attends to the meaning of the teachings of the sutras, etc., just so does it appear.

original: gal te sangs rgyas nyid yin no zhes chos de dang de dag yid la byed pa na sangs rgyas kyi don du snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas nyid yin no zhes chos de dang de dag yid la byed pa na sangs rgyas kyi don du snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one mentally attends to this and that teaching, thinking, “This is Buddhahood,” it appears as the meaning of Buddha.

original: de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzugs dang tshor ba la sogs pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: And so on, in the same way, with respect to form, feeling, etc.

original: ye shes rgyu ba rtog med la //
analyzed: ye shes rgyu ba rtog med la //
translated: With respect to the movement of nonconceptual intuition,

original: don rnams thams cad mi snang phyir //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: don rnams thams cad mi snang phyir // zhes bya ba la /
translated: all objects do not appear.

original: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu ba 'jug pa la 'di ltar don thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med pa'i ye shes kyi rgyu ba 'jug pa la 'di ltar don thams cad snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the movement, i.e., the activity, of nonconceptual intuition, in this way, all objects do not appear.

original: de'i phyir / don med khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir / don med khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: one should understand that the object does not exist.

original: des na gal te don med pa yin na rnam par rig pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te don med pa yin na rnam par rig pa yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, if it does not exist, then consciousness also does not exist.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rnam par rig pa med pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽don med pas na rnam rig med //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa med pa bstan par bya ba'i phyir / don med pas na rnam rig med //
translated: In order to demonstrate that consciousness does not exist,

original: ces bya ba la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la /
translated: he says, “Since the object does not exist, consciousness does not exist.”

original: rnam par rig par bya ba'i don med na /
analyzed: rnam par rig par bya ba'i don med na /
translated: Since the object of consciousness does not exist,🔽consciousness also does not exist.

original: rnam par rig pa yang rigs par mi 'gyur bas de med par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig pa yang rigs par mi 'gyur bas de med par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be understood as follows:

original: don 'di ni shes bya'i mtshan nyid du go sla bar phye zin to //
analyzed: don 'di ni shes bya'i mtshan nyid du go sla bar phye zin to //
translated: This meaning has already been explained in an easy way in the definition of the object of knowledge.

original: de lta bu'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par mi rtog pa'i ye shes gang yin pa de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yin te /
translated: That nonconceptual wisdom is the perfection of wisdom.

original: gang gi phyir de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'byung bas so //
translated: Because it is said, “Having stood in the perfection of wisdom by way of not standing in it,” and so on.

original: de dag nyid kyi don gsal bar bya bar 'dod nas gzhung @181b 'di dag gis bstan te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi don gsal bar bya bar 'dod nas gzhung @181b 'di dag gis bstan te /
translated: Wishing to clarify the meaning of those very [topics], this treatise is taught.

original: ji ltar mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na /🔽mu stegs can gyi ngar 'dzin pa'i gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la mu stegs can shes rab la gnas nas nga rgyal dang bcas par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas nas pha rol tu phyin pa rnams bsgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed ce na / mu stegs can gyi ngar 'dzin pa'i gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la mu stegs can shes rab la gnas nas nga rgyal dang bcas par 'gyur te /
translated: How, by abiding in a non-abiding manner, does one complete the cultivation of the perfections?

original: bdag ni shes rab la gnas pa /
analyzed: bdag ni shes rab la gnas pa /
translated: Abandoning the abode of the tīrthikas' grasping at I means that the tīrthikas, abiding in wisdom, become conceited, thinking, I abide in wisdom.

original: bdag gi shes rab ni 'di lta bu zhes mu stegs kyi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i phyir shes rab kyis gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi shes rab ni 'di lta bu zhes mu stegs kyi gnas pa'i rnam par rtog pa spong ba'i phyir shes rab kyis gnas pa med pa'i tshul gyis gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: My wisdom is like this. In order to abandon the conceptualization of abiding in the tīrthikas' way, one abides in wisdom by abiding in a non-abiding manner.

original: de kho na ma mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par rtog pa gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de kho na ma mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa'i rnam par rtog pa gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Abandoning the abode of the bodhisattvas' conceptualization who have not seen reality means that the bodhisattvas, abiding in the perfections, think, I abide in the perfections.

original: ji ltar de kho na ma mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par brtag par bya ba med pa la 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par byed pa des na mi gnas
analyzed: ji ltar de kho na ma mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa rnam par brtag par bya ba med pa la 'di ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'o zhes rnam par rtog par byed pa des na mi gnas
translated: Just as the bodhisattvas who have not yet seen reality imagine the perfection of wisdom, which is not to be imagined, as “this is the perfection of wisdom,” so they imagine the other perfections, the emptinesses, etc.,

original: pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin du rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
analyzed: pa'i tshul gyis de bzhin du rnam par rtog par mi byed do //
translated: in the same way, but they do not imagine them as existing in the manner of a non-abiding.

original: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' gnyis kyi gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Abandoning the two extremes of cyclic life and of nirvana” means

original: ji ltar 'jig rten pa 'khor ba'i mtha' la gnas pa dang / nyan thos mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la gnas pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'jig rten pa 'khor ba'i mtha' la gnas pa dang / nyan thos mya ngan las 'das pa'i mtha' la gnas pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: that the bodhisattvas do not abide in the extreme of cyclic life as the worldly do, nor in the extreme of nirvana as the disciples do.

original: de ltar na mi gnas pas gnas pa ni ji ltar rigs pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na mi gnas pas gnas pa ni ji ltar rigs pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, non-abiding is to be seen as the proper course.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa'i gnas yongs su spong ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase the state of being content with merely eliminating the afflictive obstructions refers to the fact that.

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnams nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnams nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa spangs pa tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' ni ma yin te /
translated: The bodhisattvas are not like the sravakas, who are content with merely eliminating the afflictive obstructions.

original: de'i phyir na dgongs pa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par rig par bya'o //🔽sems can gyi don la mi lta ba phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi gnas yongs su spong ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir na dgongs pa 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rnams mi gnas pa'i tshul gyis gnas par rig par bya'o // sems can gyi don la mi lta ba phung po lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings kyi gnas yongs su spong ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, in this regard, it should be understood that the bodhisattvas abide in a nonabiding manner.🔽The phrase the state of being indifferent to the welfare of sentient beings, which is the realm of nirvana without residual aggregates refers to the fact that.

original: ji ltar nyan thos rnams sems can gyi don la ltos pa med par phung po dag pa dang ma dag pa ni rten nyid yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nyan thos rnams sems can gyi don la ltos pa med par phung po dag pa dang ma dag pa ni rten nyid yin no //
translated: The sravakas, who are indifferent to the welfare of sentient beings, are attached to the realm of nirvana without residual aggregates, which is the support for the elimination of the aggregates, whether pure or impure.

original: de dag ni kham gyi zas por ba reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas gsum gyis de'i rten gnas par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag ni kham gyi zas por ba reg pa dang / yid la sems pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i zas gsum gyis de'i rten gnas par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: Those who are born supernaturally have four sustenances, because they are sustained by the three sustenances of contact, mental volition, and consciousness, and also by the sustenance of physical nutriment.

original: de'i phyir de'i rten gnas par byed pa ni gsum yin no //🔽dag pa'i rten gnas par byed @182a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i rten gnas par byed pa ni gsum yin no // dag pa'i rten gnas par byed @182a * //
translated: Therefore, the sustenance of those who are born supernaturally is fourfold.

original: pa ni kham gyi zas la sogs pa bzhi po de dag nyid yin te /
analyzed: pa ni kham gyi zas la sogs pa bzhi po de dag nyid yin te /
translated: The sustenance of those who are pure is also fourfold,

original: nyan thos la sogs pa de dag gi rten yang dag pa rnams 'di ltar gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽gnas par ston pa yang bzhi po de dag nyid de /
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa de dag gi rten yang dag pa rnams 'di ltar gnas par byed pa'i phyir ro // gnas par ston pa yang bzhi po de dag nyid de /
translated: because those who are pure, such as the disciples and so on, are sustained by those four sustenances, such as physical nutriment.🔽The sustenance of those who are shown to be sustained is also fourfold.

original: de yang gnas pa ltar ston pa'i zas ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de yang gnas pa ltar ston pa'i zas ni sangs rgyas rnams kyi ste bzhi pa'o //
translated: The sustenance of those who are shown to be sustained like those who are sustained is the fourth sustenance of the Buddhas.

original: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams des ston pa ltar ston te /
analyzed: 'di ltar sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams des ston pa ltar ston te /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas are shown to be sustained by that, just as those who are sustained are shown to be sustained.

original: sems can sbyin pa po rnams des rab tu mgu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsod nams bsags pa'i don du yin gyi yang de dag gi zas kyi bya ba mdzad par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sems can sbyin pa po rnams des rab tu mgu bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsod nams bsags pa'i don du yin gyi yang de dag gi zas kyi bya ba mdzad par mi 'gyur te /
translated: In order to please those sentient beings who are givers, and in order to accumulate merit, but not to perform the function of eating food.

original: zas de dag bzhes pa'i dus su sangs rgyas las lha rnams kyis blangs nas gzhan sems can rnams la sbyin par byed de /
analyzed: zas de dag bzhes pa'i dus su sangs rgyas las lha rnams kyis blangs nas gzhan sems can rnams la sbyin par byed de /
translated: When the time comes to eat that food, the gods take it from the buddhas and give it to other sentient beings.

original: de dag kyang rgyu des byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang rgyu des byang chub thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: And they attain enlightenment through that cause.

original: de dag thams cad kyang zab pa gcig nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyang zab pa gcig nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: All of these should be understood as one profound point.

original: de lta mod kyi sangs rgyas kyi skye ba med pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi sangs rgyas kyi skye ba med pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya ste /
translated: However, the nonarising and the characteristics of the arising of a buddha should be understood as tenfold.

original: kun tu rmongs pa rnam par sel ba nyid dang / tha dad pa rnam par sel ba nyid dang / len pa la rang dbang nyid dang / gnas pa la rang dbang nyid dang / gtong pa la rang dbang nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
analyzed: kun tu rmongs pa rnam par sel ba nyid dang / tha dad pa rnam par sel ba nyid dang / len pa la rang dbang nyid dang / gnas pa la rang dbang nyid dang / gtong pa la rang dbang nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i mtshan nyid dang /
translated: It is the elimination of all delusion, the elimination of differentiation, mastery over taking up, mastery over abiding, mastery over giving up, the characteristic of nonduality,

original: snang ba tsam nyid dang / sgyu ma lta bu nyid dang / mi gnas par rab tu gnas pa nyid dang / don chen po sgrub pa nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba tsam nyid dang / sgyu ma lta bu nyid dang / mi gnas par rab tu gnas pa nyid dang / don chen po sgrub pa nyid do //
translated: the mere appearance, the illusion-like nature, the nonabiding state, and the accomplishment of the great meaning.

original: rnam pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus de bzhin gshegs pa rnams 'khor ba dang mya ngan las 'das pa la rab tu mi gnas par rig par bya ste /
translated: The tathāgatas should be known as not abiding in saṃsāra and nirvāṇa through ten aspects:

original: lags par yongs su shes pa nyid dang / legs par spangs pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa shes pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa nyid dang / mi dmigs shing mi rtog pa nyid dang / sems yongs su spangs pa nyid dang /
analyzed: lags par yongs su shes pa nyid dang / legs par spangs pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa shes pa nyid dang / dngos po med pa'i ngo bo nyid shes pa nyid dang / mi dmigs shing mi rtog pa nyid dang / sems yongs su spangs pa nyid dang /
translated: correct complete understanding, correct relinquishment, the knowledge of non-entityness, the knowledge of the nature of non-entityness, non-apprehension and non-conceptuality, the complete relinquishment of mind,

original: sems so sor thob pa nyid dang / sems mnyam pa nyid dang / dngos po la mi dmigs pa nyid dang / dmigs pa la dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems so sor thob pa nyid dang / sems mnyam pa nyid dang / dngos po la mi dmigs pa nyid dang / dmigs pa la dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: the attainment of the individual mind, the equality of mind, the non-apprehension of things, and the apprehension of the apprehension.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa yang rnam pa bcus 'grub ste rab tu spangs pa nyid dang / bya ba la lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / byed pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / las lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyis sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa lhun gyis grub pa yang rnam pa bcus 'grub ste rab tu spangs pa nyid dang / bya ba la lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / byed pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / las lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang /
translated: The buddhas' spontaneous performance of buddha activities is also accomplished by ten aspects: non-abandonment, spontaneity in action, spontaneity in performance, spontaneity in karma,

original: med pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / yod pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / snga ma las khyad pa nyid dang / bya ba @182b mthar phyin pa nyid dang / bya ba mthar ma phyin pa nyid do //
analyzed: med pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / yod pa lhun gyis grub pa nyid dang / snga ma las khyad pa nyid dang / bya ba @182b mthar phyin pa nyid dang / bya ba mthar ma phyin pa nyid do //
translated: spontaneity in non-existence, spontaneity in existence, distinction from the previous, completion of action, and non-completion of action.

original: rnam pa bcus na sangs rgyas zas kyis zas kyi bya ba mi mdzad kyang sku zas kyis gnas par ston te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcus na sangs rgyas zas kyis zas kyi bya ba mi mdzad kyang sku zas kyis gnas par ston te /
translated: In ten aspects, the buddhas, even though they do not perform the function of food with food, demonstrate the sustenance of the body with food.

original: sems can rnams kyi bsod nams bsags pa'i phyir dang / chos mthun pa nyid du yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rigs pa la longs spyad par rjes su bslab par bya ba'i phyir dang / chags pa med pa bslab par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi bsod nams bsags pa'i phyir dang / chos mthun pa nyid du yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir dang / rigs pa la longs spyad par rjes su bslab par bya ba'i phyir dang / chags pa med pa bslab par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: In order to accumulate merit for sentient beings, in order to demonstrate the concordant nature of phenomena, in order to train in the enjoyment of reason, in order to train in nonattachment,

original: mchod pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa yang dag par shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid chags pa med par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang /
analyzed: mchod pa nye bar bsdu ba'i phyir dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa yang dag par shes par bya ba'i phyir dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dang / bdag nyid chags pa med par bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang /
translated: in order to gather worship, in order to understand the practice of striving, in order to ripen the roots of virtue, in order to demonstrate selflessness,

original: las la gus pa nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / smon lam 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las la gus pa nye bar bstan par bya ba'i phyir dang / smon lam 'byung ba yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to demonstrate respect for karma, and in order to fulfill the arising of vows.

original: de la gang 'og nas brjod par bya ba rnam par gnas pa dang / grangs dang phrin las zab pa nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa /
analyzed: de la gang 'og nas brjod par bya ba rnam par gnas pa dang / grangs dang phrin las zab pa nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa /
translated: The remaining verses teach the arrangement of the topics, their number, and their profound activity.

original: tha dad med cing dpag tu med //
analyzed: tha dad med cing dpag tu med //
translated: It is not differentiated and is immeasurable.

original: ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: ces bya ba ste /
translated: Thus it is.

original: rnam par gnas pa zab pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa zab pa yin no //
translated: This is the profundity of the abiding reality.

original: de la tha dad med ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku la dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de la tha dad med ces bya ba ni chos kyi sku la dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: Therein, it is not differentiated refers to the Dharma Body, which is undifferentiated.

original: dpag tu med pa ni rten du ma las mngon par byang chub pas so //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni rten du ma las mngon par byang chub pas so //
translated: It is immeasurable because of the enlightenment in many supports.

original: phrin las dpag tu med cing gcig / ces bya ba ni grangs zab pa nyid de /
analyzed: phrin las dpag tu med cing gcig / ces bya ba ni grangs zab pa nyid de /
translated: Its activity is immeasurable and one refers to the profundity of number.

original: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams du ma nyid yin na yang phrin las ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sangs rgyas rnams du ma nyid yin na yang phrin las ni gcig pa nyid yin no //
translated: For, although the Buddhas are many, their activity is one.

original: mi brtan brtan pa'i phrin las can //
analyzed: mi brtan brtan pa'i phrin las can //
translated: It is steady and unsteady in activity.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni sku gsum ldan //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni sku gsum ldan //
translated: The Buddhas possess three bodies.

original: zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la /
translated: Thus it is.

original: sangs rgyas rnams sku gsum dang ldan pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i phrin las ni brtan pa yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams sku gsum dang ldan pas longs spyod rdzogs pa'i phrin las ni brtan pa yin la /
translated: The activity of the Enjoyment Body is steady because the Buddhas possess three bodies.

original: sprul pa'i phrin las ni mi brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i phrin las ni mi brtan pa yin te /
translated: The activity of the Transformation Body is unsteady.

original: de lta bu dag ni phrin las zab pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu dag ni phrin las zab pa nyid yin no //
translated: Such is the profundity of activity.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zab pa nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa zab pa nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni /
translated: The profundity of perfect enlightenment is indicated in a verse.

original: gang yang mngon rdzogs sangs rgyas med //
analyzed: gang yang mngon rdzogs sangs rgyas med //
translated: There is no perfect enlightenment

original: ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: ces bya ba ni /
translated: This is the meaning of the above verse.🔽

original: gang zag dang chos dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang zag dang chos dngos po med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no real person or real process.

original: thams cad sangs rgyas ma yin min //
analyzed: thams cad sangs rgyas ma yin min //
translated: But neither is there no enlightenment🔽.

original: zhes bya ba ni di ltar gdags pa ni yang sangs rgyas thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni di ltar gdags pa ni yang sangs rgyas thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in this way, all enlightenment is perfect enlightenment.

original: de'i mngon bar rdzogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mngon bar rdzogs pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: How is it perfect?🔽It is immeasurable in each instant

original: skad cig re la dpag tu med //🔽ces bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: skad cig re la dpag tu med // ces bya bas bstan te /
translated: In each instant, they are immeasurable.🔽🔽

original: gang gi phyir skad cig re re la yang dpag tu med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir skad cig re re la yang dpag tu med pa mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because in each instant there is immeasurable perfect enlightenment.

original: dngos po'i dngos med rab tu phye //
analyzed: dngos po'i dngos med rab tu phye //
translated: The differentiation of the nonexistence of things and the existence of their nonexistence is🔽.

original: @183a * // zhes bya ba ni 'dir de bzhin nyid ni dngos po'i dngos po med pa ste /
analyzed: @183a * // zhes bya ba ni 'dir de bzhin nyid ni dngos po'i dngos po med pa ste /
translated: Here, thusness is the nonexistence of the thing that is the imagined reality, and the existence of the reality of that nonexistence.

original: des rab tu phye ba ni sangs rgyas yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des rab tu phye ba ni sangs rgyas yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Buddha is distinguished by that.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zab pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zab pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the profundity of freedom from passion, he says,

original: chags pa ma yin mi chags min //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: chags pa ma yin mi chags min // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: He is not attached, nor is he nonattached.

original: 'dod chags med pas chags pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags med pas chags pa ma yin la /
translated: He is not attached because he is free from passion.

original: chags pa med pa nyid kyis na yang mi chags pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chags pa med pa nyid kyis na yang mi chags pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is he nonattached because he is free from nonattachment.

original: 'di ltar chags pa yod na mi chags pa yang rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar chags pa yod na mi chags pa yang rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For if there were attachment, then nonattachment would be logical.

original: 'dod chags nyid kyis byung ba yin //
analyzed: 'dod chags nyid kyis byung ba yin //
translated: He is born from passion itself.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa spangs pas 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dag ma bzung ba'i phyir gang 'di ma bzung ba nyid kyis des na nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir 'dod chags kyi kun nas dkris pa spangs pas 'dod chags kyi bag la nyal dag ma bzung ba'i phyir gang 'di ma bzung ba nyid kyis des na nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because he has abandoned the entanglements of passion, he does not grasp the latent dispositions of passion. And because he does not grasp them, he attains nirvana like the disciples.

original: 'dod chags 'dod chags min mkhyen nas //
analyzed: 'dod chags 'dod chags min mkhyen nas //
translated: Knowing passion and nonpassion,

original: 'dod chags chos nyid la yang zhugs //
analyzed: 'dod chags chos nyid la yang zhugs //
translated: he enters into the reality of passion.

original: zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dod chags ma yin no zhes rnam par shes nas /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni kun tu brtags pa'i 'dod chags ni 'dod chags ma yin no zhes rnam par shes nas /
translated: This is the meaning: having understood that the imagined passion is not passion,

original: 'dod chags kyi de bzhin nyid la zhugs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi de bzhin nyid la zhugs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: he has entered into the reality of passion.

original: phung po spangs pa zab pa nyid ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: phung po spangs pa zab pa nyid ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: A verse on the profundity of the abandonment of the aggregates:

original: sangs rgyas phung po rnams las 'das //
analyzed: sangs rgyas phung po rnams las 'das //
translated: 1. The Buddha transcends the aggregates,

original: phung po rnams la'ang rnam par bzhugs //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: phung po rnams la'ang rnam par bzhugs // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: and yet he abides in the aggregates.

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gzugs la sogs pa las shin tu 'das nas de dag mi dmigs pa'i chos nyid kyi phung po la rab tu gnas pa'o //🔽de las gzhan min gzhan min min //
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po gzugs la sogs pa las shin tu 'das nas de dag mi dmigs pa'i chos nyid kyi phung po la rab tu gnas pa'o // de las gzhan min gzhan min min //
translated: This is the meaning: having transcended the five appropriated aggregates of form, etc. , he abides in the reality of the aggregates, which is the nonapprehension of those .

original: zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni /
translated: 2. He is not other than that, nor is he not other.

original: kun tu brtags pa'i phung po de dag spangs pa las de gzhan ma yin te /
analyzed: kun tu brtags pa'i phung po de dag spangs pa las de gzhan ma yin te /
translated: He is not other than the abandonment of the imagined aggregates,

original: gang gi phyir de dag nyid kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag nyid kyi chos nyid gang yin pa de la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he abides in the reality of those .

original: yang gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: yang gzhan ma yin pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is he not other,

original: gang gcig nyid yin na yang kun tu brtags pa rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gcig nyid yin na yang kun tu brtags pa rnam par dag pa la dmigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And even though they are one, they are endowed with the observation of the purification of the thoroughly imagined.

original: de ma btang bas legs par 'das //
analyzed: de ma btang bas legs par 'das //
translated: They are well-transcended by not giving them up.

original: zhes bya ba ni de dag gis yongs su grub pa'i phung po ma btang bas legs par 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni de dag gis yongs su grub pa'i phung po ma btang bas legs par 'das so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they are well-transcended by not giving up the aggregates which are their thoroughly established natures.

original: yongs su smin par mdzad pa ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: yongs su smin par mdzad pa ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: A verse on the teaching of their maturation

original: kun kyang 'dres pa'i phrin las can //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: kun kyang 'dres pa'i phrin las can // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All have the same activity of mixing.

original: thams cad kyang sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phrin las mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: thams cad kyang sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa'i phrin las mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: All have the same activity of maturing beings.

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rgya mtshor chu 'dra zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgya mtshor chu 'dra zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Like water in the ocean.

original: ji ltar rgya @183b mtshor 'jug pa'i chu rnams ni nya dang / rus sbal la sogs pa rnams kyi nye bar spyad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya @183b mtshor 'jug pa'i chu rnams ni nya dang / rus sbal la sogs pa rnams kyi nye bar spyad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the water in the ocean is used by fish, turtles, and so on,

original: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings su bzhugs pa de dag kyang /
analyzed: de bzhin du chos kyi dbyings su bzhugs pa de dag kyang /
translated: so also those who dwell in the Dharma-element

original: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa nye bar 'byung ba mnyam pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa nye bar 'byung ba mnyam pa nyid yin no //
translated: The equality of the arising of the activity of bringing sentient beings to maturity.

original: byas so byed do bya'o zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du sems can gzhan gyi don la dgongs pa med ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: byas so byed do bya'o zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du sems can gzhan gyi don la dgongs pa med ces bya ba ste /
translated: The statement “He has done, is doing, and will do” means that he is not without the intention to benefit other sentient beings in the three times.

original: de lta na yang nor bu dang sil snyan bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par 'jug par 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta na yang nor bu dang sil snyan bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi don mdzad par 'jug par 'gyur ba nyid yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Nevertheless, he is engaged in benefiting all sentient beings, like a wish-fulfilling gem and a celestial drum.

original: mthong ba zab pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mthong ba zab pa nyid bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the profundity of his vision,🔽the verse states,

original: gang / sangs rgyas rtag pa'i sku yin no //
analyzed: gang / sangs rgyas rtag pa'i sku yin no //
translated: “The Buddha is the body of the real.”

original: zhes brjod pa de la rtag pa'i sku nyid yin na 'jig rten gyis mi mthong ba de rgyu gang gis mi mthong zhe na /
analyzed: zhes brjod pa de la rtag pa'i sku nyid yin na 'jig rten gyis mi mthong ba de rgyu gang gis mi mthong zhe na /
translated: If he is the body of the real, why is he not seen by the world?

original: sems can nyes pas mi snang ste //
analyzed: sems can nyes pas mi snang ste //
translated: Sentient beings do not see him because of their faults,

original: snod chag pa yi zla ba bzhin //
analyzed: snod chag pa yi zla ba bzhin //
translated: Like the moon in a broken pot.

original: ji ltar snod chag pa'i nang du chu gnas par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: ji ltar snod chag pa'i nang du chu gnas par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Just as water does not remain in a broken pot,

original: de med na yang der zla ba mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med na yang der zla ba mthong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and the moon is not seen there,

original: de bzhin du zhi gnas kyi rlan med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la yang sangs rgyas kyi zla ba mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhi gnas kyi rlan med pa'i sems can gyi rgyud la yang sangs rgyas kyi zla ba mthong bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Likewise, the moon of the Buddhas is not seen in the mental continua of sentient beings who are without the moisture of serenity.

original: 'dir chu zla lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin yin te /
analyzed: 'dir chu zla lta bu ni ting nge 'dzin yin te /
translated: Here, the moon in the water is meditative concentration,

original: rlan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽'jig rten kun la nyi bzhin du //
analyzed: rlan pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // 'jig rten kun la nyi bzhin du //
translated: because it has the nature of moisture.🔽They pervade the world with the light of the Dharma,

original: de dag chos 'od khyab par mdzad //🔽ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag chos 'od khyab par mdzad // ces bya ba ni /
translated: like the sun.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni ma mthong du zin kyang phrin las mdzad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni ma mthong du zin kyang phrin las mdzad pa nyid yin te /
translated: Even though the Buddhas are not seen, they do perform deeds,

original: 'di ltar mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa 'od zer lta bu gang yin pa des /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo'i sde la sogs pa'i chos bstan pa 'od zer lta bu gang yin pa des /
translated: because the Dharma teachings of the sutra collection and so forth, which are like light rays,

original: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten la snang bar mdzad pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa sems can yongs su smin pa la sogs pa 'jig rten la snang bar mdzad pa nyid yin no //
translated: illuminate the world with the deeds of the Buddhas, such as the maturation of sentient beings.

original: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu ston pa zab pa nyid ni /
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / mya ngan las 'das pa kun tu ston pa zab pa nyid ni /
translated: The profundity of the teaching of complete enlightenment and nirvana is

original: la lar rdzogs par byang chub ston //
analyzed: la lar rdzogs par byang chub ston //
translated: In some places they show complete enlightenment,

original: la lar me bzhin mya ngan 'das //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: la lar me bzhin mya ngan 'das // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: For some, like a fire, he passes into Nirvana.

original: la lar rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / la lar mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa ni me bzhin du ste /🔽ji ltar me ni la la na 'bar /
analyzed: la lar rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / la lar mya ngan las 'das pa ston pa ni me bzhin du ste / ji ltar me ni la la na 'bar /
translated: For some, he displays perfect enlightenment, for some, he displays passing into Nirvana, like a fire.

original: la la na zhi ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang sems can yongs su smin pa kha cig la ni mya ngan las 'das par ston la /
analyzed: la la na zhi ba de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyang sems can yongs su smin pa kha cig la ni mya ngan las 'das par ston la /
translated: Just as a fire burns in one place and is extinguished in another, so also the Buddha, for some sentient beings to be trained, displays passing into Nirvana,

original: yongs su ma smin pa kha cig la ni de yongs su grol bar bya ba'i phyir rdzogs par byang chub par ston te /
analyzed: yongs su ma smin pa kha cig la ni de yongs su grol bar bya ba'i phyir rdzogs par byang chub par ston te /
translated: and for some who are not fully ripe, he displays perfect enlightenment in order to liberate them.

original: mer tha mi dad pa gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku gcig la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: mer tha mi dad pa gcig la ji lta ba de bzhin du chos kyi sku gcig la yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Just as a fire, which is not different, is like that, so also the Dharma Body should be viewed as being like that.

original: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma'i don ni go sla'o //🔽bzhugs pa zab pa @184a * //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa lhag ma'i don ni go sla'o // bzhugs pa zab pa @184a * //
translated: The meaning of the remaining verses is easy to understand.

original: nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The profundity of his abiding is shown by the next verse.

original: sangs rgyas 'phags min chos rnams dang // mi dang ngan song ba rnams dang // tshangs spyod ma yin chos rnams las //
analyzed: sangs rgyas 'phags min chos rnams dang // mi dang ngan song ba rnams dang // tshangs spyod ma yin chos rnams las //
translated: And from non-noble dharmas, from humans, from those in unfortunate destinies, and from non-celibate dharmas.

original: bdag nyid dang ni bzhugs pa mchog / ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid dang ni bzhugs pa mchog / ces bya ba la /
translated: The best of selves and the best of abidings.

original: bdag nyid mchog dang bzhugs pa mchog ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid mchog dang bzhugs pa mchog ste /
translated: The best of selves and the best of abidings.

original: 'phags pa la sogs pa'i bzhugs pas bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa la sogs pa'i bzhugs pas bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Abiding is due to the abidings of the noble ones and so forth.

original: de la 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa ni stong pa nyid la bzhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa ni stong pa nyid la bzhugs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Among them, the abiding of the noble ones is that which abides in emptiness.

original: lha'i bzhugs pa ni bsam gtan gyis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: lha'i bzhugs pa ni bsam gtan gyis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding of the gods is abiding in the dhyanas.

original: tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa ni byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa dag gis bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bzhugs pa ni byams pa la sogs pa tshad med pa dag gis bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The abiding of Brahma is abiding in the immeasurables such as love.

original: de la 'phags min chos rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba ste /
analyzed: de la 'phags min chos rnams zhes bya ba ni mi dge ba ste /
translated: Among them, non-noble dharmas are non-virtuous.

original: des de dag stong pa nyid la bzhugs pas de'i phyir yang 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: des de dag stong pa nyid la bzhugs pas de'i phyir yang 'phags pa'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: Since they abide in emptiness, therefore it is also the abiding of the noble ones.

original: gang mi dang ngan song ba rnams kyi sems can de dag la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan de ni lha'i bzhugs pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi dang ngan song ba rnams kyi sems can de dag la dmigs pa'i bsam gtan de ni lha'i bzhugs pa'o //
translated: The meditative concentration of those bodhisattvas who focus on sentient beings in the human and evil destinies is the abode of the gods.

original: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams las mchog kyang yin la bdag nyid kyang yin pas 'di ni bdag nyid mchog ste /
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa ma yin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams las mchog kyang yin la bdag nyid kyang yin pas 'di ni bdag nyid mchog ste /
translated: It is the highest and it is the self, thus it is the highest self.

original: stong pa nyid la bzhugs pa de'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid la bzhugs pa de'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The highest self is the self of the one who abides in emptiness.

original: sku kun tu ston pa zab pa nyid ni /🔽de dag kun tu rnam par dpyod //
analyzed: sku kun tu ston pa zab pa nyid ni / de dag kun tu rnam par dpyod //
translated: The profundity of the manifestation of the body is🔽They analyze everything

original: gang du'ang rnam par dpyod mi mnga' //🔽zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gang du'ang rnam par dpyod mi mnga' // zhes bya ba la /
translated: but do not analyze anything at all.

original: dge ba dang mi dge ba la blo 'jug par 'gyur ba ste ;
analyzed: dge ba dang mi dge ba la blo 'jug par 'gyur ba ste ;
translated: The mind engages in virtue and nonvirtue.

original: de'i rjes las thob pas de dag yong su dpyod la /
analyzed: de'i rjes las thob pas de dag yong su dpyod la /
translated: The post equipoise state analyzes those.

original: rnam par mi rtog pas ni gang la yang dpyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: rnam par mi rtog pas ni gang la yang dpyod par mi byed do //
translated: The nonconceptual does not analyze anything at all.

original: don gzhan gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i skus ni thams cad la dpyod par byed la /
analyzed: don gzhan gnyis pa ni sprul pa'i skus ni thams cad la dpyod par byed la /
translated: The second alternative is that the emanation body analyzes everything

original: sku gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sku gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
translated: but the other bodies do not.

original: gnas rnams kun na'ang mthong mod kyi //
analyzed: gnas rnams kun na'ang mthong mod kyi //
translated: Although it is seen in all places,

original: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i lus de nyid thams cad du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sprul pa'i lus de nyid thams cad du mthong bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that that very emanation body is seen everywhere.

original: dbang po drug gi spyod yul min //
analyzed: dbang po drug gi spyod yul min //
translated: It is not an object of the six sense faculties.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pas mthong ba'i sprul pa de ni der skyes pa de dag 'dul ba'i phyir yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs par skyes pas mthong ba'i sprul pa de ni der skyes pa de dag 'dul ba'i phyir yin gyi /
translated: This means that the emanation body that is seen by those born in the hells and so on is for the purpose of taming those born there.

original: de dag nyid ni sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid ni sprul pa'i sku'i ngo bo nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: However, those born there are not the essence of the emanation body itself.

original: dmyal ba de dag gis de mthong ba na 'di yang sems can dmyal ba yin no zhes shes pas yang dmyal ba de dag gis de dbang po drug gi spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dmyal ba de dag gis de mthong ba na 'di yang sems can dmyal ba yin no zhes shes pas yang dmyal ba de dag gis de dbang po drug gi spyod yul du gyur pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: When those hell beings see it, they think, “This is also a hell being.” Therefore, those hell beings do not make it an object of the six sense faculties.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pa zab pa nyid ston pa ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pa zab pa nyid ston pa ni /
translated: The profundity of the abandonment of the afflictions is taught:

original: nyon mongs thul la spangs pa @184b med ;
analyzed: nyon mongs thul la spangs pa @184b med ;
translated: For one who has conquered the afflictions, there is no abandonment,

original: ; sngags kyis bsad pa'i dug dang 'dra //
analyzed: ; sngags kyis bsad pa'i dug dang 'dra //
translated: Like poison destroyed by a mantra.

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: This means that

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyi kun nas dkris pa'i nyon mongs pa thul na yang nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gnas skabs kyi kun nas dkris pa'i nyon mongs pa thul na yang nyon mongs pa spangs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: When the bodhisattva has subdued the afflictions that are entanglements in the state of a bodhisattva, he has not yet abandoned the afflictions,

original: de'i bag la nyal yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bag la nyal yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their latent impressions remain.

original: sngags kyis bsad pa'i dug dang 'dra //🔽zhes bya ba ni ji ltar /
analyzed: sngags kyis bsad pa'i dug dang 'dra // zhes bya ba ni ji ltar /
translated: They are like poison that has been neutralized by a mantra.🔽This is like the case of poison that has been neutralized by a mantra.

original: sngags kyis bsad pa'i dug gis ni 'chi bar mi nus pa de bzhin du de dag gis kyang nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngags kyis bsad pa'i dug gis ni 'chi bar mi nus pa de bzhin du de dag gis kyang nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pas kun nas nyon mongs par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the poison cannot cause death, in the same way, they do not cause affliction because they fully understand the afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni nyon mongs las //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni nyon mongs las //
translated: The buddhas, though free from the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs zad pa kun mkhyen brnyes //
analyzed: nyon mongs zad pa kun mkhyen brnyes //
translated: attain omniscience through the elimination of the afflictions.

original: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i bag chags bzung ba dang ldan pa ni nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i bag chags bzung ba dang ldan pa ni nyan thos bzhin du mya ngan las 'da' bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they do not attain nirvana like the sravakas, because they retain the impressions of the afflictions.

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zad pa dang bcas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zad pa dang bcas pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa nyid brnyes zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The Buddhas means those who have attained the knowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zab pa nyid de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa zab pa nyid de bstan par bya ste /
translated: The profundity of the inconceivable will now be taught.

original: de yang 'di ltar /🔽nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar / nyon mongs byang chub yan lag 'gyur //
translated: And that is as follows:

original: zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The members of enlightenment are the impurities.

original: kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
analyzed: kun 'byung gi bden pa'o //
translated: The truth of the origin of suffering.

original: 'khor ba'ang zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni zhi ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: 'khor ba'ang zhes bya ba sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ni zhi ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: Samsara is also means the truth of suffering has the nature of peace.

original: de lta bu thams cad kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa sngar bstan pa rgyu gsum gyis so sor rang gis rig par bya ba yin par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu thams cad kyis ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gyis mi khyab pa sngar bstan pa rgyu gsum gyis so sor rang gis rig par bya ba yin par bstan pa yin no //
translated: All of this shows that the inconceivable of the Tathagata is to be individually intuited through the three causes that were previously taught.

original: da ni ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi skur rjes su dran zhe na /
analyzed: da ni ji ltar sangs rgyas rnams chos kyi skur rjes su dran zhe na /
translated: Now, how do the Buddhas recollect the Dharma Body?

original: byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bdun gyis rjes su dran par byed cing de dag gis de bsgom pa nyid do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas rnam pa bdun gyis rjes su dran par byed cing de dag gis de bsgom pa nyid do //
translated: The Bodhisattva recollects through seven aspects and meditates on it through them.

original: de la chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dag gis chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba de dag nyid kyis gnas pa ste /
analyzed: de la chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni mngon par shes pa dag gis chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba de dag nyid kyis gnas pa ste /
translated: Mastery over all phenomena refers to the buddhas' mastery over all phenomena through their higher perceptions.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa can du sangs rgyas rnams 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad du thogs pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa can du sangs rgyas rnams 'gyur gyi /
translated: They abide in that mastery because the buddhas have unobstructed higher perceptions in all world systems.

original: nyan thos bzhin du thogs pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos bzhin du thogs pa dang bcas pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not like the sravakas, who have obstructed higher perceptions.

original: gal te chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba yin na de ci'i phyir sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das par mi byed ce na /
analyzed: gal te chos thams cad la dbang sgyur ba yin na de ci'i phyir sems can thams cad mya ngan las 'das par mi byed ce na /
translated: If they have mastery over all phenomena, why do they not bring all sentient beings to nirvana?

original: de tshigs su bcad pas ston par byed de /🔽rgyu gang gi phyir mya ngan las bzla bar mi nus pa ni /
analyzed: de tshigs su bcad pas ston par byed de / rgyu gang gi phyir mya ngan las bzla bar mi nus pa ni /
translated: This is taught in the verse:🔽The reason they cannot be brought to nirvana is:

original: bsgrubs shing rgyu dang mi ldan la //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bsgrubs shing rgyu dang mi ldan la // zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are not endowed with the cause.🔽This is explained in the verse:

original: de la bsgribs shing zhes bya ba ni gang las las la sogs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa @185a * //
analyzed: de la bsgribs shing zhes bya ba ni gang las las la sogs pa'i sgrib pas bsgribs pa @185a * //
translated: They are obscured by obscurations to action and so on.

original: sangs rgyas mang pos kyang mya ngan las bzla bar mi nus so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mang pos kyang mya ngan las bzla bar mi nus so //
translated: Many buddhas also cannot deliver them from suffering.

original: re zhig de dag la rnam pa de lta bur sangs rgyas rnams la yang nus pa mi mnga' ba nyid do //
analyzed: re zhig de dag la rnam pa de lta bur sangs rgyas rnams la yang nus pa mi mnga' ba nyid do //
translated: For a while, even the buddhas do not have the power to do that to them.

original: rgyu dang mi ldan la zhes bya ba ni yong su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni 'dir rgyu dang mi ldan par 'dod de /
