analyzed: rgyu dang mi ldan la zhes bya ba ni yong su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can ni 'dir rgyu dang mi ldan par 'dod de /
translated: Those who are not endowed with a cause means those who are not destined for nirvana are considered here to be not endowed with a cause.

original: gang la de'i rigs med pa'o //
analyzed: gang la de'i rigs med pa'o //
translated: They are those in whom the lineage has been severed.

original: nges pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nges pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Endowed with two certainties means

original: nges pa gnyis ni las byas par nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa so sor myong bar nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa gnyis ni las byas par nges pa dang / rnam par smin pa so sor myong bar nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: that the two certainties are understood to be the certainty of having committed the action and the certainty of experiencing the ripening.

original: de'i phyir na yang nges pa gnyis po de dag la sangs rgyas rnams la nus pa mi mnga'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang nges pa gnyis po de dag la sangs rgyas rnams la nus pa mi mnga'o //
translated: Therefore, even the buddhas do not have the power to do that to those who have the two certainties.

original: de la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni lkugs pa'i dngos po la sogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de la rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni lkugs pa'i dngos po la sogs pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: In that regard, the obscuration to ripening should be understood as the state of being mute, and so on.

original: rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba ni yang dmyal ba la sogs pa dag tu nges par 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa so sor myong ba ni yang dmyal ba la sogs pa dag tu nges par 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The experience of the maturation is that one definitely goes to the hells, etc.

original: de ni de dag gi bye brag go //
analyzed: de ni de dag gi bye brag go //
translated: This is the distinction of those.

original: sku rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni dri ma las rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa de ni rtag pa yin la /
analyzed: sku rtag pa'o zhes bya ba ni dri ma las rnam par grol ba'i de bzhin nyid rgyun mi 'chad pa de ni rtag pa yin la /
translated: The body is permanent means that suchness, which is liberated from the defilements, is uninterrupted and therefore permanent.

original: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin te /
analyzed: de ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku yin te /
translated: And that is the body of the Tathagata.

original: de'i phyir na sku rtag pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na sku rtag pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the body is permanent.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams longs spyod chen po mnga' ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de ni chen po yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams longs spyod chen po mnga' ba'o zhes bya ba ni gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de ni chen po yin la /
translated: The Tathagatas possess great enjoyment means that the completely purified buddhaverse is great.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rjes su longs spyod par mdzad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis rjes su longs spyod par mdzad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: And it should be understood that the Tathagatas enjoy it.

original: don chen po'o zhes bya ba'i don chen po nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa rnams yongs su grol bar mdzad pa dang / ma smin pa rnams smin pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'i mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: don chen po'o zhes bya ba'i don chen po nyid ni sangs rgyas rnams kyis sems can yongs su smin par mdzad pa rnams yongs su grol bar mdzad pa dang / ma smin pa rnams smin pa dang / mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ba'i mya ngan las 'da' bar byed pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: The meaning of “great meaning” is that the Buddhas liberate those sentient beings who have been matured, mature those who have not been matured, and cause those who have been matured to attain nirvana through complete enlightenment.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa'i rnam pa lhag ma rnams kyi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the remaining aspects of mindfulness of the Buddha is easy to understand.🔽These very seven aspects of mindfulness of the Buddha are indicated by two verses.

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam pa bdun po de dag nyid yang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa rnam pa bdun po de dag nyid yang tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa ni /
translated: The first verse states:

original: rang gi sems la rag las dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi sems la rag las dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The first line of the verse indicates the perfection of the Buddha, which is dependent on one’s own mind.

original: de la rnam pa bdun po des ni phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
analyzed: de la rnam pa bdun po des ni phun sum tshogs pa bstan te /
translated: Among these seven aspects, the first indicates perfection.

original: de la re zhig dang por rang gi sems la rag las pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa dran par bya'o //
analyzed: de la re zhig dang por rang gi sems la rag las pa'o zhes byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs pa dran par bya'o //
translated: Here, the bodhisattva should recollect the perfection of the Buddha, which is dependent on one’s own mind.

original: de yang rtag dang dge ldan te //
analyzed: de yang rtag dang dge ldan te //
translated: It is eternal and virtuous.

original: de'i phyir na yang mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang mchog tu kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is also supremely free from reproach.

original: btsal mi dgos zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis @185b grub par sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: btsal mi dgos zhes bya ba ni lhun gyis @185b grub par sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad pa'o //
translated: It is not sought means that it performs the deeds of a Buddha spontaneously.

original: chos kyi longs spyod chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: chos kyi longs spyod chen po ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The great enjoyment of Dharma should be understood as the purification of the Buddha land.

original: dbang du ma gyur rab tu rgyu //
analyzed: dbang du ma gyur rab tu rgyu //
translated: It is not under control, yet it is very active.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal gyi dbang du ma gyur pa yang yin la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang sdug bsngal gyi dbang du ma gyur pa yang yin la /
translated: This means that it is not under the control of suffering,

original: de ni rab tu rgyu ba yang yod de /
analyzed: de ni rab tu rgyu ba yang yod de /
translated: but it is active.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the conventional usage of the Buddhas.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar /🔽skye bo mang por de 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar / skye bo mang por de 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽One desires it for the sake of many beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni skye bo mang po'i don 'dod pas phun sum tshogs pa rjes su dran pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni skye bo mang po'i don 'dod pas phun sum tshogs pa rjes su dran pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: This is the recollection of the perfection that consists of desiring the welfare of many beings.

original: gang yang stong phrag brgya pa'i mdo sde'i gleng gzhi las sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rab tu bstan te /
analyzed: gang yang stong phrag brgya pa'i mdo sde'i gleng gzhi las sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa rab tu bstan te /
translated: Moreover, the introduction to the Sūtra of a Hundred Thousand Stanzas on the Perfection of Sublime Insight clearly reveals the utterly pure buddha field.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de'i yon tan phul du byung ba gang yin pa de tshig 'di rnams kyis gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de'i yon tan phul du byung ba gang yin pa de tshig 'di rnams kyis gsal bar byed de /
translated: The following verses clarify the sublime qualities of that utterly pure buddha field.

original: re zhig kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni rin po che sna bdun te /
analyzed: re zhig kha dog phun sum tshogs pa ni rin po che sna bdun te /
translated: First, the perfection of color refers to the seven precious substances:🔽gold, silver, beryl, musāragalva, emerald, coral, and ruby.

original: gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'u rya dang / mu sa la gar ba dang / rdo'i snying po dang / de smos pas ma rgad la sogs pa yang gzung bar rig par bya ba dang / mu tig dmar po ste /
analyzed: gser dang / dngul dang / bee d'u rya dang / mu sa la gar ba dang / rdo'i snying po dang / de smos pas ma rgad la sogs pa yang gzung bar rig par bya ba dang / mu tig dmar po ste /
translated: The mention of the latter includes onyx and so forth.

original: de yang srog chags dmar po zhig gi nang nas 'byung ste /
analyzed: de yang srog chags dmar po zhig gi nang nas 'byung ste /
translated: Coral is a red creature that comes from the ocean.

original: de yang thams cad kyi mchog yin te /
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi mchog yin te /
translated: It is the best of all.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rin po che'i rgyal pos kun tu snang bar byed de /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams dpag tu med pa rin po che'i rgyal pos kun tu snang bar byed de /
translated: It illuminates countless world systems with the light of precious substances.

original: bshad ma thag pa'i rin po che rnams las kun tu byung bas so //🔽tshig gcig gis ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: bshad ma thag pa'i rin po che rnams las kun tu byung bas so // tshig gcig gis ni dbyibs phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: because it arises from the jewels that have just been mentioned.🔽One verse on the perfection of form.

original: tshig gcig gis ni tshad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni tshad phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: One verse on the perfection of size.

original: tshig gcig gis ni yul phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis ni yul phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: One verse on the perfection of domain.

original: ji lta bu'i rgyu las she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu'i rgyu las she na /
translated: What is the cause of these perfections?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i bla ma rjes las thob pa dang / de dag gnyi ga'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las yang dag par byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa rnam par mi rtog pa dang / de'i bla ma rjes las thob pa dang / de dag gnyi ga'i dge ba'i rtsa ba las yang dag par byung ba'i dge ba'i rtsa ba ni rgyu yin te /
translated: The cause is the root of virtue that arises from the supramundane, nonconceptual intuition, from the subsequent pure mundane intuition, and from the roots of virtue of both of these.

original: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu yang tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: rgyu phun sum tshogs pa de lta bu yang tshig gcig gis so //
translated: The perfection of cause is also indicated in one verse.

original: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis so //
translated: The perfection of result is also indicated in one verse.

original: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rigs la gang dbang sgyur ba'i mtshan nyid de ni bdag po phun sum tshogs pa ste tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: shin tu rnam par dag pa'i rigs la gang dbang sgyur ba'i mtshan nyid de ni bdag po phun sum tshogs pa ste tshig gcig gis so //
translated: The perfection of mastery is the mastery over the extremely pure lineage, indicated in one verse.

original: phyogs phun sum tshogs pa ni tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: phyogs phun sum tshogs pa ni tshig gcig gis so //
translated: The perfection of domain is indicated in one verse.

original: zham ring ba phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis so //🔽de dag nyid la klu smos pas ni lto 'phye chen po yang gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: zham ring ba phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis so // de dag nyid la klu smos pas ni lto 'phye chen po yang gzung bar bya ste /
translated: The perfection of attendants is also stated in one verse.🔽The mention of nagas there also includes mahoragas.

original: sprul chen po bsdu ba'i phyir ro //🔽de la nye bar ston @186a * //🔽par byed pa ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
analyzed: sprul chen po bsdu ba'i phyir ro // de la nye bar ston @186a * // par byed pa ni ston pa phun sum tshogs pa yin te /
translated: Because they are included in the great serpents.🔽The perfection of teacher is stated in one verse.

original: tshig gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gcig gis bstan to //
translated: The perfection of teaching is stated in one verse.

original: de dag brjod nas phrin las gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de dag brjod nas phrin las gang yin zhe na /
translated: Having described those, what is the activity?

original: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad mdzad pa ste /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don thams cad mdzad pa ste /
translated: It is the performance of all the aims of all sentient beings.

original: phun sum tshogs pa de yang tshig gcig gis so //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa de yang tshig gcig gis so //
translated: That perfection is also stated in one verse.

original: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis te /
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis te /
translated: The perfection of benefit is also stated in one verse.

original: gang gi phyir der nyon mongs pa yang mi 'byung sdug bsngal yang mi 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir der nyon mongs pa yang mi 'byung sdug bsngal yang mi 'byung ba'o //
translated: Because neither afflictions nor suffering arise there.

original: gang la dgra med pa de ni 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la dgra med pa de ni 'jigs pa med pa yin te /
translated: One who has no enemies has no fear.

original: bdun bzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdun bzhi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no fourth.

original: yang de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na phung po'i bdud yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: yang de ni sangs rgyas kyi zhing de na phung po'i bdud yod pa ma yin /
translated: Moreover, in that buddha-field, the demon of the aggregates does not exist,

original: nyon mongs pa'i bdud yod pa ma yin /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bdud yod pa ma yin /
translated: The demon of the afflictions does not exist.

original: 'chi bdag gi bdud yod pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'chi bdag gi bdud yod pa ma yin na /
translated: The demon of the Lord of Death does not exist.

original: lha'i bu'i bdud yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu'i bdud yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The demon of the sons of the gods does not exist.

original: de'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jigs pa med pa phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is called the perfection of fearlessness.

original: de yang tshig gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang tshig gcig gis bstan to //
translated: That is taught by one verse.

original: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yang gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: gnas phun sum tshogs pa yang gcig gis bstan to //
translated: The perfection of abode is taught by one verse.

original: yang lam gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa der de 'jug de na /
analyzed: yang lam gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa der de 'jug de na /
translated: By what path does one enter into that buddha-land that is purified by the bodhisattva?

original: theg pa chen po thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis te /
analyzed: theg pa chen po thos pa dang / bsams pa dang / bsgoms pa'i shes rab kyis te /
translated: By the path of the Great Vehicle, through the wisdom that comes from hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa chen po dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: dran pa dang / blo gros dang / rtogs pa chen po dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: It should be connected in order with great mindfulness, understanding, and realization.

original: lam phun sum tshogs pa de yang tshig gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: lam phun sum tshogs pa de yang tshig gcig gis bstan to //
translated: That perfection of path is taught by one verse.

original: bzhon pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
analyzed: bzhon pa ni zhi gnas dang lhag mthong ste /
translated: The vehicle is calm abiding and insight,

original: des 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one goes by means of them.

original: phun sum tshogs pa de yang gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa de yang gcig gis bstan to //
translated: That perfection is taught by one verse.

original: sgo gang nas der 'jug ce na /
analyzed: sgo gang nas der 'jug ce na /
translated: By what door does one enter there?

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa nyid ni sgo phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa nyid ni sgo phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The perfection of the gate is emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: de yang tshig gcig gis bstan to //
analyzed: de yang tshig gcig gis bstan to //
translated: This is taught in one verse.

original: gzhi phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis bstan te /🔽ji ltar sa gzhi rlung gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu brten cing gnas pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de dag la brten cing gnas shes na /
analyzed: gzhi phun sum tshogs pa yang tshig gcig gis bstan te / ji ltar sa gzhi rlung gi dkyil 'khor la rab tu brten cing gnas pa de bzhin du sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa de dag la brten cing gnas shes na /
translated: The perfection of the basis is taught in one verse.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas brgyan pa'i rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po bkod pa la brten pa na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs tshad med pas brgyan pa'i rin po che'i padma'i rgyal po chen po bkod pa la brten pa na zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the earth rests and is supported by the circle of wind, so those pure buddha-fields rest and are supported by that great king of jeweled lotuses adorned with immeasurable collections of qualities.

original: yongs su dag pa de'i longs spyod ni shin tu gtsang ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: yongs su dag pa de'i longs spyod ni shin tu gtsang ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The enjoyment of that purity is said to be very pure.

original: gang gi phyir de'i gtsang ba nyid ni de na phyi sa la sogs pa mi gtsang ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de'i gtsang ba nyid ni de na phyi sa la sogs pa mi gtsang ba med pa nyid do //
translated: For its purity is that there is no impurity such as excrement there.

original: shin tu bde ba ni gang tshor ba bde ba 'ba' zhig dang ldan gyi sdug bsngal yang med cing @186b btang snyoms kyang med pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu bde ba ni gang tshor ba bde ba 'ba' zhig dang ldan gyi sdug bsngal yang med cing @186b btang snyoms kyang med pa'o //
translated: Very happy means that it is endowed only with the feeling of pleasure, and neither with pain nor with indifference.

original: shin tu kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /🔽'di ltar de ni mi dge ba'am /
analyzed: shin tu kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya ba ni / 'di ltar de ni mi dge ba'am /
translated: Very irreproachable means

original: lung du ma bstan pa med pa'o //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa med pa'o //
translated: that it is neither nonvirtuous nor neutral.

original: shin tu dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: shin tu dbang sgyur ba zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Very controlled means

original: des rang gi sems la dbang sgyur ba yin pa'i phyir gang rkyen gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'o //
analyzed: des rang gi sems la dbang sgyur ba yin pa'i phyir gang rkyen gzhan la ni mi ltos pa'o //
translated: that it is not dependent on other conditions, because it controls its own mind.

original: yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings de ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi dbyings de ni zhes bya ba ni chos kyi sku'o //
translated: Moreover, that dharmadhatu of the Buddhas, which is called the Dharma Body,

original: de yang phrin las lnga dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de yang phrin las lnga dang ldan par rig par bya'o //
translated: is to be known as having five actions.

original: sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa las yongs su skyong ba'i phrin las can zhes bya ba ni gang gis khams gsum las shin tu 'da' bar byed pa'i lam de 'jig rten la ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi gnod pa las yongs su skyong ba'i phrin las can zhes bya ba ni gang gis khams gsum las shin tu 'da' bar byed pa'i lam de 'jig rten la ston pa'o //
translated: It has the action of protecting from harm to all sentient beings, because it shows to the world the path by which one transcends the three realms.

original: khams gsum ni 'dir 'jig tshogs smos pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: khams gsum ni 'dir 'jig tshogs smos pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The three realms are indicated here by the word “aggregates. ”

original: tshig lhag ma rnams kyi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: tshig lhag ma rnams kyi don ni go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of the rest of the passage is self-evident.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad phrin las lnga po 'di dag gis phrin las mnyam pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad phrin las lnga po 'di dag gis phrin las mnyam pa yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that all Buddhas are equal in their activities.

original: 'dir don 'di dag gi tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir don 'di dag gi tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: Here is a verse on these topics:

original: rgyu dang gnas dang bya ba dang ni bsam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi phrin las mnyam pa nyid de rgyu gang gis yin pa rgyas par bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu dang gnas dang bya ba dang ni bsam pa dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gang sangs rgyas rnams kyi phrin las mnyam pa nyid de rgyu gang gis yin pa rgyas par bstan to //
translated: The verse beginning “The cause, the ground, the action, the aspiration, the skillful means, and the essence” explains in detail what the cause is of the equality of activities of the Buddhas.

original: gang yang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yul gyi las nyid gang yin pa de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bstan te /🔽'jig rten pa rnams kyi rgyu tha dad pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di ltar dmyal ba yang rgyu gzhan las ;
analyzed: gang yang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi yul gyi las nyid gang yin pa de ni tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis bstan te / 'jig rten pa rnams kyi rgyu tha dad pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di ltar dmyal ba yang rgyu gzhan las ;
translated: The rest of the verse shows the activities of the Buddhas in the world.🔽The activities of worldly people are different because of their different causes.🔽Thus, hell beings are born from one cause,

original: mi rnams kyang rgyu gzhan las de bzhin du yi dags kyi bar du yang ste /
analyzed: mi rnams kyang rgyu gzhan las de bzhin du yi dags kyi bar du yang ste /
translated: humans from another, and so on up to the hungry ghosts.

original: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa des na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rgyu tha dad pa des na /
translated: Therefore, because of the difference in causes,

original: 'jig rten rnams kyi las ni tha dad gyur par 'dod /
analyzed: 'jig rten rnams kyi las ni tha dad gyur par 'dod /
translated: the actions of the worlds are considered to be different.

original: gnas tha dad pa nyid ni 'di ltar 'di dag gis gnas tha dad pa ste lus so //
analyzed: gnas tha dad pa nyid ni 'di ltar 'di dag gis gnas tha dad pa ste lus so //
translated: The difference in location is that they have different bodies.

original: des na las kyang tha dad do //
analyzed: des na las kyang tha dad do //
translated: Therefore, their actions are also different.

original: bya ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzhan dag ni tshong byed /
analyzed: bya ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gzhan dag ni tshong byed /
translated: The difference in activity is that some engage in commerce,

original: gzhan dag ni gar byed pa la sogs pa'i las tha dad pa dang rab tu ldan pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gar byed pa la sogs pa'i las tha dad pa dang rab tu ldan pa ste /
translated: some in dancing, and so on, and they are endowed with different activities.

original: de'i phyir bya ba tha dad pas kyang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir bya ba tha dad pas kyang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of the difference in activity, the actions of the worlds are different.

original: bsam pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bsam pa tha dad pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The difference in intention is that

original: bsam pa ni 'dir mos pa ste /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'dir mos pa ste /
translated: intention here is interest.

original: de lta bas na bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi las tha dad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na bsam pa tha dad pa'i phyir yang 'jig rten pa rnams kyi las tha dad do //
translated: Therefore, because of the difference in intention, the actions of the worlds are different.

original: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di ltar tha dad pa nyid du 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: 'du byed rnams kyang 'di ltar tha dad pa nyid du 'jug pa ste /
translated: The formations also operate as different.

original: gang 'du byed pa rnams kyi bya ba tha dad pa gang yin pa de yin no //
analyzed: gang 'du byed pa rnams kyi bya ba tha dad pa gang yin pa de yin no //
translated: That is the difference in the activity of the formations.

original: gang dag gi zhes na /
analyzed: gang dag gi zhes na /
translated: Whose?

original: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of the worldly.

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa'i bya ba yin pas de dag @187a * //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi ni lhun gyis grub par mdzad pa'i bya ba yin pas de dag @187a * //
translated: The activities of the Buddhas are spontaneous, and therefore

original: thams cad med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi rgyu la sogs pa tha dad pa med pas de'i phyir de dag rnams kyi phyin las kyi mdzad pa la tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: thams cad med pa'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams kyi rgyu la sogs pa tha dad pa med pas de'i phyir de dag rnams kyi phyin las kyi mdzad pa la tha dad pa med do //
translated: they are not different from the Buddhas in terms of cause, etc. Therefore, their activities are not different.

original: theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa dgongs pa can du gsungs pa yin par ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
analyzed: theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa dgongs pa can du gsungs pa yin par ston pa'i tshigs su bcad pa ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to show that the teaching of a single vehicle is interpretable in meaning.

original: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: kha cig dag ni drang phyir dang // zhes bya ba la /
translated: Some are led to it,

original: nyan thos rigs ma nges pa rnams theg pa chen po drang bar bya ba'i ched du ste /
analyzed: nyan thos rigs ma nges pa rnams theg pa chen po drang bar bya ba'i ched du ste /
translated: Some disciples of undetermined lineage are led to the Great Vehicle.

original: ma nges pa de ci nas kyang theg pa chen por mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma nges pa de ci nas kyang theg pa chen por mya ngan las 'da' bar bya'o zhes bya'o //
translated: They are not determined, but are to be led to Nirvana by the Great Vehicle.

original: gzhan yang kun tu gzung ba'i phyir //
analyzed: gzhan yang kun tu gzung ba'i phyir //
translated: And others are to be converted.

original: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rigs ma nges pa gang yin pa de dag ci nas theg pa chen po la thun mong du 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po bor nas nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' bar ma gyur cig ces bya bas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rigs ma nges pa gang yin pa de dag ci nas theg pa chen po la thun mong du 'gyur ba dang / theg pa chen po bor nas nyan thos kyi theg pas mya ngan las 'da' bar ma gyur cig ces bya bas so //
translated: This is for those Bodhisattvas who are not of fixed potential, so that they will be in common with the Great Vehicle, and so that they will not fall from the Great Vehicle and attain Nirvana by means of the Disciple Vehicle.

original: don de dag gi phyir theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: don de dag gi phyir theg pa gcig nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: For these reasons, the One Vehicle is taught.

original: yang ma nges pa rnams kyi don ni go sla'o //
analyzed: yang ma nges pa rnams kyi don ni go sla'o //
translated: Moreover, the meaning of the indeterminate is easy to understand.

original: chos dang bdag med grol mthun phyir //
analyzed: chos dang bdag med grol mthun phyir //
translated: Because of the similarity of Dharma, selflessness, and liberation,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba la /
translated: and so on at length.

original: 'dir yang dgongs pa'i dbang gis theg pa gcig nyid du gcig par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dir yang dgongs pa'i dbang gis theg pa gcig nyid du gcig par bstan to //
translated: Here, too, the One Vehicle is taught by the power of suggestion.

original: yang 'di'i dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di'i dgongs pa gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is the suggestion here?

original: chos mthun pa'i phyir dang / bdag med pa mthun pa'i phyir dang grol ba mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos mthun pa'i phyir dang / bdag med pa mthun pa'i phyir dang grol ba mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the similarity of Dharma, the similarity of selflessness, and the similarity of liberation.

original: de la chos mthun pa nyid ni re zhig 'dir chos ni de bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de la chos mthun pa nyid ni re zhig 'dir chos ni de bzhin nyid do //
translated: Here, the similarity of Dharma is that the Dharma is thusness.

original: de ni mthun pa nyid de /
analyzed: de ni mthun pa nyid de /
translated: That is the similarity.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad 'dir 'gro bar bya ba yin pas na theg pa chen po zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad 'dir 'gro bar bya ba yin pas na theg pa chen po zhes byas nas so //
translated: Since all śrāvakas and so on are to go there, it is called the Great Vehicle.

original: de mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir theg pa gcig nyid do //🔽bdag med pa mthun pa nyid ni bdag dang gang zag med pas de'i phyir med pa 'di la 'di ni nyan thos so //
analyzed: de mthun pa nyid yin pa'i phyir theg pa gcig nyid do // bdag med pa mthun pa nyid ni bdag dang gang zag med pas de'i phyir med pa 'di la 'di ni nyan thos so //
translated: Since it is similar, there is only one vehicle.

original: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes brjod par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub sems dpa'o zhes brjod par mi rigs te /
translated: The similarity of selflessness is that since there is no self or person, it is not correct to say that this is a śrāvaka and that is a bodhisattva.

original: de'i phyir na yang bdag med pa la dgongs nas theg pa gcig nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang bdag med pa la dgongs nas theg pa gcig nyid do //
translated: Therefore, with regard to selflessness, there is only one vehicle.

original: grol ba mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa las grol ba mthun pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: grol ba mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyang nyon mongs pa las grol ba mthun pa nyid yin te /
translated: The similarity of liberation is that śrāvakas and so on are similar in being liberated from the afflictions.

original: de'i phyir 'di la dgongs nas kyang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di la dgongs nas kyang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
translated: Therefore, with regard to that, it is also taught that there is only one vehicle.

original: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba ni tha dad du bya ba med do zhes gsungs so /🔽// / bam po brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang rnam par grol ba dang / rnam par grol ba ni tha dad du bya ba med do zhes gsungs so / // / bam po brgyad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavān also said, “Liberation and the liberated one are not to be differentiated.”

original: rigs ni tha dad ces bya ba ni gang la rigs tha dad pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: rigs ni tha dad ces bya ba ni gang la rigs tha dad pa yod pa ste /
translated: The phrase “different lineages” means that there are those who have different lineages.

original: rigs ma nges pa'i @187b nyan thos dag sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba la dgongs nas kyang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: rigs ma nges pa'i @187b nyan thos dag sangs rgyas su 'gyur ba la dgongs nas kyang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
translated: With the intention that the śrāvakas of unfixed lineage will become buddhas, he also taught that there is only one vehicle.

original: bsam gnyis rnyed phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam pa gnyis thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bsam gnyis rnyed phyir zhes bya ba ni bsam pa gnyis thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase “in order to attain the two aspirations” means that in order to attain the two aspirations.

original: gcig ni mnyam pa nyid kyi bsam pa ste /
analyzed: gcig ni mnyam pa nyid kyi bsam pa ste /
translated: The first is the aspiration of sameness.

original: gang gis sems can thams cad gang yin pa nyid ni bdag yin la /
analyzed: gang gis sems can thams cad gang yin pa nyid ni bdag yin la /
translated: It is the thought that “what all sentient beings are is what I am,

original: bdag kyang de dag nyid yin no zhes de ltar 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag kyang de dag nyid yin no zhes de ltar 'dzin pa ste /
translated: and what I am is what they are.”

original: de ltar 'dzin pas kyang de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur bas de dag kyang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de ltar 'dzin pas kyang de mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur bas de dag kyang mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas par gyur ba yin te /
translated: By holding that thought, they will fully awaken to buddhahood, and so they will fully awaken to buddhahood.

original: dgongs pa de'i phyir yang theg pa gcig nyid do //
analyzed: dgongs pa de'i phyir yang theg pa gcig nyid do //
translated: For this reason too there is only one vehicle.

original: yang bsam pa gnyis pa ni gang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po las nyan thos lung bstan pa de dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyis kyang chos nyid mnyam pa nyid la dgongs nas /
analyzed: yang bsam pa gnyis pa ni gang dam pa'i chos padma dkar po las nyan thos lung bstan pa de dag gis ni sangs rgyas kyis kyang chos nyid mnyam pa nyid la dgongs nas /
translated: Again, the second thought is that in the Sutra of the White Lotus of the Sacred Doctrine, those who were predicted to become Sravakas had the thought that the Buddha, intending the equality of the Dharma nature,🔽had attained the Dharma body itself.

original: chos kyi sku thob pa nyid yin no zhes bsams nas mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa dang / mthun pa'i bsam pa thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid yang dag par thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos kyi sku thob pa nyid yin no zhes bsams nas mnyam pa nyid la dgongs pa dang / mthun pa'i bsam pa thob pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos nyid yang dag par thob pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having attained the thought of equality, they attained the true nature of the Buddha.

original: don gzhan yang de lta bu'i ming can gyi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de lung bstan pa yin pas sprul pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan yang de lta bu'i ming can gyi byang chub sems dpa'i 'khor de lung bstan pa yin pas sprul pa'i phyir yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Again, the other meaning is that the assembly of Bodhisattvas, so named, were predicted, and so he says, “also, in order to emanate them.”

original: ji ltar ngas mngon par shes te /
analyzed: ji ltar ngas mngon par shes te /
translated: As I have understood it,

original: da nyid lan brgya stong du mar nyan thos kyi theg par mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes pa de lta bu la dgongs nas theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: da nyid lan brgya stong du mar nyan thos kyi theg par mya ngan las 'das par gyur to zhes pa de lta bu la dgongs nas theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
translated: With the intention that they have already attained nirvana in the Hearer Vehicle hundreds of thousands of times, he taught a single vehicle.

original: gang nyan thos kyi theg pas gdul ba'i sems can rnams mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no //🔽mthar phyin pas na zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar theg pa 'dis mthar phyin par grol bar bya ba'i theg pa gzhan ni med pas sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa de dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas de las dgongs
analyzed: gang nyan thos kyi theg pas gdul ba'i sems can rnams mya ngan las bzla ba'i phyir bstan pa yin no // mthar phyin pas na zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar theg pa 'dis mthar phyin par grol bar bya ba'i theg pa gzhan ni med pas sangs rgyas kyi theg pa 'di ni nyan thos la sogs pa de dag las khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas de las dgongs
translated: It was taught in order to lead those sentient beings who are to be guided by the Hearer Vehicle to nirvana.

original: nas kyang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
analyzed: nas kyang theg pa gcig nyid du bstan te /
translated: Because it is the ultimate means that since there is no other vehicle by which to attain liberation, this Buddha vehicle is superior to those of the Hearers and so on. With the intention of that superiority, he taught a single vehicle.

original: da ni sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi sku mnyam pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: da ni sangs rgyas thams cad chos kyi sku mnyam pa nyid yin na /
translated: Now, if all Buddhas are the same in having the Dharma body,

original: yang rgyu gang gis gcig nyid dam mang po nyid du blta bar bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yang rgyu gang gis gcig nyid dam mang po nyid du blta bar bya ba de bstan par bya ste /
translated: then it must be shown what causes one to be seen as one and many.

original: de la re zhig gcig nyid du blta bar bya ba ni de dag gcig nyid ni mnyam pa nyid yin la sangs rgyas kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir de ni gcig nyid yin te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gcig nyid du blta bar bya ba ni de dag gcig nyid ni mnyam pa nyid yin la sangs rgyas kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pas de'i phyir de ni gcig nyid yin te /
translated: First, they are to be seen as one, because their sameness is their oneness, and the Buddha is their nature.

original: chos kyi dbyings gcig pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //🔽yang gcig nyid du blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings gcig pa nyid du blta bar bya'o // yang gcig nyid du blta bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, they are to be seen as one, as the sameness of the Dharma realm.

original: gang dus gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas gnyis 'byung @188a * //
analyzed: gang dus gcig la 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas gnyis 'byung @188a * //
translated: Again, they are to be seen as one, because it is impossible for two Buddhas to appear in one world at one time.

original: ba ni mi srid pas de'i phyir yang gcig nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ba ni mi srid pas de'i phyir yang gcig nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, they are to be seen as one.

original: yang mang po nyid dang gcig nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni /🔽khams gcig na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ste /
analyzed: yang mang po nyid dang gcig nyid tshigs su bcad pas bstan pa ni / khams gcig na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ste /
translated: The verse teaches their multiplicity and oneness:

original: khams gcig na ni gnyis med phyir //
analyzed: khams gcig na ni gnyis med phyir //
translated: In one realm, two do not appear.

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni gcig pa nyid du bstan pa'i don te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ni gcig pa nyid du bstan pa'i don te /
translated: The phrase “in one realm, two do not appear” teaches the meaning of oneness.

original: gang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas gnyis 'byung ba ni mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gang 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu sangs rgyas gnyis 'byung ba ni mi srid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is impossible for two Buddhas to appear in a single world system.

original: lhag mas ni mang po nyid du bstan te /🔽dpag med cig car tshogs bsags phyir //
analyzed: lhag mas ni mang po nyid du bstan te / dpag med cig car tshogs bsags phyir //
translated: The rest of the verse shows that many Buddhas appear.🔽Because many simultaneously complete the collections.

original: zhes bya ba ni gang dus gcig tu byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnams tshogs yongs su bsags par 'gyur la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gang dus gcig tu byang chub sems dpa' mang po rnams tshogs yongs su bsags par 'gyur la /
translated: When many Bodhisattvas simultaneously complete the collections,

original: gal te de dag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur na tshogs bsags pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de dag gis bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags kyang sangs rgyas nyid thob par mi 'gyur na tshogs bsags pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: if they were to complete the collections of merit and wisdom and still not attain Buddhahood, then completing the collections would be pointless.

original: de'i phyir na mang po rnams kyis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'grub pas sangs rgyas mang po nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir na mang po rnams kyis tshogs yongs su rdzogs par 'grub pas sangs rgyas mang po nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, because many complete the collections and attain Buddhahood, many Buddhas appear.

original: rim gyis 'byung bar mi rigs phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni rim gyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par yang mi 'grub ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'byung bar mi rigs phyir //🔽zhes bya ba ni rim gyis mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par yang mi 'grub ste /
translated: Because it is illogical for them to appear sequentially.🔽It is also illogical for them to appear sequentially, one after another.

original: gal te gang gi phyir tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa rnams rim gyis gzhes par gyur na /🔽de dag nyid kyi rjes su rim gyis thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te gang gi phyir tshogs yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa rnams rim gyis gzhes par gyur na / de dag nyid kyi rjes su rim gyis thob par 'gyur te /
translated: If the assemblies of bodhisattvas were to attain enlightenment in sequence,

original: gzhan dag kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ste /🔽de dag mang ba nyid kyi phyir rim gyis rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par 'gyur ba yin no zhes bya ba ste / de dag mang ba nyid kyi phyir rim gyis rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: then others would attain enlightenment in sequence after them.

original: gzhan dag kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: But that is not logical, because many would attain enlightenment simultaneously.

original: de'i phyir na yang ;
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang ;
translated: Therefore,

original: sangs rgyas nyid mang po yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid mang po yin no //
translated: there are many buddhas.

original: yang kha cig ni sangs rgyas rnams la gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med do zhes zer la /
analyzed: yang kha cig ni sangs rgyas rnams la gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba med do zhes zer la /
translated: Some say that buddhas do not attain nirvana forever,

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i sde pa gzhan dag ni gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhes zer te /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa pa'i sde pa gzhan dag ni gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba yin no zhes zer te /
translated: but other schools of the śrāvaka vehicle say that they do attain nirvana forever.

original: 'di ltar de dag gnyi ga'i dgongs pa tshigs su bcad pas ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag gnyi ga'i dgongs pa tshigs su bcad pas ston pa ni /
translated: The intention of both of these is expressed in the following verse.

original: sgrib pa kun las nges grol phyir //
analyzed: sgrib pa kun las nges grol phyir //
translated: Because of being definitely liberated from all obscurations.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher 'byung ste /
translated: Thus it is extensively stated.

original: de la gang gi phyir sangs rgyas ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir des na gtan du mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba @188b yin te /
analyzed: de la gang gi phyir sangs rgyas ni nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba yin pa'i phyir des na gtan du mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ba @188b yin te /
translated: In that regard, because the Buddha is completely liberated from all afflictive and knowledge obscurations, he is one who attains parinirvana forever.

original: dgongs pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the intention.

original: yang gang gi phyir mdzad pa rnams kyang yongs su ma rdzogs pa ste ma smin pa rnams smin par bya ba dang / smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba dgongs pa'i phyir de'i mdzad pa de la dgongs nas gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin na //
analyzed: yang gang gi phyir mdzad pa rnams kyang yongs su ma rdzogs pa ste ma smin pa rnams smin par bya ba dang / smin pa rnams rnam par grol bar bya ba dgongs pa'i phyir de'i mdzad pa de la dgongs nas gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin na //
translated: Moreover, because his deeds are not yet complete, he does not attain parinirvana forever, intending to ripen those not yet ripened and liberate those already ripened.

original: de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin te /
translated: If it were not so,

original: nyan thos bzhin du gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin na smon lam btab pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos bzhin du gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ma yin na smon lam btab pa 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: if he did not attain parinirvana forever like the sravakas, his aspirations would be fruitless.

original: da ni gang las dgongs nas ngo bo nyid kyi sku longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: da ni gang las dgongs nas ngo bo nyid kyi sku longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ma yin zhe na /
translated: Now, with what intention is the essential body not the beatific body?

original: de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: de bstan par bya ste /
translated: That should be explained.

original: de gzugs kyi skur snang ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de gzugs kyi skur snang ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: It is said, “It appears as the form body.”

original: sangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni chos kyi sku yin la /
translated: The Buddha is the body of truth.

original: de ni gzugs su mthong ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ni gzugs su mthong ba'i phyir /
translated: Since he is seen as form,

original: chos kyi sku ma yin te /🔽de lta bu ni chos kyi sku ma yin pas /
analyzed: chos kyi sku ma yin te / de lta bu ni chos kyi sku ma yin pas /
translated: he is not the body of truth.🔽Since he is not like that,

original: de'i phyir na chos kyi sku ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na chos kyi sku ma yin no //
translated: he is not the body of truth.

original: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil gyi dkyil 'khor tshad med pa dag na tha dad par snang la /
analyzed: longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku de ni sangs rgyas kyi 'khor gyi dkyil gyi dkyil 'khor tshad med pa dag na tha dad par snang la /
translated: That beatific body appears separately in the immeasurable circles of the Buddha’s retinue,

original: chos kyi sku la ni tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: chos kyi sku la ni tha dad pa med do //
translated: but in the body of truth there is no separation.

original: de'i phyir tshul 'dis kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir tshul 'dis kyang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, by this method also, the beatific body is not the essential body.

original: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa mthong bas kyang /
analyzed: mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa mthong bas kyang /
translated: Also, because the beatific body is seen according to one’s aspiration,

original: ji ltar mdo las /
analyzed: ji ltar mdo las /
translated: as it says in the sutra,

original: kha cig ni kha dog ser po /
analyzed: kha cig ni kha dog ser po /
translated: “Some see him as yellow,

original: kha cig ni kha dog sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig ni kha dog sngon po zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say: Because it is extensive, beginning with “blue color” and so on.

original: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni ma nges pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku ni ma nges pa'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the enjoyment body appears with an indeterminate nature,

original: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni ma nges pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi rigs te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyi sku ni ma nges pa'i ngo bo nyid du mi rigs te /
translated: but it is illogical that the nature body has an indeterminate nature.

original: de'i phyir na yang ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is also not the nature body.

original: yang longs spyod rdzogs pa de ni gcig nyid yin na yang gzhan dang gzhan du mthong bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: yang longs spyod rdzogs pa de ni gcig nyid yin na yang gzhan dang gzhan du mthong bar 'gyur la /
translated: Moreover, even though that enjoyment body is singular, it is seen as different.

original: yang de nyid kho na de las kyang gzhan du mthong bar 'gyur bas de ni g-yo ba'i ngo ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: yang de nyid kho na de las kyang gzhan du mthong bar 'gyur bas de ni g-yo ba'i ngo ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid kyi sku yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is seen as different from that very body, so it is illogical that it is the nature body because it has a nature that moves.

original: de'i phyir na yang ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is also not the nature body.

original: yang long spyod rdzogs pa de ni lha la sogs pa'i 'khor dang rtag tu 'dres shing bskor nas gnas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: yang long spyod rdzogs pa de ni lha la sogs pa'i 'khor dang rtag tu 'dres shing bskor nas gnas pa yin gyi /
translated: Moreover, that enjoyment body always abides in the retinue of gods and so on, surrounded by them.

original: ngo bo nyid ni 'dres par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni 'dres par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The nature does not mix,

original: de'i phyir na yang ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
translated: and therefore the enjoyment body is not the nature body.

original: gang yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid yin la /
analyzed: gang yang kun gzhi rnam par shes pa yongs su gyur pa ni ngo bo nyid yin la /
translated: Also, the transformation of the container consciousness is the nature.

original: gal te de dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid yin na de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa yang yin pas 'jug pa rnams par shes pa yongs su gyur pa las sku gang mngon @189a * //🔽par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te de dag ngo bo nyid gcig pa nyid yin na de ni longs spyod rdzogs pa yang yin pas 'jug pa rnams par shes pa yongs su gyur pa las sku gang mngon @189a * // par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If those two were the same nature, then since that is the enjoyment body, what body would be produced from the transformation of the active consciousness?

original: de'i phyir na yang longs spyod rdzogs pa ni ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang longs spyod rdzogs pa ni ngo bo nyid ma yin te /
translated: Therefore the enjoyment body is not the nature body.

original: rnam pa drug po de dag mi rigs pa'i phyir na yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: rnam pa drug po de dag mi rigs pa'i phyir na yang mi rung ngo //
translated: And because those six aspects are not reasonable, it is also unreasonable.

original: da ni gang gi phyir sprul pa'i sku ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin pa'i tshul de bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gang gi phyir sprul pa'i sku ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin pa'i tshul de bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate how the emanation body is not the nature body,

original: rgyu brgyad kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu brgyad kyi phyir ro //
translated: it is said that it is not because of eight reasons.

original: de la re zhig mi rigs pa dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' yun ring po nas bskal pa du mar yang mi mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams ni dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi nang du yang skye bar mi rigs na mi rnams kyi nang
analyzed: de la re zhig mi rigs pa dang po ni byang chub sems dpa' yun ring po nas bskal pa du mar yang mi mnyam pa'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa rnams ni dga' ldan gyi lha rnams kyi nang du yang skye bar mi rigs na mi rnams kyi nang
translated: The first absurdity is that the Bodhisattva, having attained the unequalled concentration for many eons, would not be born among the Tuṣita gods,

original: du lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: du lta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: let alone among humans.

original: sprul pa de ni yang 'jig rten pa yang yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa de ni yang 'jig rten pa yang yin no //
translated: And that emanation would be worldly.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' skye pa dran pa rnams ni yi ge dang / rtsis dang / grangs la sogs pa mi mkhyen pa ni mi rigs te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' skye pa dran pa rnams ni yi ge dang / rtsis dang / grangs la sogs pa mi mkhyen pa ni mi rigs te /
translated: Moreover, it is not possible that the Bodhisattva, who remembers his births, would not know letters, calculation, and enumeration, etc.

original: de'i phyir na yang sprul pa nyid sems can de rnams gdul ba'i don du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir na yang sprul pa nyid sems can de rnams gdul ba'i don du byung ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, that emanation also appears for the sake of training those beings.

original: yang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du byang chub sems dpa' bsgrubs par gyur kyang nyes par bshad pa dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos de dag rnams par ma mkhyen na yang /
analyzed: yang bskal pa grangs med pa gsum du byang chub sems dpa' bsgrubs par gyur kyang nyes par bshad pa dang / legs par bshad pa'i chos de dag rnams par ma mkhyen na yang /
translated: Moreover, even though the Bodhisattva has practiced for three incalculable eons, if he does not know the Dharma that is wrongly taught and the Dharma that is well taught,

original: de las gzhan pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus na mkhyen par 'gyur bas de'i phyir na yang sprul pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus na mkhyen par 'gyur bas de'i phyir na yang sprul pa ni ngo bo nyid kyi sku ma yin no //
translated: But since the Buddha knows them at the time of perfect enlightenment, the emanation body is not the essential body.

original: yang 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya bor te /
analyzed: yang 'dzam bu'i gling bye ba phrag brgya bor te /
translated: Moreover, it is not reasonable that the Buddha would abandon a billion Jambudvīpas

original: gcig tu mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi rigs pas /
analyzed: gcig tu mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / chos kyi 'khor lo bskor bar mi rigs pas /
translated: and be perfectly enlightened and turn the wheel of the Dharma in one place.

original: sprul pa yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: sprul pa yin par mi rigs te /
translated: Therefore it is not reasonable that he is an emanation.

original: gang gi phyir de dag thams cad kyis sprul pa mthong bar mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag thams cad kyis sprul pa mthong bar mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of them see the same emanation.

original: gal te gcig tu mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas gzhan dag tu sprul pa rnams 'byung bar mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs len par byed pa yin na yang /🔽de lta na dga' ldan nyid na gnas bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu mngon par rdzogs par byang chub nas gzhan dag tu sprul pa rnams 'byung bar mdzad pa yin no zhes bya ba'i phyogs len par byed pa yin na yang / de lta na dga' ldan nyid na gnas bzhin du /
translated: If you accept the position that the Buddha is perfectly enlightened in one place and emanations appear in other places,🔽then why not accept that he emanates from the Tuṣita realm

original: gling bzhi pa thams cad du sprul pa 'gyed par ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa thams cad du sprul pa 'gyed par ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: and appears in all four continents?

original: yang la la 'di skad du /
analyzed: yang la la 'di skad du /
translated: Some say:

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa'i gling bzhi pa la la nas sangs rgyas ma mthong ngo zhes zer na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gtogs pa'i gling bzhi pa la la nas sangs rgyas ma mthong ngo zhes zer na /
translated: If someone says that a buddha is not seen in some of the four continents that belong to a buddhafield,

original: gling bzhi pa thams cad na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med pa la ni yang lung dang rigs pa med do //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa thams cad na mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa med pa la ni yang lung dang rigs pa med do //
translated: then there is no scripture or reasoning to prove that there is no perfect buddha in all four continents.

original: gal te de lta yin na mdo dang 'gal te /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na mdo dang 'gal te /
translated: If that is so, then it contradicts a sutra,

original: mdo las kyang /
analyzed: mdo las kyang /
translated: for a sutra declares:

original: sangs rgyas gnyis 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnyis 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: Two buddhas do not arise in the same world system.

original: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gnyis mi 'byung @189b pa yin no //🔽zhes gsungs pas so //
analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gnyis mi 'byung @189b pa yin no // zhes gsungs pas so //
translated: Two cakravartin kings do not arise in the same world system.

original: zhes na / gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gnyis mi 'byung ngo zhes 'byung zhes 'byung ba de ni /
analyzed: zhes na / gang gi phyir 'di ltar 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po gnyis mi 'byung ngo zhes 'byung zhes 'byung ba de ni /
translated: If you say that this is so, then why does it say that two cakravartin kings do not arise in the same world system?

original: gling bzhi pa gcig tu mi 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gling bzhi pa gcig tu mi 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: It does not say that two do not arise in one four continent world system.

original: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mi ma yin no //
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mi ma yin no //
translated: It says that two do not arise in one buddhafield.

original: de bzhin du sangs rgyas gnyis mi 'byung ba yang gling bzhi pa gcig tu mi rigs kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du sangs rgyas gnyis mi 'byung ba yang gling bzhi pa gcig tu mi rigs kyi /
translated: Similarly, it is illogical that two buddhas do not arise in one four continent world system.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu ni 'dod do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gyi khams gcig tu ni 'dod do //
translated: Thus, it is said that there is only one world system.

original: da ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa tshigs su bcad pas bstan par bya ba ni /
analyzed: da ni mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa tshigs su bcad pas bstan par bya ba ni /
translated: Now, the full enlightenment is taught in a verse:

original: sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnam 'phrul zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par 'byung ba ste /
translated: The Buddha’s emanations, etc.

original: don ni dus gang gi tshe dga' ldan na bzhugs pa las /
analyzed: don ni dus gang gi tshe dga' ldan na bzhugs pa las /
translated: The meaning is this: At whatever time the Buddha was dwelling in Tuṣita Heaven,

original: sangs rgyas mngal du gshegs pa de bzhin du dus de nyid kyi tshe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas mngal du gshegs pa de bzhin du dus de nyid kyi tshe na /
translated: at that very time, just as the Buddha entered the womb,

original: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa 'khor 'di dag kyang de bzhin du sprul pa'i gnas skabs kyis de dang der bzhugs par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa 'khor 'di dag kyang de bzhin du sprul pa'i gnas skabs kyis de dang der bzhugs par blta bar bya'o //
translated: at that very time, these retinues, the Elder Śāriputra and so forth, should be seen as dwelling there in that way through the state of emanation.

original: de dag rnam par gzhag pas kyang de ltar byas na rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rnam par gzhag pas kyang de ltar byas na rnam pa thams cad mngon par rdzogs par byang chub par bstan par bya'o //
translated: And by their arrangement, it should be taught that way, as the full enlightenment of all aspects.

original: da ni gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi rigs par bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gtan du yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba mi rigs par bstan par bya ste /
translated: Now, the non-reasonableness of the final parinirvāṇa should be taught.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don du smon lam btab par byas pa dang / sems can gyi don du sgrub pa nyid byas pa ji ltar sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba lta bur byas pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don du smon lam btab par byas pa dang / sems can gyi don du sgrub pa nyid byas pa ji ltar sems can gyi don bya'o zhes bya ba lta bur byas pa'o //
translated: and they make prayers for the sake of all sentient beings, and they do practice for the sake of sentient beings, thinking, “How can I benefit sentient beings?”

original: gal te gtan du mya ngan las 'da' bas mya ngan las 'das pa yin na gang smon lam btab pa dang / sgrub pa dag 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gtan du mya ngan las 'da' bas mya ngan las 'das pa yin na gang smon lam btab pa dang / sgrub pa dag 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If nirvana were a permanent transcendence of sorrow, then prayers and practice would be pointless.

original: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rtag pa'i sku yin no zhes bya ba de longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dag mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i rtag pa'i sku yin no zhes bya ba de longs spyod rdzogs pa dang / sprul pa dag mi rtag pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: And if the Buddha’s body is permanent, then the enjoyment body and the emanation body would not be permanent.

original: ji ltar rtag pa'i sku yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtag pa'i sku yin zhe na /
translated: How could the Buddha’s body be permanent?

original: de bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: This should be proven.

original: de dag nyid rtag pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid rtag pa nyid yin te /
translated: They are permanent,

original: gang gi phyir rtag pa'i sku chos kyi sku la brten pa'i phyir des na rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtag pa'i sku chos kyi sku la brten pa'i phyir des na rtag pa yin no //
translated: because the permanent body is based on the Dharma body. Therefore it is permanent.

original: yang longs spyod rdzogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i longs spyod de la rgyun chad pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: yang longs spyod rdzogs pa ni rdzogs pa'i longs spyod de la rgyun chad pa med pa'i phyir rtag pa yin no //
translated: The enjoyment body is permanent because its enjoyment is uninterrupted.

original: sprul pa yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa'i rgyun chad pa med pas rtag pa yin no //
analyzed: sprul pa yang mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba ston pa'i rgyun chad pa med pas rtag pa yin no //
translated: The emanation body is permanent because its manifestation of perfect enlightenment and final nirvāṇa is uninterrupted.

original: de dag gnyi ga yang rtag pa nyid yin @190a * //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga yang rtag pa nyid yin @190a * //
translated: Both of these bodies are permanent.

original: pa'i dpe bstan pa ni /
analyzed: pa'i dpe bstan pa ni /
translated: The example of their permanence is taught.

original: ji ltar na 'jig rten na rtag tu bde ba la spyod do zhes brjod pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji ltar na 'jig rten na rtag tu bde ba la spyod do zhes brjod pa lta bu ste /
translated: Just as it is said in the world that one always experiences pleasure,

original: de ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni rtag tu rgyun mi 'chad par byed par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: but that does not mean that one is always experiencing pleasure without interruption.

original: 'on kyang rtag tu bde ba la spyod do zhes ni rjod par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtag tu bde ba la spyod do zhes ni rjod par byed do //
translated: Nevertheless, it is said that one always experiences pleasure.

original: yang gang dag 'di ni rtag tu slong mo sbyin pa yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: yang gang dag 'di ni rtag tu slong mo sbyin pa yin no zhes zer na /
translated: Again, some say that this is always the giving of alms.

original: yang de ni rtag tu sbyin pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: yang de ni rtag tu sbyin pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that is not always giving.

original: res 'ga' zhig sbyin par byed pa yin na yang /
analyzed: res 'ga' zhig sbyin par byed pa yin na yang /
translated: Even though one gives sometimes,

original: 'on kyang rtag tu slad mo sbyin pa po yin no zhes rjod par byed pa ltar rtag pa de dag kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rtag tu slad mo sbyin pa po yin no zhes rjod par byed pa ltar rtag pa de dag kyang de bzhin no //
translated: But they are always called donors, and so it is with those who are permanent.

original: 'dir rgol bar byed do /
analyzed: 'dir rgol bar byed do /
translated: Here someone objects:

original: yang gal te sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku thog ma med pa'i dus nas bye brag med pa dpag tu med pa de dag nyid sems can gyi don bya ba la nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang gal te sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos kyi sku thog ma med pa'i dus nas bye brag med pa dpag tu med pa de dag nyid sems can gyi don bya ba la nus pa yod pa'i phyir /
translated: If the Dharma Body of the Buddhas is beginningless, undifferentiated, and immeasurable, and if it is the cause of the benefit and happiness of all beings,

original: yang ci'i phyir sems can gyi don du 'bad par byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir sems can gyi don du 'bad par byed ce na /
translated: why do the Buddhas strive to benefit beings?

original: lan tshigs su bcas pas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: lan tshigs su bcas pas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The reply is given in verse:

original: gal te sangs rgyas brnyes pa khyad par med dpag med pa //🔽zhes bya ba'i rgyu 'di nyid kyis 'bad par mi bya'o zhes zer na /
analyzed: gal te sangs rgyas brnyes pa khyad par med dpag med pa // zhes bya ba'i rgyu 'di nyid kyis 'bad par mi bya'o zhes zer na /
translated: If the attainment of Buddhahood is undifferentiated and immeasurable,🔽why do the Buddhas strive to benefit beings?

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir /🔽skyon thams cad 'byung bar thar bar 'gyur ba thob pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas rnams thog ma med pa'i dus can yin pa'i phyir / skyon thams cad 'byung bar thar bar 'gyur ba thob pa'am /
translated: Because the Buddhas are beginningless,🔽all faults would arise, or there would be no attainment of liberation,

original: thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: thams cad rgyu med pa nyid du 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or everything would be causeless.

original: rgyu rgyun chad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu rgyun chad pa med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The continuum of causes would be interrupted.

original: gzhan yang snying rjes rgyud bsgos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du brtse ba 'byung bas /
analyzed: gzhan yang snying rjes rgyud bsgos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams sems can thams cad la bu gcig pa bzhin du brtse ba 'byung bas /
translated: Moreover, since the bodhisattvas, whose mindstreams are saturated with compassion, feel love for all sentient beings as if they were their only child,🔽it is not right to think, “I will not do it because others will do it for the sake of sentient beings”

original: sems can gyi don la gzhan byed par 'gyur gyi zhe'am /🔽gzhan byed kyang rung /🔽mi byed kyang rung /
analyzed: sems can gyi don la gzhan byed par 'gyur gyi zhe'am / gzhan byed kyang rung / mi byed kyang rung /
translated: or “I will do it because others will not do it.”

original: bdag gis ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: bdag gis ni mi bya'o zhes bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: It is not right to think, “I will not do it because others will do it” or “I will do it because others will not do it.”

original: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa /🔽theg pa chen po la rab tu gnas pa /
analyzed: theg pa chen po bsdus pa'i 'grel pa / theg pa chen po la rab tu gnas pa /
translated: The Commentary on the Compendium of the Mahāyāna🔽is composed by the master Vasubandhu, who is well established in the Mahāyāna

original: bstan bcos phun du byung ba du byung ma mdzad pa'i slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bstan bcos phun du byung ba du byung ma mdzad pa'i slob dpon dbyig gnyen gyis mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: and has mastered the treatises. It is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po d'am pam ka ra shr'i dzny'a na dang / lo tstsha ba dge slong tshul khrims rgyal bas /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po d'am pam ka ra shr'i dzny'a na dang / lo tstsha ba dge slong tshul khrims rgyal bas /
translated: The Indian preceptor Dāṇḍapātika Śrījñāna and the translator-monk Tshul khrims rgyal ba

original: yul brag dmar lha sdings /
analyzed: yul brag dmar lha sdings /
translated: translated it in the land of Dmar red rocks lha sding,

original: ri khas po ri'i rtsa /
analyzed: ri khas po ri'i rtsa /
translated: at the peak of Kha spo ri mountain,

original: chu bo lo hi ta'i 'gram /
analyzed: chu bo lo hi ta'i 'gram /
translated: on the banks of the Lohit River.

original: dpal bsam yas lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas /
analyzed: dpal bsam yas lhun gyis grub pa'i gnas /
translated: The glorious site of Samye, spontaneously present,

original: dbyig 'dul pe kar gling du bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
analyzed: dbyig 'dul pe kar gling du bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa'o //
translated: was translated, revised, and finalized at the temple of Pe kar Ling, the subduer of wealth.

original: 'di la sh'o ka nyis stong tshig brgya brgyad cu yod de /
analyzed: 'di la sh'o ka nyis stong tshig brgya brgyad cu yod de /
translated: This has 2,000 ślokas, 800 lines.

original: bam po ni brgyad du byas so /
analyzed: bam po ni brgyad du byas so /
translated: It is divided into eight chapters.
